text: المقنع تأليف الشيخ الأقدم أبي جعفر الصدوق محمد بن علي بن الحسين بن بابويه القمي المتوفي سنة 381 ه‍ حقوق الطبع محفوظة و مسجد لمؤسسة الإمام الهادي - عليه السلام -
translation:
Al-Muqni'ah authored by the venerable Sheikh Abu Ja'far Al-Saduq Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Al-Husayn ibn Babawayh Al-Qummi, who passed away in the year 381 AH. All rights reserved for Masjid Imam Al-Hadi - peace be upon him -

(Introduction 1)

text:
هوية الكتاب اسم الكتاب: المقنع الموضوع: الفقه المؤلف: الشيخ الصدوق محمد بن علي بن بابويه التحقيق: لجنة التحقيق التابعة لمؤسسة الإمام الهادي - عليه السلام -.
الناشر: مؤسسة الإمام الهادي - عليه السلام - المطبعة: اعتماد التاريخ: 1415 ه‍ الصف والإخراج باللاينوترون: مؤسسة الإمام الصادق - عليه السلام - - قم مؤسسة الإمام الهادي - عليه السلام - قم - شارع بهار - زقاق آية الله النجفي - رقم 48
translation:
Book Identity

Title: Al-Muqni'

Subject: Jurisprudence

Author: Sheikh Saduq Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Babawayh

Edited by: The Investigation Committee of Imam al-Hadi Foundation - Peace be upon him.

Publisher: Imam al-Hadi Foundation - Peace be upon him

Printer: Itimad

Date: 1415 AH

Typesetting and Layout by Linotron: Imam al-Sadiq Foundation - Peace be upon him - Qom Imam al-Hadi Foundation - Peace be upon him - Qom - Bahar Street - Ayatollah Najafi Alley - No. 48

(Introduction 2)

text:
بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم تمهيد:
الحمد لله رب العالمين، والصلاة والسلام على أشرف المرسلين محمد وعلى أهل بيته الطاهرين.
شكرا لك يارب أن هديتنا إلى الدين المبين، وجعلتنا من المتمسكين بالثقلين، ومن المساهمين في إحياء تراث الأئمة الهداة المهديين.
أما بعد: فكتاب المقنع يعد من الكتب الفقهية الأصيلة، ومن أهم المصادر للفقهاء منذ جميع العصور، وذلك لأن عباراته كلها ألفاظ للأحاديث المسندة، بيد أن المصنف حذف أسنادها روما للاختصار، وثقة بوجودها في أمهات الأصول وكتب الأحاديث.
وهو في الواقع رسالة فتوائية للشيخ الصدوق، دون ألفاظه من متون الأحاديث.
ومن هنا قال - رحمه الله -: إني صنفت كتابي هذا وسميته كتاب المقنع، لقنوع من يقرأه بما فيه، وحذفت الأسانيد منه لئلا يثقل حمله ولا يصعب حفظه ولا يمل قارئه، إذ كان ما أبينه فيه في الكتب الأصولية موجودا مبينا على المشائخ العلماء الفقهاء الثقات رحمهم الله.
translation:
In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

Introduction:
Praise be to God, Lord of all worlds, and prayers and peace be upon the most honorable of messengers, Muhammad, and his pure family. Thank You, Lord, for guiding us to the clear religion and for making us among those who adhere to the two significant weights and contribute to reviving the heritage of the guiding and rightly guided Imams.

As for what follows, the book "Al-Muqni'" is considered one of the original legal texts and among the most important sources for jurists throughout all ages. This is because its expressions are entirely composed of the phrases of authenticated narrations. However, the compiler omitted their chains of transmission aiming for brevity, relying on their existence in the primary sources and books of hadith.

In reality, it is a jurisprudential treatise by Sheikh Al-Saduq, compiled from the texts of the narrations. Therefore, he said - may God have mercy on him: "I compiled this book of mine and named it 'Al-Muqni'' so that the one who reads it finds contentment with what it contains. I omitted the chains of transmission so it would not be cumbersome to carry, difficult to memorize, nor would it tire its reader, as what I illustrate in it is already explained in the foundational books based on the teachings of the trusted scholars, jurists, and righteous, may God have mercy on them."

(Introduction 3)

text:
وذكر المحدث النوري بعد بيان كلام الصدوق - قدس سره -: بأن هذه العبارة كما ترى متضمنة لمطالب:
الأول: أن ما في الكتاب خبر كله إلا ما يشير إليه.
الثاني: أن ما فيه من الأخبار مسند كله، وعدم ذكر السند فيه للاختصار، لا لكونها من المراسيل.
الثالث: أن ما فيه من الأخبار مأخوذ من أصول الأصحاب، التي هي مرجعهم، وعليها معولهم، وإليها مستندهم، وفيها مباني فتاويهم.
الرابع: أن أرباب تلك الأصول ورجال طرقه إليها من ثقات العلماء، وبذلك فاق قدره عن كتاب الفقيه.
وأضاف - قدس سره -: والحق أن ما فيه عين متون الأخبار الصحيحة بالمعنى الأخص، الذي عليه المتأخرون (1).
وقال المجلسي في بحاره: ينزل أكثر أصحابنا كلامه - الصدوق - وكلام أبيه منزلة النص المنقول والخبر المأثور (2).
فلأهمية هذا الكتاب رأينا من الأفضل إخراج كتاب المقنع بحلة جديدة، بالتحقيق المشتمل على تصحيح متنه، وتخريج مصادره، والتعليق عليه في موارده الغامضة، لكي يرجع إليه العلماء بكل ثقة، ويطمئنوا بصحة متنه.
ولإنجاز هذا المشروع قامت مؤسسة الإمام الهادي - عليه السلام - في مبتدء نشاطها العلمي بتحقيق وإخراج هذا الكتاب الشريف بشكل رائق، رجاء أن تكون خطوة لإحياء تراث السلف الصالح، وخدمة للحوزات العلمية، تحريا لمرضاة الرب، وتقربا إلى الرسول - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - والأئمة - عليهم السلام -.

١ - مستدرك الوسائل، طبع حجري: ٣ / ٣٢٧.
٢ - بحار الأنوار: ١٠ / 405.
translation:
The scholar Al-Noori mentioned, following Al-Sadūq's comments—may his soul be sacred—that this phrase, as you can see, encompasses several points:

First: Everything in the book is a report except for what it specifically points out.

Second: All reports in it are sourced, and the omission of the chain of transmission is for conciseness, not because they are unsupported messages.

Third: The reports are derived from the foundational works of the scholars, which are their references and foundations for their jurisprudence.

Fourth: The scholars responsible for those foundational works and the chains leading to them are trusted scientists, thus elevating its status above that of the book "Al-Faqeeh."

He—may his soul be sacred—added, "And indeed, it contains the exact texts of authentic reports in the special sense agreed upon by later scholars."

Al-Majlisi, in his "Bihar al-Anwar," stated that most of our scholars consider Al-Sadūq's word and his father's word as equivalent to transmitted text and well-established tradition.

Due to the importance of this book, we deemed it preferable to republish "Al-Muqni" in a new form, involving the verification of its text, sourcing its references, and commenting on its obscure parts, so scholars can refer to it with confidence and assurance in the authenticity of its content.

To accomplish this project, the Imam Al-Hadi Foundation—peace be upon him—initiated its scholarly activities by verifying and releasing this noble book in an elegant form. This is hoped to be a step towards reviving the heritage of righteous predecessors and serving the religious seminaries, in pursuit of divine pleasure, and to draw closer to the Messenger—peace be upon him and his family—and the Imams—peace be upon them.

1 - Mustadrak al-Wasa’il, Stone Print: 3 / 327.
2 - Bihar al-Anwar: 10 / 405.
(Introduction 4)

text:
حياة المؤلف 1 - اسمه ونسبه:
هو الشيخ الأجل والأقدم، أبو جعفر محمد بن علي بن الحسين بن موسى ابن بابويه المشتهر بالصدوق.
والده: هو علي بن الحسين بن موسى بن بابويه القمي، أبو الحسن شيخ القميين في عصره، ومتقدمهم وفقيههم وثقتهم.
وأمه جارية ديلمية، كما سنذكر.
2 - ولادته ونشأته:
ولد المصنف - رحمه الله - بدعاء القائم - عليه السلام - بقم، بعد سنة 305 ه‍، وترعرع ونشأ بين يدي أبيه - العالم الكامل الفقيه الثقة - نحو عشرين سنة، فقرأ عليه وأخذ عنه.
روى الشيخ بإسناده، عن علي بن الحسن بن يوسف الصائغ القمي، ومحمد بن أحمد بن محمد الصيرفي - المعروف بابن الدلال - وغيرهما من مشايخ أهل قم: أن علي بن الحسين بن موسى بن بابويه كانت تحته بنت عمه، محمد بن موسى بن بابويه فلم يرزق منها ولدا، فكتب إلى الشيخ أبي القاسم الحسين بن روح - رضي الله عنه أن يسأل الحضرة أن يدعو الله، أن يرزقه أولادا فقهاء، فجاء الجواب: «إنك لا ترزق من هذه، وستملك جارية ديلمية، وترزق منها ولدين فقيهين» (1).

translation:
Life of the Author:

1. Name and Lineage:
He is the esteemed and senior Sheikh, Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Ali ibn al-Husayn ibn Musa ibn Babawayh, known as al-Saduq. His father is Ali ibn al-Husayn ibn Musa ibn Babawayh al-Qummi, Abu al-Hasan, the Sheikh of the people of Qom in his time, their leader, jurist, and trusted figure. His mother was a Daylamite woman, as we will mention.

2. His Birth and Upbringing:
The author, may God have mercy on him, was born in Qom after the year 305 AH, thanks to the prayers of al-Qa'im, peace be upon him. He grew up and was nurtured under the guidance of his father, a complete, trusted, and knowledgeable jurist, for about twenty years, studying and acquiring knowledge from him.

The Sheikh narrated, with his chain of transmission, from Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Yusuf al-Sayagh al-Qummi, Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Muhammad al-Sayrafi—known as Ibn al-Dallal—and other notable figures from Qom, that Ali ibn al-Husayn ibn Musa ibn Babawayh was married to the daughter of his cousin, Muhammad ibn Musa ibn Babawayh, but did not have children with her. He wrote to Sheikh Abu al-Qasim al-Husayn ibn Ruh, may God be pleased with him, asking him to beseech the holy presence to pray to God to grant him children who are jurists. The response came: “You will not have children from this woman. You will marry a Daylamite bondwoman, and you will be blessed with two scholarly sons from her.” 

References:
1. Kitab al-Ghaybah by Sheikh al-Tusi: 188 and 195, and see Rijal al-Najashi: 261, Kamal al-Din wa Tamam al-Ni'mah: 2 / 502, Hadith 31.
(Introduction 5)

text:
3 - الثناء عليه:
قال النجاشي: شيخنا وفقيهنا، ووجه الطائفة بخراسان. وكان ورد بغداد سنة خمس وخمسين وثلاثمائة، وسمع منه شيوخ الطائفة وهو حدث السن (1).
وفي رجال الطوسي: جليل القدر، حفظة، بصير بالفقه والأخبار والرجال، له مصنفات كثيرة (2).
وجاء في فهرسته: جليل القدر، يكنى أبا جعفر، كان جليلا حافظا للأحاديث، بصيرا بالرجال، ناقدا للأخبار، لم ير في القميين مثله في حفظه وكثرة علمه، له نحو من ثلاثمائة مصنف (3).
وقال ابن إدريس: كان ثقة جليل القدر، بصيرا بالأخبار، ناقدا للآثار، عالما بالرجال، حفظة (4).
وذكر العلامة في خلاصته: شيخنا وفقيهنا، ووجه الطائفة بخراسان (5).
وجاء في رجال ابن داود الحلي: جليل القدر، حفظة، بصير بالفقه والأخبار، شيخ الطائفة وفقيهها، ووجهها بخراسان، له مصنفات كثيرة لم ير في القميين مثله في الحفظ وفي كثرة علمه (6).
وفي روضة المتقين للمولى محمد تقي المجلسي: وثقه جميع الأصحاب، لما حكموا بصحة أخبار كتابه، بل هو ركن من أركان الدين، جزاه الله عن الإسلام والمسلمين أفضل الجزاء (7).
وقال المجلسي في بحاره: (بأنه - قدس سره‍) من عظماء القدماء، التابعين لآثار

3 - Praise for Him:
Al-Najashi said: "He is our Sheikh and jurist, and the face of the sect in Khurasan. He arrived in Baghdad in the year 355 AH, and the elders of the sect heard from him while he was still young in age."

In the work "Rijal al-Tusi," it is mentioned: "Esteemed in rank, a memorizer, perceptive in jurisprudence, traditions, and men. He authored many works."

In his "Fihrist," it states: "Highly esteemed, known by the nickname Abu Ja'far, he was great, a memorizer of hadiths, insightful regarding men, critical of traditions. None among the people of Qom matched him in memory and extensive knowledge. He had around three hundred publications."

Ibn Idris remarked: "He was trustworthy, highly esteemed, insightful in traditions, critical of legacies, knowledgeable about men, a memorizer."

Al-'Allamah mentioned in his "Khilasat al-Aqwal": "He is our Sheikh and jurist, and the face of the sect in Khurasan."

In "Rijal Ibn Dawood al-Hilli": "Highly esteemed, a memorizer, insightful in jurisprudence and traditions, the Sheikh of the sect and its jurist, and its face in Khurasan. He authored many works. None among the people of Qom matched him in memory and extensive knowledge."

In "Rawdat al-Muttaqin" by Mulla Muhammad Taqi al-Majlisi: "All the jurists vouched for him, as they deemed the reports of his book authentic. He is indeed a pillar of religion. May Allah reward him for Islam and Muslims with the best recompense."

Al-Majlisi stated in "Bihar al-Anwar": that he, may Allah sanctify his soul, is among the great ancients who followed the traditions of...

text:
الأئمة النجباء، الذين لا يتبعون الآراء والأهواء، ولذا ينزل أكثر أصحابنا كلامه وكلام أبيه منزلة النص المنقول، والخبر المأثور (1).
وذكر المامقاني: التأمل في وثاقة الرجل وعدالته وجلالته، كالتأمل في نور الشمس الضاحية (2).
4 - أساتذته ومشايخه:
تتلمذ شيخنا المترجم له، عند أساطين العلم، وكبار العلماء، ولا سيما والده المعظم - كما مر آنفا - ويبلغ عدد أساتذته وشيوخه أكثر من مأتين، وجاء في مستدرك الوسائل سرد أسمائهم، فراجع (3).
5 - تلامذته والراوون عنه:
تتلمذ عليه الكثير من علماء الطائفة وجهابذتهم، وروى عنه جماعة من فطاحل العلماء، إلا أنه لا يسعنا إستقصاءهم على التحقيق، وسرد أسماء جميعهم، بل نذكر نبذة يسيرة من الأعلام المشهورين:
1 - أخو المترجم له: الشيخ الفقيه، الحسين بن علي بن موسى بن بابويه القمي - رحمه الله -.
2 - ابن أخ المترجم له: الشيخ ثقة الدين، الحسن بن الحسين بن علي بن موسى القمي - رحمه الله -.
3 - والد الشيخ النجاشي: الشيخ الثقة، علي بن أحمد بن العباس - رحمه الله -.

translation:
The Noble Imams, who do not follow opinions or whims, are held in high regard by most of our peers, who treat his words and those of his father as equivalent to transmitted texts and established reports (1). Al-Mamaqani mentioned: Reflecting on the trustworthiness, integrity, and reverence of the man is akin to contemplating the light of the midday sun (2).

4 - His Teachers and Mentors:
Our esteemed Sheikh, the subject of this translation, studied under the giants of knowledge and prominent scholars, especially his great father, as previously mentioned. The number of his teachers and mentors exceeds two hundred, and their names are listed in the "Mustadrak al-Wasa'il," for further reference (3).

5 - His Students and Narrators:
Many scholars and eminent figures of the sect studied under him, and a group of outstanding scholars narrated from him. However, it is not feasible to list them all in detail or to enumerate all their names, so we will mention a brief selection of the well-known figures:

1 - The brother of the subject of this translation: Sheikh al-Faqih, Al-Hussain ibn Ali ibn Musa ibn Babwayh al-Qummi - may Allah have mercy on him.
2 - The nephew of the subject of this translation: Sheikh Thiqatu al-Din, Al-Hasan ibn Al-Hussain ibn Ali ibn Musa al-Qummi - may Allah have mercy on him.
3 - The father of Sheikh al-Najashi: Sheikh al-Thiqa, Ali ibn Ahmad ibn al-Abbas - may Allah have mercy on him.

1 - "Bihar al-Anwar": 10 / 405.
2 - "Tanquih al-Maqal": 3 / 154.
3 - "Mustadrak al-Wasa'il," Stone Print: 3 / 713.
(Introduction 7)

4 - صاحب كفاية الأثر: الشيخ الثقة، أبو القاسم علي بن محمد بن علي الخزاز - رحمه الله -.
5 - الشيخ الجليل: محمد بن محمد بن النعمان، المفيد - رحمه الله -.
6 - الشيخ الجليل: أبو عبد الله الحسين بن عبيد الله الغضائري - رحمه الله -.
7 - الشيخ الثقة: أبو محمد هارون بن موسى التلعكبري - رحمه الله -.
6 - رحلاته:
رحل المترجم له - رحمه الله - من قم إلى الري، ثم سافر إلى مدن متعددة، كنيسابور، ومشهد الرضا - عليه السلام -، وسمرقند، وبلخ، وأسترآباد، وهمدان، وجرجان، وبغداد، والكوفة، ومكة، والمدينة، وحينما كان يصل إلى بعض البلدان يجتمع عليه العلماء والفضلاء، للنيل من عذب علومه، وسجية أخلاقه، وسماع أحاديثه.
7 - آثاره العلمية:
وللمترجم له - رحمه الله - مؤلفات كثيرة، تقرب من ثلاثمائة كتاب، ذكر عدة منها النجاشي في رجاله، والشيخ في فهرسته.
ومن مؤلفاته القيمة الموجودة: «كتاب من لا يحضره الفقيه»، - وهو أحد الكتب الأربعة المعتمدة عند الشيعة -، و «علل الشرائع»، و «الخصال»، و «الأمالي»، و «عيون أخبار الرضا - عليه السلام -»، و «ثواب الأعمال»، و «التوحيد»، و «المقنع» الذي بين يديك.
وذكر العلامة المجلسي - قدس سره في بحاره: ضمن أسماء كتب الصدوق - رحمه الله: المقنع (1)، وأضاف القول في مكان آخر: بأن هذه الكتب لا تقصر في الاشتهار

translation:
4 - The Author of "Kifayat al-Athar": The trustworthy Sheikh, Abu al-Qasim Ali ibn Muhammad ibn Ali al-Khazzaz - may God have mercy on him.
5 - The Esteemed Sheikh: Muhammad ibn Muhammad ibn al-Nu‘man, Al-Mufid - may God have mercy on him.
6 - The Esteemed Sheikh: Abu Abdullah Al-Husayn ibn Ubaydullah Al-Ghada’iri - may God have mercy on him.
7 - The Trustworthy Sheikh: Abu Muhammad Harun ibn Musa al-Talaqani - may God have mercy on him.

6 - His Journeys:
The biographed individual - may God have mercy on him - traveled from Qom to Ray, and then journeyed to various cities such as Nishapur, Mashhad al-Rida - peace be upon him, Samarkand, Balkh, Astarabad, Hamadan, Gorgan, Baghdad, Kufa, Mecca, and Medina. In many of these cities, scholars and virtuous individuals would gather around him to benefit from his profound knowledge, noble character, and to listen to his narrations.

7 - His Scientific Works:
The biographed scholar - may God have mercy on him - authored many works, nearing three hundred books. Al-Najashi mentioned several of these in his "Rijal," and Sheikh in his "Fihrist." Among his valuable existing works are: "Man La Yahduruhu al-Faqih" - one of the four major books relied upon by the Shi'a -, "Ilal al-Shar'a," "Al-Khisas," "Al-Amali," "Uyoun Akhbar al-Rida - peace be upon him," "Thawab al-A'mal," "Al-Tawhid," and "Al-Muqni'," which is before you.

The revered scholar Al-Majlisi - may his soul be sanctified - mentioned in his "Bihar al-Anwar" under the names of al-Saduq's books - may God have mercy on him: Al-Muqni’ (1), and he added elsewhere that these books are widely recognized.

text:
عن الكتب الأربعة (1).
وله كتاب آخر اسمه: مدينة العلم، وهو يعد خامسا للكتب الأربعة، وكان موجودا ظاهرا إلى عصر الشيخ حسين بن عبد الصمد، والد شيخنا البهائي - قدس سرهما - بيد أنه فقد، ولم يبق له أثر، ما عدا المنقولات عنه في أبواب متعددة من كتب الفقه والحديث (2).
8 - وفاته ومدفنه:
توفي - رحمه الله - بالري سنة 381 ه‍، وقبره مزار معروف يقصده أرباب الحوائج، بقرب مرقد السيد عبد العظيم الحسني - رحمه الله -.
نسخ الكتاب:
1 - النسخة المحفوظة في المكتبة العامة للمرحوم آية الله العظمى المرعشي النجفي - قدس سره مع غنية ابن زهرة - رحمه الله - المرقمة 4511، وتأريخ كتابتها 1257 ه‍ بخط محمد بن الحسين بن علي أكبر الخونساري، ورمزنا لها بالحرف «أ».
2 - النسخة المحفوظة في المكتبة السابقة ضمن كتاب «الجوامع الفقهية» المرقمة 4332، وتأريخ كتابتها 1231 ه‍ بخط محمد تقي، ورمزنا لها بالحرف «ب».

translation:
On the Four Books (1).

He has another book called "The City of Knowledge," which is considered the fifth among the Four Books. It was visible and available until the era of Sheikh Hussein bin Abdul Samad, the father of our Sheikh Al-Baha'i—may their souls be sanctified. However, it was lost and left no trace except for what has been quoted from it in various sections of books on jurisprudence and hadith (2).

8 - His Death and Grave:

He passed away—may God have mercy on him—in Rayy in the year 381 AH. His grave is a well-known shrine visited by those in need, near the resting place of Sayyid Abdul Azim Al-Hasani—may God have mercy on him.

Copies of the Book:

1 - The copy preserved in the public library of the late Grand Ayatollah Al-Mar'ashi Al-Najafi—may his soul be sanctified—along with the work "Ghunya" by Ibn Zuhra—may God have mercy on him—Numbered 4511, the date of its writing is 1257 AH, written by Muhammad Ibn Al-Hussein Ibn Ali Akbar Al-Khunsari, to which we assigned the letter "A."

2 - The copy preserved in the aforementioned library within the book "Al-Jawaami' Al-Fiqhiyya" was numbered 4332, and the date of its writing is 1231 AH, written by Muhammad Taqi, to which we assigned the letter "B."

7 - النسخة المحفوظة في مكتبة المرحوم آية الله العظمى المرعشي النجفي - قدس سره المرقمة 2219 ضمن كتاب الجوامع الفقهية، وتأريخ كتابتها 1247 ه‍ بخط محمد علي، وقد كتب في الصفحة الأولى بالفارسية ما معناه: أن الكتاب قد قوبل من قبل المرحوم صاحب الرياض.
وقد اعتمدنا في تحقيق الكتاب على النسخ الأربع الأولى وعند الحاجة راجعنا النسخ الثلاث الأخيرة.

إن هدفنا الرئيسي في تحقيق الكتاب منصب على أمرين:
الأول: إثبات متن صحيح للكتاب.
الثاني: تخريج الكتاب من المصادر الأخرى المعتبرة.

3. The copy preserved in the Razavi Library in the sacred city of Mashhad, numbered 2620. It was endowed by Nader Shah in the year 1145 AH, and we have denoted it with the letter "J".

4. The copy preserved in the Goharshad Mosque Library in the sacred city of Mashhad, numbered 721, with its writing dated to 1244 AH. The name of its scribe is not mentioned, and it was endowed by Haj Sayyed Saeed Tabatabai—may his soul be sanctified in the year 1332 AH—and we have denoted it with the letter "D".

5. The copy preserved in the Library of the Islamic Consultative Assembly in Tehran, catalogued with the number 1272 and registration number 13192. Its writing was dated to the year 1241 AH, and it appears to be in the handwriting of Muhammad bin Khader. We have denoted it with the letter "M".

6. The copy preserved in the previous library, catalogued with the number 5852 and registration number 41599. Its writing was dated to 1234 AH in the handwriting of Ibn Muhammad Mehdi Ali Abadi Yazdi—Abdul Majid—and we have denoted it with the letter "Sh".

7. The copy preserved in the library of the late Grand Ayatollah Sayyid Marashi Najafi—may his soul be sanctified, numbered 2219 within the book of "Jami' Fiqh". Its writing was dated to 1247 AH by Muhammad Ali. On the first page, it is written in Persian meaning: the book has been verified by the late author of "al-Riyadh".

We have relied on the first four copies for the investigation of the book and referred to the last three copies when necessary.

Methodology of Investigation:
Our main objective in investigating the book focuses on two aspects:

First: Establishing an accurate text of the book.

Second: Referencing the book from other reliable sources.

text:
وفي نهجنا التحقيقي اتبعنا الخطوات التالية:
1 - مقابلة النسخ الخطية - أ، ب، ج، د - والكتب التي نقلت عن المقنع وهي: المختلف، والذكرى، ومسالك الأفهام (1)، والبحار، والوسائل، ومستدرك الوسائل.
2 - اتباع أسلوب التلفيق في تحقيقه.
3 - إثبات ما سقط من النسخ الخطية من الكتب الستة المذكورة في الرقم «1»، وحصره ما بين المعقوفين [] والإشارة إليه في الهامش، ولم نثبت في المتن إلا ما نقل عن المقنع بصورة مباشرة وكاملة.
وما ورد ما بين [] دون الإشارة إليه في الهامش فهو من عندنا لتنظيم أبواب الكتاب.
4 - التعليق على بعض العبارات المبهمة، بالاستفادة من أقوال فطاحل علمائنا كالشيخ الطوسي، والعلامة الحلي، والمجلسي - رحمهم الله -.
5 - الإشارة إلى موارد الاختلاف في أقوال المصنف، في الكتاب وسائر كتبه.
6 - الإشارة إلى ما خالف المشهور من الأحكام.
7 - الإشارة إلى الاختلافات اللفظية.
8 - شرح الألفاظ الصعبة نسبيا.
9 - ترجمة بعض الأعلام، وتوضيح الأماكن والبقاع.
10 - تخريج الآيات الكريمة.
11 - الإشارة إلى ما تقدم ويأتي في الكتاب.
وإتماما للفائدة أعددنا فهارس فنية للكتاب في آخره.

translation:
In our investigative approach, we followed the steps outlined below:

1. We compared the manuscript copies - A, B, C, D - and the books that referenced "Al-Muqni'": Al-Mukhtalaf, Al-Dhikrā, Masālik al-Afhām¹, Al-Biḥār, Al-Wasā'il, and Mustadrak al-Wasā'il.
2. We employed the method of synthesis in our verification process.
3. We documented what was missing from the manuscript copies based on the six aforementioned books in point "1", enclosing these within brackets [] and noting them in the margins. In the main text, we only included what was directly and completely sourced from "Al-Muqni'".
   Any content within [] without marginal notes is our own addition to organize the book's sections.
4. We commented on some ambiguous phrases using insights from the statements of our great scholars such as Shaykh al-Ṭūsi, al-ʿAllāmah al-Ḥilli, and al-Majlisi — may Allah have mercy upon them.
5. We highlighted instances of divergence in the author's views within this book and in his other works.
6. We noted any rulings that differed from prevalent opinions.
7. We pointed out verbal variances.
8. We explained relatively difficult terms.
9. We translated some figures and clarified places and locations.
10. We documented the sources of the noble verses.
11. We referred to related or upcoming content within the book.
To maximize the benefit, we prepared technical indices for the book at its end.

1. Al-Shahid al-Thani mentioned after narrating from "Al-Muqni'": "This is how Al-Saduq expressed it, and it exists in his noble handwriting with me." Masālik al-Afhām: 2 / 87, Kitāb al-Ẓihār, Al-Kaffarāt.

وختاما نتقدم بجزيل الشكر إلى السادة العلماء والمحققين الذين آزرونا في انجاز هذا المشروع، كما نشكر مسؤولي مكتبة آية الله العظمى المرعشي النجفي - قدس سره والمكتبة الرضوية ومكتبة جامع گوهرشاد ومكتبة مجلس الشورى الإسلامي في طهران، ومديرية مدرسة عترة آل محمد - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - ومدرسة الشهيدين (بهشتي وقدوسي) راجين من الله العلي القدير التوفيق والسداد والاخلاص في العمل.

translation:
Dedication

To the proof of God over His creation and His lamp on Earth, to the descendant of the righteous and the light of the virtuous saints, to the pillar to which people turn and by whom lands are enlivened, to Abu al-Hasan Ali ibn Muhammad al-Naqi al-Hadi - peace be upon him - we present this humble effort, hoping for his acceptance, to the verification committee.

(1)

text:
بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم (1) قال محمد بن علي بن الحسين بن موسى بن بابويه: إن أحق ما بدء الكتاب به حمد الله بجميع محامده، والثناء عليه بما هو أهله، ثم الصلاة على رسوله محمد المصطفى، وعلى آله الطاهرين.
الحمد لله الذي حجب الأبصار عن رؤيته، وتفرد بكبريائه، وعز في ذاته، وعلا في صفاته، الذي ليس (2) لأوله ابتداء، ولا لآخره انقضاء، الذي كان قبل كل شيء، ويكون بعد كل شيء، الذي قدرته عن العجز مرتفعة، وقوته من الضعف ممتنعة، الذي هو في سلطانه قوي، وفي ملكه عظيم، وهو سبحانه بر رحيم وبالمؤمنين من عباده رؤوف رحيم، الذي يعلم خائنة الأعين (3) وما تخفي الصدور الذي يعلم ما كان وما يكون وما لا يكون أن لو كان كيف كان يكون، الذي لا

translation:
In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. (1) Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Al-Husayn ibn Musa ibn Babawayh said: Indeed, the most appropriate way to begin any book is with praise to Allah in all His praises and to extol Him as is His due, followed by prayers upon His Messenger, Muhammad the chosen, and upon his pure family.

Praise be to Allah, who has veiled the eyes from seeing Him, who is unique in His majesty, exalted in His being, and elevated in His attributes. He, whose beginning has no inception, and whose end has no termination, who existed before everything and will remain after everything. His power is beyond any weakness, and His strength is impervious to frailty. He is mighty in His sovereignty, and great in His dominion. He, the Exalted, is benevolent and merciful, and with the believers among His servants, He is compassionate and kind. He knows the deceitful glance of the eyes (3) and what the hearts conceal, who knows what was, what is, and what shall be, and what would not have been had it been, how it would have been.

1 - With the addition "and in Him we trust" A, "and praise be to Allah and in Him we trust" B.
2 - "No" B, C.
3 - Meaning, He knows the stealthy glance towards that which is not lawful "Majma' al-Bahrain: 1/714 - Khoun".

text:
تدركه الأبصار وهو يدرك الأبصار، وهو اللطيف الخبير (1).
وأشهد أن لا إله إلا الله وحده لا شريك له، إلها واحدا أحدا فردا (2) صمدا، لم يتخذ صاحبة ولا ولدا، ولم يكن له شريك في الملك، ولم يكن له ولي من الذل وكبره تكبيرا.
وأشهد أن محمدا عبده ورسوله، أرسله بالهدى بشيرا، ومن النار نذيرا، وإلى الجنة هاديا ودليلا، فجاهد في الله حق جهاده، وعبده مخلصا حتى أتاه اليقين فصلوات الله عليه، وعلى آله الطاهرين.
وأشهد أن علي بن أبي طالب أمير المؤمنين، وإمام المتقين، ووصي رسول رب العالمين، وأشهد أن الأئمة الراشدين المهديين المعصومين المكرمين من ولده، اصطفاهم الله لدينه، واجتباهم لسره، وفضلهم على خلقه، وأعزهم بهداه، وخصهم ببرهانه، وانتجبهم لنوره، وأيدهم بروحه، ورضيهم خلفاء (3) في (4) أرضه، وحججا على بريته، وأنصارا لدينه، وحفظة لحكمته، وتراجمة لوحيه، وأركانا لتوحيده، وعصمهم (5) من الزلل، وطهرهم من الدنس، وأذهب عنهم الرجس وآمنهم من الخوف، فعظموا جلاله (6)، وكبروا شأنه، ومجدوا كرمه (7)، ووكدوا من ميثاقه، ودعوا إلى سبيله بالحكمة والموعظة الحسنة، وبذلوا أنفسهم في مرضاته وأقاموا الصلاة، وآتوا الزكاة، وأمروا بالمعروف، ونهوا عن المنكر، وجاهدوا في الله حق جهاده حتى أعلنوا دعوته، وبينوا فرائضه، وأقاموا حدوده، وشرعوا أحكامه، وسنوا سننه (8).
وأشهد أن الحق لهم ومعهم وفيهم ومنهم وإليهم، فهم أهله ومعدنه، وأن

translation:
Sight cannot perceive Him, but He perceives all sight, and He is the Subtle, the All-Aware.

I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, alone without any partner, a sole, unique deity, one who is self-sufficient, who neither takes a consort nor has a child. He has no partner in His sovereignty, nor does He have any ally arising from weakness, and He is exalted with great exaltation.

I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His Messenger, sent with guidance as a bearer of good news and a warner from fire, a guide to Paradise and a leader directing towards it. He strove in the cause of Allah with true striving, worshipping Him sincerely until certainty (death) came to him. May Allah's blessings be upon him and his purified family. 

I bear witness that Ali, the son of Abu Talib, is the Commander of the Faithful, the leader of the God-conscious, and the appointed guardian of the Messenger of the Lord of all worlds. I bear witness that the rightly guided, honored, and infallible Imams from his lineage were chosen by Allah for His religion, selected for His mystery, favored above all creation, honored by His guidance, distinguished with His proof, chosen for His light, supported by His spirit, and approved by Him as His caliphs on His earth, as proof over His creation, as supporters of His religion, protectors of His wisdom, interpreters of His revelation, and pillars of His oneness. He protected them from error, purified them from impurity, removed all defilement from them, and secured them from fear. They magnified His might, exalted His importance, glorified His generosity, and reaffirmed His covenant. They called to His path with wisdom and good instruction, sacrificed themselves to earn His pleasure, established prayer, gave alms, enjoined what is right, forbade what is wrong, and strove for Allah with true striving until they proclaimed His call, explained His obligations, set up His boundaries, legislated His rules, and established His traditions.

I bear witness that the truth is for them, with them, within them, from them, and towards them. They are its kin and origin.

text:
من والاهم فقد والى الله، ومن عاداهم فقد عادى الله، ومن جهلهم (1) خاب، ومن فارقهم ضل، ومن تمسك بهم فاز، ومن لجأ إليهم أمن (2)، ومن صدقهم سلم، أسأل الله أن يجعل على ذلك محياي ومماتي ونشري وبعثي وحشري ومنقلبي بتفضله ومنه وتوفيقه، إنه على كل شيء قدير.
قال محمد بن علي: ثم إني صنفت كتابي هذا، وسميته كتاب «المقنع» لقنوع من يقرأه بما فيه، وحذفت الأسانيد (3) منه لئلا يثقل حمله، ولا يصعب حفظه، ولا يمل (4) قارئه، إذ كان ما أبينه فيه في الكتب الأصولية موجودا مبينا عن المشائخ العلماء الفقهاء الثقاة رحمهم الله، أرجو بذلك ثواب الله، وأبتغي به مرضاته، وأطلب الأجر عنده، فسبحان الله إن أريد بما تكلفت (5) (غير ذلك) (6)، وما توفيقي إلا بالله، عليه توكلت، وإليه أنيب، وبالله للصواب أرتشد، وعلى التوفيق للهدى أعتمد (7)، وهو حسبي ونعم الوكيل.

translation:
Whoever supports them supports God, and whoever opposes them opposes God. Whoever is ignorant of them fails, whoever separates from them goes astray, whoever holds onto them succeeds, and whoever seeks refuge with them finds safety. Whoever trusts them finds peace. I ask God to make this my way of life and my death, my resurrection, and my gathering, out of His grace, bounty, and guidance, for He is capable of all things.

Muhammad bin Ali said: I then compiled this book and named it "The Convincer" because it satisfies those who read it with its contents. I omitted the chains of narration so as not to make it cumbersome to carry, difficult to memorize, or tiresome for the reader, as what I explain within can be found in foundational books, clearly outlined by the venerable scholars and trustworthy jurists, may God have mercy on them. I hope for the reward from God and seek His pleasure through this, seeking recompense with Him. Glory be to God if I intended anything other than that in what I undertook, and my success is only by God; upon Him I rely, to Him I turn, and by God’s guidance I seek the right path, depending on His success for guidance. He is sufficient for me, and what an excellent trustee.

text:
[أبواب الطهارة] 1 باب الوضوء إذا أردت دخول الخلاء فقنع رأسك (1)، وأدخل رجلك اليسرى قبل اليمنى (2) وقل: بسم الله وبالله ولا إله إلا الله، اللهم لك الحمد، إعصمني من شر هذه البقعة وأخرجني منها سالما، وحل بيني وبين طاعة الشيطان (3).
وإذا (4) فرغت من حاجتك فقل: الحمد لله الذي أماط عني الأذى وهنأني طعامي وشرابي، وعافاني من البلوى (5).

translation:
### [Chapters on Purity]

#### Chapter 1: Ablution

When you wish to enter the bathroom, cover your head (1), and step in with your left foot before the right (2) and say: "In the name of Allah and by Allah, there is no deity but Allah. O Allah, all praise belongs to You. Protect me from the evil of this place and allow me to leave it safely, and keep me from the obedience to Satan." (3)

After you have relieved yourself, say: "All praise is due to Allah who has removed harm from me, blessed my food and drink, and protected me from affliction." (4)

translation: Do not aim your urine off the roof or any elevated position in the air. Do not urinate standing without necessity, as it is considered rude, and do not cleanse yourself with your right hand, as this is also considered rude. Do not prolong your stay in the restroom, as it can cause hemorrhoids. Avoid the banks of rivers, passageways, under fruit-bearing trees, and places subject to curses, such as house gates. It is narrated, "May God curse the one who relieves themselves in shaded places meant for resting, the one who withholds water meant for public use, and the one who blocks pathways."

text:
جالسا ذات يوم، وعنده ابنه محمد بن الحنفية، قال: يا محمد إئتني بإناء من ماء أتوضأ للصلاة، فأتاه، فأكفى (1) بيده اليسرى على يده اليمنى، وبيده اليمنى على يده اليسرى، ثم قال: بسم الله، والحمد لله الذي جعل الماء طهورا ولم يجعله نجسا.
ثم استنجى فقال: اللهم حصن فرجي، وأعفه (2)، واستر عورتي، وحرمني على النار.
ثم تمضمض فقال: اللهم لقني حجتي يوم ألقاك، وأطلق لساني بذكرك.
ثم استنشق فقال: اللهم لا تحرم علي (3) ريح الجنة، واجعلني ممن يشم ريحها، وروحها، وطيبها.
ثم غسل وجهه فقال: اللهم بيض وجهي يوم تسود فيه (4) الوجوه، ولا تسود وجهي يوم تبيض فيه (5) الوجوه.
ثم غسل يده اليمنى فقال: اللهم أعطني كتابي بيميني والخلد (في الجنان) (6) بيساري، وحاسبني حسابا يسيرا.
ثم غسل يده اليسرى فقال: اللهم لا تعطني كتابي بشمالي، ولا تجعلها مغلولة إلى عنقي، وأعوذ بك من مقطعات النيران.
ثم مسح رأسه فقال: اللهم (7) غشني برحمتك (8)، وظللني تحت عرشك يوم لا ظل إلا ظلك.
ثم مسح على قدميه فقال: اللهم ثبتني على الصراط يوم تزل فيه الأقدام، وأجعل سعيي فيما يرضيك عني.

translation:
One day, while seated with his son Muhammad ibn al-Hanafiyyah, he said: "O Muhammad, bring me a vessel of water so I may perform ablution for prayer." So, he brought it to him, and he poured with his left hand over his right hand, and with his right hand over his left hand. Then he said: "In the name of Allah, and praise be to Allah who made water pure and did not make it impure."

After cleansing himself, he said: "O Allah, protect my chastity, make it pure, and cover my shame, and forbid the fire for me."

Then he rinsed his mouth and said: "O Allah, make me recognize my argument the day I meet you, and loosen my tongue with your remembrance."

Then he inhaled water into his nose and said: "O Allah, do not deprive me of the scent of paradise, and make me among those who inhale its fragrance, its breeze, and its goodness."

Then he washed his face and said: "O Allah, make my face bright on the day when faces will be darkened, and do not darken my face on the day when faces will be brightened."

Then he washed his right hand and said: "O Allah, grant me my record in my right hand and eternal residence (in the gardens) in my left, and account me with an easy reckoning."

Then he washed his left hand and said: "O Allah, do not give me my record in my left hand, nor make it chained to my neck, and I seek refuge with you from the shackles of the fire."

Then he wiped his head and said: "O Allah, cover me with your mercy, and shade me under your throne on the day when there is no shade except your shade."

Finally, he wiped over his feet and said: "O Allah, keep my steps firm on the Path when feet will slip, and make my effort for that which pleases you about me."

ثم رفع رأسه فنظر (1) إلى محمد وقال (2): يا محمد من توضأ مثل وضوئي هذا (3)، وقال مثل قولي، خلق الله من كل قطرة ملكا يقدسه، ويسبحه، ويكبره، فيكتب (4) الله تبارك وتعالى له ثواب ذلك إلى يوم القيامة (5).
وأعلم أن الوضوء مرة، واثنتين لا يؤجر (6)، وثلاثة (7) بدعة (8).
وإن بلت، فذكرت بعد ما صليت أنك لم تغسل ذكرك، فأغسل ذكرك، وأعد الوضوء للصلاة (9).
وكان أمير المؤمنين - عليه السلام - إذا توضأ للصلاة (10)، لا يترك (11) أحدا يصب

translation:
Then he raised his head and looked at Muhammad and said: "O Muhammad, whoever performs ablution like mine and recites as I do, God creates an angel from each drop of water to glorify and exalt Him, and God Almighty records the reward for that until the Day of Resurrection."

"And know that performing ablution once or twice does not earn a reward, while doing it three times is an innovation. If you urinate and remember after praying that you did not wash your private part, wash it and renew your ablution for the prayer." 

When the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, performed ablution for prayer, he would not allow anyone to pour water on him. 

(Note: This translation maintains the religious and historical context as reflected in the original Arabic text. The footnotes reference various Islamic texts and interpretations related to the practice of ablution.)

text:
عليه الماء، فسئل عن ذلك، فقال: لا أحب أن اشرك في صلاتي أحدا (1) (2).
ولا ينقض (3) وضوؤك إلا من أربعة أشياء: من بول، أو غائط، أو ريح، أو مني (4)، وما سوى ذلك من القيء، والقلس (5)، والقبلة، والحجامة، والرعاف (6)، والوذي (7)، والمذي (8)، فليس فيه إعادة وضوء (9).

translation:
He was asked about water being poured over him, and he said: "I do not like to allow anyone to join me in my prayer."

Your wudu (ablution) is not invalidated except by four things: urine, feces, wind, or seminal fluid. Other than that, actions such as vomiting, reflux, kissing, cupping, nosebleeds, pre-ejaculate fluid, and thin fluid resulting from foreplay, do not require you to repeat your wudu.

وكل ما لم يجب فيه إعادة الوضوء، فليس عليك أن تغسل ثوبك منه (1).
وإن نسيت أن تستنجي بالماء، وقد تمسحت بثلاثة أحجار حتى صليت، ثم ذكرت وأنت في وقتها، فأعد الوضوء (2) والصلاة، وإن كان قد مضى الوقت، فقد جازت صلاتك، فتوضأ لما تستقبل من الصلاة (3).
وإن بلت فأصاب فخذك نكتة من بولك، فصليت، ثم ذكرت أنك لم تغسله، فاغسل وأعد الصلاة (4).
ولا بأس أن (5) تمس عظم الميت إذا جاز (6) سنة (7).
وإن أصاب ثوبك بول الخشاشيف (8)، فاغسل ثوبك (9).

translation:
If something does not require redoing ablution, you do not have to wash your garment because of it (1). If you forgot to cleanse yourself with water and used three stones instead before you prayed, and you remembered while still in the prayer time, redo the ablution (2) and the prayer. However, if the prayer time has passed, your prayer is valid, so perform ablution for future prayers (3). 

If you urinated and a drop of it touched your thigh, then you prayed and later remembered you didn't wash it off, wash it and redo the prayer (4). There is no issue with touching a bone of the deceased if a year has passed (5)(6)(7). If your garment is stained by the urine of bats, wash your garment (8)(9).

1. Referenced from Al-Mustadrak: 1/234, end of Hadith 2. See also Al-Kafi: 3/39, end of Hadith 2 and 3, p. 54, end of Hadith 6, Ilal Al-Sharaye: 295, Hadith 1, p. 296, end of Hadith 3, Al-Faqih: 1/39, end of Hadith 2, Al-Tahdhib: 1/17, end of Hadith 40 and 41, and Al-Istibsar: 1/91, end of Hadith 3 and 4. Refer to Al-Wasael: 1/276 - The Chapters of Nullifiers of Ablution - Chapter 12, Hadith 1, 2, 4, and 5.
   
2. According to the author of Al-Wasael, "ablution" here likely refers to cleansing oneself, as it is often implied, or redoing the prayer and ablution is recommended as a preferable act.
   
3. Referenced from Al-Mustadrak: 1/259, Hadith 1. In Al-Tahdhib: 1/45, beginning of Hadith 66, and Al-Istibsar: 1/52, beginning of Hadith 4 with slight variation in wording. They are referenced in Al-Wasael: 1/317 - The Chapters of Rules of Solitude - Chapter 10, Hadith 1.

Refer to Al-Wasael: 3/428 - The Chapters of Impurities - Chapter 19, Hadith 2 and 3. In Al-Faqih: 1/43 with slight variation.
   
5-7. Referenced from Al-Mustadrak: 2/492, Hadith 2. In Al-Kafi: 3/73, Hadith 13, Al-Tahdhib: 1/277, Hadith 101, and Al-Istibsar: 1/192, Hadith 3 with minor wording differences. Refer to Al-Wasael: 3/294 - The Chapters of Washing After Contact - Chapter 2, Hadith 2, and in Al-Faqih: 1/42 similarly.

وروي: أنه لا بأس بخرء ما طار، وبوله (1).
ولا تصل في ثوب أصابه ذرق الدجاج (2).
وإن وقعت فأرة في الماء، ثم خرجت فمشت على الثياب، فاغسل ما رأيت من أثرها، وما لم تره انضحه بالماء (3).
ولا بأس بدم السمك في الثوب أن تصلي (4) فيه، قليلا كان أم كثيرا (5).
وإن أصاب عمامتك أو قلنسوتك أو تكتك أو جوربك أو خفك مني أو بول أو دم (6) أو غائط فلا بأس بالصلاة فيه، وذلك أن الصلاة لا تتم في شيء من هذا وحده (7).

translation:
It has been narrated that there is no harm in the droppings or urine of flying creatures. However, you should not pray in a garment that has been soiled by chicken droppings.

If a mouse falls into water, then comes out and walks on clothes, wash the places where you can see its traces, and sprinkle water on areas you cannot see.

There is no harm in the blood of fish on a garment, whether in small or large amounts, and you may pray in it.

If your turban, cap, belt, socks, or shoes are stained with semen, urine, blood, or feces, there is no harm in praying in them, as the prayer is not completed using only these items.

وكل شيء طاهر، (إلا ما علمت) (1) أنه قذر (2).
وقال (3) أمير المؤمنين - عليه السلام -: لبن الجارية وبولها يغسلان من الثوب قبل أن تطعم، لأن لبنها يخرج من مثانة أمها، ولبن الغلام لا يغسل منه الثوب ولا (بوله (4)، لأن لبن الغلام) (5) يخرج من المنكبين والعضدين (6).
وروي في امرأة ليس لها إلا قميص واحد، ولها مولود يبول عليها، أنها تغسل القميص في اليوم مرة (7).
وإن وقع ثوبك على حمار ميت فليس عليك غسله، ولا بأس بالصلاة فيه (8).
وإذا توضأت المرأة ألقت قناعها عن موضع مسح رأسها في صلاة الغداة

translation:
Everything is pure, except for what you know to be impure.

Amir al-Mu'minin – peace be upon him – said: "The milk of a female infant and her urine should be washed from clothing before she eats, because her milk comes from her mother's bladder. However, the milk of a male infant does not require the clothing to be washed from it, nor his urine, because the milk of a male infant comes from the shoulders and the upper arms."

It is narrated about a woman who has only one garment and a newborn who urinates on her, that she washes the garment once a day.

If your garment comes into contact with a dead donkey, you are not required to wash it, and there is no problem praying in it.

When a woman performs ablution, she should remove her head covering from the area to be wiped for the morning prayer.

والمغرب (1)، وتمسح عليه، ويجزيها في سائر الصلوات (2) أن تدخل إصبعها (3)، فتمسح على رأسها من غير أن تلقي عنها قناعها (4).
ولا بأس أن تصلي بوضوء واحد صلوات (5) الليل والنهار كلها، ما لم تحدث (6).
وإن غسلت يمينك قبل الوجه، فاغسل وجهك، ثم أعد على اليمين، وإن غسلت يسارك قبل يمينك فاغسل يمينك، ثم اغسل يسارك (7)، وإن مسحت على رجليك قبل رأسك فامسح على رأسك، ثم أعد المسح على رجليك (8).
وإن توضأت فانقطع بك الماء قبل أن تتم الوضوء فأتيت بالماء، فأتمم وضوءك إذا كان ما غسلته رطبا، وإن كان قد جف فأعد وضوءك، وإن جف بعض وضوئك قبل أن تتم الوضوء من غير أن ينقطع عنك الماء فاغسل ما بقي،

translation:
In Morocco (1), she wipes over it, and it suffices her for the rest of the prayers (2) to insert her finger (3) and wipe over her head without having to remove her veil (4). There is no issue with praying all the daytime and nighttime prayers with one ablution, as long as she does not invalidate it (6). If you wash your right hand before your face, then wash your face and repeat washing the right hand. If you wash your left hand before your right, wash your right hand and then your left (7). If you wipe over your feet before your head, wipe over your head, then repeat wiping over your feet (8). If you start your ablution and the water is cut off before completion, and you later get water, complete your ablution if what you've washed is still wet. If it has dried, repeat your ablution. If part of your ablution dries before completing it and water was not cut off, only wash what remains.

translation:
Your ablution may have dried or not. (1)
(And do not fear) (2) - it has also been narrated: I do not fear (3) - drinking intoxicants or wiping over the leather socks from anyone (4).
If a man wakes up from sleep and has not urinated, he should not put his hand into the vessel until he washes it (5), and if he has urinated, he must not put his hand into the water until he washes it (6) (7).
Do not perform ablution (8) with the leftover water of a menstruating woman, nor drink (9) from it (10).

text:
وإذا توضأت فدور الخاتم في وضوئك، وإن علمت أن الماء لا يدخل تحته فحوله (1)، وإذا اغتسلت من الجنابة فحوله، وإن نسيت حتى قمت في الصلاة فلا آمرك أن تعيده (2) (3).
وإن أصابك نضح (4) من طشت فيه وضوؤك (5)، فاغسل ما أصابك منه، إذا كان الوضوء من بول أو قذر، وإن كان وضوؤك للصلاة فلا يضرك (6).
ولا بأس أن تتوضأ من الماء إذا كان في زق (7) من جلد (8) ميتة، ولا بأس بأن تشربه (9).
ولا بأس بأن تتوضأ من فضل المرأة إذا لم تكن جنبا ولا حائضا (10).

translation:
If you perform ablution, rotate the ring during your ablution, and if you know that water does not reach underneath it, move it. When you perform the ritual bath (ghusl) to cleanse from a state of impurity due to sexual activity (janabah), also move it. However, if you forget and have already started your prayer, I do not instruct you to repeat it.

If you are splashed by drops from a basin containing your ablution water, wash what the water touched if the ablution was for removing impurity or filth. But if the ablution was for prayer, it does not harm you.

There is no harm in performing ablution with water stored in a leather container from a dead animal's skin, and it is permissible to drink from it. Likewise, it is permissible to perform ablution using the leftover water of the woman if she is neither in a state of major impurity nor menstruating. 

Note: The references indicate various Islamic scholarly sources and annotations, and there are specific views from the Imami Shi'a scholars regarding the permissibility under different circumstances.

text:
وإن وجدت ماء نقيعا (1) تبول فيه الدواب فتوضأ منه، وكذلك الدم السائل في الماء وأشباهه (2).
ولا بأس أن تدخل في الصلاة ويدك غمرة (3) (4).
ولا تتوضأ إن (5) نمت وأنت جالس في الصلاة، فإن العين قد تنام بعبد (6) والأذن تسمع، فإذا سمعت الأذن (7) فلا بأس (8)، إنما الوضوء مما وجدت ريحه، أو سمعت صوته (9).
وإن استيقنت أنك توضأت وأحدثت، فلا تدري سبق الوضوء الحدث، أم الحدث الوضوء، فتوضأ (10).
ولا تبعض الوضوء (11)، وتابع بينه كما أمرك الله (12) (13).

translation:
If you find stagnant water that animals urinate in, you may perform ablution from it, as well as in the case of flowing blood in the water and similar situations, as long as the water's characteristics do not change. There is no harm in starting the prayer while there is grease on your hand.

Do not perform ablution if you have slept while sitting in prayer, for the eyes may sleep while the ears remain alert. If the ears hear, there is no harm. Ablution is only required if you notice a smell or hear a sound indicative of release.

If you are certain that you have performed ablution and then had an occurrence (that invalidates it), but you are unsure which came first, the ablution or the occurrence, then perform ablution again.

Do not fragment your ablution; perform it continuously as Allah has commanded you, referring to what is mentioned in Surah Al-Ma'ida, verse 6.

text:
وإن شككت بعدما صليت فلم تدر توضأت أم لا، فلا تعد الوضوء ولا الصلاة (1).
ومتى شككت في شيء وأنت في حال أخرى، فامض ولا تلتفت إلى الشك إلا أن تستيقن (2).
ومتى (3) ما تكشفت لبول أو غير ذلك فقل: بسم الله، فإن الشيطان يغض بصره عنك حتى تفرغ (4).
وسئل أبو الحسن الرضا - عليه السلام - ما حد الغائط؟ فقال: لا تستقبل القبلة، ولا تستدبرها، ولا تستقبل الريح، ولا تستدبرها (5).
ومتى (6) توضأت فاذكر اسم الله، فان من توضأ فذكر اسم الله طهر جميع جسده، وكان الوضوء إلى الوضوء كفارة لما بينهما من الذنوب، ومن (7) لم يسم لم يطهر من جسده إلا ما أصابه الماء (8).

translation: If you doubt after having prayed and are uncertain whether you performed ablution or not, do not repeat the ablution or the prayer. If you are in another state and doubt something, continue and do not pay attention to the doubt unless you are certain. Whenever you uncover yourself to urinate or for any other reason, say: "In the name of Allah," for Satan averts his gaze from you until you finish. Abu al-Hasan al-Ridha – peace be upon him – was asked about the limits of defecation, and he said: Do not face the Qibla, do not turn your back to it, do not face the wind, and do not turn your back to it. Whenever you perform ablution, mention the name of Allah; for whoever performs ablution and mentions the name of Allah, his entire body is purified, and ablution to ablution is an atonement for the sins between them. Whoever does not mention the name, only the parts touched by water are purified.

واعلم أن من توضأ وتمندل كتبت (2) له حسنة، ومن توضأ (3) ولم يتمندل (حتى يجف) (4) كتبت (5) له ثلاثون حسنة (6).
وروي: أن من توضأ للمغرب، كان وضوؤه ذلك كفارة لما مضى من ذنوبه في نهاره، إلا الكبائر (7).
وافتح عينيك (8) إذا توضأت، فإن رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - قال: افتحوا عيونكم عند الوضوء، لعلها (9) لا ترى نار جهنم (10).

translation:
It is narrated that whoever performs ablution (wudu) and mentions the name of Allah, it is as though they have performed a full ritual bath (ghusl).

Be aware that whoever performs ablution and dries themselves is recorded a good deed, and whoever performs ablution and does not dry themselves until it dries naturally is recorded thirty good deeds.

It is narrated that whoever performs ablution for the Maghrib prayer, their ablution serves as atonement for the sins committed during the day, except for major sins.

Open your eyes when you perform ablution, for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said, "Open your eyes during ablution, so that they may not see the fire of Hell."

This information is derived from several sources, including "Al-Bihar," "Al-Wasa'il," "Thawab al-A'mal," "Al-Faqih," "Al-Tahdhib," "Al-Istibsar," "Al-Mustadrak," "Al-Mahasn," and "Al-Kafi." Notably, Muslim scholars like Al-Shaykh al-Tusi, as cited by Al-Majlisi, argued consensus on the non-obligatory nature and the non-recommendation of opening one's eyes during ablution.

ولا تضع الماء في الشمس للوضوء والغسل، فإن رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - دخل على عائشة، وقد وضعت قمقمتها (1) في الشمس، فقال: يا حميراء، ما هذا؟ قالت: أغسل رأسي وجسدي (2)، قال - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -: لا تعودي فإنه يورث البرص (3).
وإذا اغتسلت فاغتسل (4) بصاع (من ماء) (5)، وإذا توضأت فتوض بمد من ماء، وصاع النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - خمسة أمداد، والمد وزن مائتين وثمانين درهما، والدرهم وزن ستة دوانيق، والدانق وزن ست حبات، والحبة وزن حبتي شعير من أوساط (6) الحب، لا من صغاره ولا من كباره (7).
جملة وزن الخمسة أمداد الماء، ألف وستمائة وخمسون درهما (8).

translation:
Do not place water in the sun for the purpose of ablution and washing, for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) entered upon Aisha, who had placed her water container in the sun. He said: "O Humayra, what is this?" She replied: "I am washing my head and body." He (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Do not do that again, for it can cause leprosy."

When you wash, use a sa' (a traditional unit of measure) of water, and when you perform ablution, use a mudd of water. The Prophet's sa' (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) was five mudds, and one mudd weighs two hundred and eighty dirhams. A dirham is equal to the weight of six daniqs, and one daniq weighs as much as six grains, where a grain weighs the same as two ordinary barley grains, not the smaller ones nor the larger ones.

In total, the weight of the five mudds of water is one thousand six hundred and fifty dirhams.

translation:
## Chapter 2: The Siwak and Its Virtues

Do not neglect the siwak, for it has twelve benefits: it is a Sunnah, it purifies the mouth, brightens the sight, pleases the Most Merciful, whitens the teeth, removes plaque, strengthens the gums, enhances the appetite, expels phlegm, increases memory, doubles good deeds, and delights the angels.

Everything has its cleanser, and the cleanser of the mouth is the siwak.

A prayer offered with the siwak is better with Allah than seventy prayers offered without it.

translation:
Chapter 3: Tayammum (Dry Ablution)

Know that a man (does not perform tayammum) until it is the last part of the prayer time. Once he has performed tayammum, it suffices for him to pray the obligatory prayers of both day and night as long as he does not invalidate it (by nullifying actions) or find water.

If you pass by water and do not perform wudu (ablution), hoping to find other water, you must repeat the tayammum. This is because it has been nullified by your awareness of the water.

If you performed tayammum and prayed, and then found water while the prayer time is still valid, you do not need to repeat the prayer.

إعادة عليك، وقد مضت صلاتك، فتوض لصلاة أخرى (1).
وإذا تيممت ودخلت في صلاتك، ثم أتيت بماء، فانصرف وتوض ما لم تركع، فان كنت قد ركعت فامض، فإن التيمم أحد الطهورين (2).
فإذا تيممت فاضرب بيديك على الأرض مرة واحدة، وانفضهما وامسح بهما بين عينيك إلى أسفل حاجبيك، ثم تدلك إحدى يديك بالأخرى (3) فوق الكف قليلا (4).
وقد روي: أنه (5) تضرب بيديك (6) على الأرض مرة واحدة، ثم تنفضهما فتمسح (بهما وجهك) (7) ، (ثم تضرب بيسارك الأرض، فتمسح) (8) بها يمينك من المرفق إلى أطراف الأصابع، ثم تضرب بيمينك الأرض، فتمسح بها يسارك من المرفق إلى أطراف الأصابع (9).

translation:
Here is the translation of the provided Arabic text into English:

---

If you need to perform ablution again, and your prayer is completed, then make ablution for another prayer. (1). If you have performed dry ablution (tayammum) and commenced your prayer, but then find water, you should leave and perform ablution before you have bowed (rukuu’). If you have bowed, then continue your prayer because tayammum is one of the two purifications. (2). 

When performing tayammum, strike your hands on the ground once, shake them off, and wipe them from the area between your eyes down to your lower eyebrows. Then rub your hands over each other slightly above the wrist. (3) It is also narrated that you (5) strike your hands (6) on the ground once, shake them, and then wipe (your face with them) (7). (Then strike the ground with your left hand and use it to wipe your right arm from the elbow to the fingertips, then strike the ground with your right hand and use it to wipe your left arm from the elbow to the fingertips). (9)

1 - Source: Al-Mustadrak: 2/542, No. 5, as in Al-Hidayah: 19. In Al-Fiqh: 1/58, end of Hadith 3. In Al-Tahdhib: 1/195, Hadith 37 and 39, and Al-Istibsar: 1/160, Hadith 6 and 8 with minor differences, and in Al-Wasa’il: 3/369 - Chapters of Tayammum - Chapter 14, Hadith 11, and page 370, Hadith 14.
2 - Source: Al-Mustadrak: 2/546, Hadith 2. In Al-Kafi: 3/63, end of Hadith 4, and Al-Fiqh: 1/58, end of Hadith 3, and Al-Tahdhib: 1/200, end of Hadith 54, with variations in wording, in Al-Kafi: 3/64, Hadith 5, and Al-Tahdhib: 1/204, Hadith 65-67, and Al-Istibsar: 1/166, Hadith 2, and page 167, Hadith 3 and 4 in similar fashion, also in Muntaha al-Matlab: 108, Hadith 59, quoting from the book of Ibn Mahboub, in Al-Wasa’il: 3/381 - Chapters of Tayammum - Chapter 21, Hadith 1 and 2.
3 - "On the other" Al-Mustadrak.
4 - Source: Al-Mustadrak: 2/537, Hadith 1. In Al-Kafi: 3/61, Hadith 1, and Al-Fiqh: 1/57, end of Hadith 2, and Al-Hidayah: 18, and Al-Tahdhib: 1/207, Hadith 4, and page 211, Hadith 16, and Al-Istibsar: 1/171, Hadith 1 similar, also in Muntaha al-Matlab: 26, end of Hadith 4 quoting from Nawadir al-Bazanti, most of it from Al-Wasa’il: 3/358 - Chapters of Tayammum - Chapter 11, Hadith 3 and 9. In Al-Bihar: 81/159, Hadith 18 from Al-Sarair
5 - "You" in versions B, C, Al-Mustadrak.

9 - Source: Al-Mustadrak: 2/538, end of Hadith 2, in Al-Zakra: 108, and from Al-Fadilin quoting Ali ibn Babawayh similarly. In Al-Tahdhib: 1/210, Hadith 15, and Al-Istibsar: 1/172, Hadith 8 with slight variation, from Al-Wasa’il: 3/362 - Chapters of Tayammum - Chapter 12, Hadith 5, in Fiqh al-Rida: 88 in similar manner.

This translation maintains the spiritual instructions and their significance within the religious context, referring to the practice of tayammum as a form of purification in the absence of water.

وإن كنت في حال لا تقدر إلا على الطين، فلا بأس أن تتيمم منه (1) إذا لم يكن معك ثوب جاف ولا لبد تنفضه وتتيمم به (2) (3).
وإن (4) كنت في مفازة ومعك إداوة (5) من ماء وأنت على غير طهر، فتمسح بالصعيد واترك الماء، إلا أن تعلم أنك تدرك الماء قبل أن (يفوت وقت) (6) الصلاة (7).
وإن كنت وسط (8) زحام يوم الجمعة أو يوم عرفة، لا تستطيع الخروج من المسجد من كثرة الناس، فتيمم وصل معهم، ثم تعيد إذا انصرفت (9).
وإن كنت في سفر ومعك ماء، ونسيت فتيممت وصليت، ثم ذكرت قبل أن يخرج الوقت، فأعد الوضوء والصلاة (10).

translation:
If you find yourself in a situation where you have nothing but clay, it is permissible to perform tayammum with it if you do not have a dry cloth or a piece of felt that you can shake out and perform tayammum with.

If you are traveling in a desert and you have a small leather container of water but you are not in a state of ritual purity, you may perform tayammum with earth and save the water, unless you are certain that you will reach water before the time for prayer runs out.

If you are in a crowded place on a Friday or the Day of Arafah and cannot leave the mosque due to the large number of people, perform tayammum and pray with them, but repeat the prayer after you leave.

If you are on a journey, have water with you, and forget, leading you to perform tayammum and pray, but you remember before the prayer time ends, you should redo your ablution and prayer.

(Note: The numbers and references in the original text are scholarly annotations and citations from Islamic jurisprudence sources related to the rulings on tayammum.)

text:
وإن كان معك إناءان، وقع في أحدهما ما ينجس الماء، ولم تعلم في أيهما وقع، فاهرقهما جميعا وتيمم (1).
وإذا احتلمت في المسجد الحرام، أو في مسجد الرسول - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - (2) فتيمم، ولا تمر في المسجد إلا متيمما، ولا بأس أن تمر في سائر المساجد وأنت جنب، ولا تجلس فيها (3).

translation:
If you have two containers, and something that defiles water falls into one of them, but you do not know which one, then pour them both out and perform tayammum (dry ablution).

If you experience a nocturnal emission in the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram) or in the Prophet’s Mosque (peace be upon him and his family), perform tayammum. Do not pass through the mosque unless you have done so. However, you may pass through other mosques while in a state of major ritual impurity (junub), but do not sit in them.

4 باب ما يقع في البئر، والأواني من الناس، والبهائم، والطيور، وغير ذلك إعلم أن الماء كله طاهر، إلا ما علمت أنه قذر (1).
وأكبر ما يقع في البئر الانسان، فانزح منها سبعين دلوا إذا مات، وأصغر ما يقع في البئر الصعوة (2)، فاستق منها دلوا واحدا (3).

translation:
Chapter 4: Items That May Fall Into Wells, Vessels, Including People, Animals, Birds, and Other Things

Be aware that all water is pure, except for what you know to be impure. The largest thing that may fall into a well is a human. If a person falls and dies in the well, draw seventy buckets of water from it. The smallest thing that might fall into the well is the "Sa‘wah," which refers to small birds, or it is said, a bird smaller than a sparrow with a red head. In such a case, draw out one bucket of water.

If a camel falls into the well or if wine is poured into it, then all the water must be drawn out.

References include Al-Mustadrak, Vol 1, page 190, Hadith 2; Al-Kafi, Vol 3, page 1, Hadiths 2 and 3; Al-Tahdhib, Vol 1, pages 215 and 216, Hadiths 2, 3, and 4; and with slight variations found in Wasail; Al-Faqih, Vol 1, page 6, Hadith 1; Al-Hidaya, page 13 with minor differences; Lisan al-Arab, Vol 14, page 460 for the definition of "Sa‘wah"; and similar mentions in Al-Bihar and Al-Hidaya. Variations across texts include the substitution of the word "as-s‘wah" with "as-sparrow" in some accounts. Also included are references to differences in wording in Al-Kafi, Al-Tahdhib, and Al-Istibsar.

text:
فان (1) وقع في البئر عذرة، فاستق منها عشرة دلاء، وإن ذابت فيها، فاستق منها أربعين دلوا إلى خمسين دلوا (2).
وإن بال فيها رجل، فاستق منها أربعين دلوا، فان بال فيها صبي قد أكل الطعام، فاستق منها ثلاثة دلاء، وإن كان رضيعا فاستق منها دلوا واحدا (3).
فان (4) وقع فيها كلب، أو سنور، فانزح منها ثلاثين دلوا إلى أربعين دلوا (5).
وقد روي: سبعة دلاء (6).
فان وقع فيها دجاجة، أو حمامة، فاستق منها سبعة دلاء (7).

translation:
If feces fall into a well, ten buckets of water should be drawn from it. If the feces dissolve in the water, then forty to fifty buckets need to be drawn. If a man urinates in it, forty buckets should be drawn. If a child who has eaten solid food urinates in it, three buckets should be drawn. However, if it is an infant, only one bucket is needed.

If a dog or a cat falls into the well, thirty to forty buckets should be drawn. Some traditions mention drawing seven buckets. If a chicken or a dove falls in, seven buckets should be drawn. 

[Sources and references included in the original Arabic text have been maintained for contextual preservation but not explicitly translated.]

text:
وإن وقع فيها حمار، فاستق منها كرا من الماء (1).
والكر ما يكون ثلاثة أشبار طولا (2)، في عرض ثلاثة أشبار، في عمق ثلاثة أشبار (3).
وروي أن الكر (ذراعان وشبر، في ذراعين وشبر) (4) (5).
وسئل أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام - عن الماء الذي لا ينجسه شيء، قال: ذراعان عمقه، في ذراع وشبر سعته (6) (7).
وروي: أن الكر ألف ومائتا رطل (8).
وإن قطر في البئر قطرات من دم، فاستق منها عشرة دلاء (9) (10).
وإن وقعت (11) فيها فأرة (12)، فانزح منها دلوا واحدا (13).

translation:
If a donkey falls into it, draw from it a quantity of water. The "Kurr" is measured as three spans in length, three spans in width, and three spans in depth. It is narrated that the "Kurr" is two cubits and a span in length, two cubits and a span in width. Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, was asked about the amount of water that is not rendered impure by anything, and he said: "Its depth is two cubits, and its width is one cubit and a span."

It is also narrated that the "Kurr" equals one thousand two hundred ratls. If a few drops of blood fall into a well, ten buckets should be drawn from it. If a mouse falls into it, one bucket should be drawn out.

وإن وقع فيها زنبيل (3) من عذرة، رطبة أو يابسة، أو زنبيل من سرقين، فلا بأس بالوضوء منها، وليس عليك أن تنزح منها شيئا (4).

translation:
In the event that a mouse rots in the water, most scholars recommend drawing seven buckets of water to purify it. If a basket containing feces, whether fresh or dry, or a basket of manure falls into it, you can still perform ablution from it, and you are not required to draw anything out of it. If a mouse falls into a container of oil and is removed while still alive, there is no harm in selling it to a Muslim or using the oil. However, if a sheep falls into the well, seven buckets of water should be drawn from it.

وإن وقعت فأرة (1) في خابية (2) فيها سمن أو زيت، فلا تأكله (3).

(وفي حديث آخر: أكلت النار ما فيه) (5) (6).
وإذا وقع في البئر سام أبرص (7) فحرك الماء بالدلو، فليس بشيء (8).
وروى عبد الكريم (9) عن أبي عبد الله - عليه السلام - أنه قال في بئر استقي (10) منها، فتوضئ به، وغسل به الثياب، وعجن به، ثم علم أنه كان فيها ميتة، أنه لا بأس، ولا يغسل منه الثوب، ولا تعاد منه الصلاة (11).

translation:
If a mouse falls into a jar containing butter or oil, do not eat it. And if a mouse or another creature falls into a well and dies, and water from that well is used for kneading dough, there is no harm in eating the bread, provided it is exposed to fire (baked). (In another narration, it says the fire consumes whatever impurities are in it.)

If a gecko falls into a well, stir the water with a bucket; this does not affect its purity. Abdul Karim narrated from Abu Abdullah - peace be upon him - regarding a well from which water was drawn, then used for ablution, washing clothes, or kneading, and later it was discovered that there was a carcass in it: there is no issue, and the clothes do not need to be rewashed nor the prayer repeated.

A gecko is a large type of lizard. Sheikh interpreted this purification process as valid as long as the creature has not decomposed; if decomposition occurs, seven buckets of water should be drawn from the well.

Abdul Karim bin Amr Al-Khathami Al-Kufi was mentioned by Sheikh among the companions of Al-Sadiq - peace be upon him - in his biographical account, and Taqi Al-Din Al-Hilli mentioned him in his biographical account as well, noting that he held the Waqifi position, which adheres to a specific sect in Shia Islam.

"Estesqi" refers to drawing water, and the text states that there is no problem with using the water from such a well in religious or practical terms.

وإن وقعت (2) في البئر قطرة دم، أو خمر، أو ميتة، أو لحم خنزير، فانزح منها عشرين دلوا، وإن تغير الريح، فانزح حتى تطيب (3).

وإذا أصبت جرذا (8) في إناء، فاغسل ذلك الاناء سبع مرات (9).

translation:
In another narration: Fire consumes what is in it.  
And if a drop of blood, wine, a dead animal, or pork falls into a well, draw out twenty buckets from it. If the odor changes, draw out more until it becomes pleasant again.  
If a dog or a mouse eats or sniffs a piece of bread, leave the part that was sniffed or eaten and consume the rest.  
There is no harm in performing ablution from ponds where urine is present if the color of the water is predominant over the color of the urine. However, if the color of the urine is more dominant than the water, do not perform ablution from it.  
If you find a rat in a container, wash the container seven times.  
If a beetle, fly, locust, ant, or scorpion falls into the well...  

(Note: The passage involves detailed religious guidelines regarding purity and cleanliness. The references and variations in phrases are traditional scholarly notes and are part of Islamic jurisprudential discussions.)

If there is a well next to a latrine, the flow of all springs moves with the northern direction. If the clean well is north and the latrine is lower, it doesn't harm if they are separated by arm's lengths. However, if the latrine is above the clean well, it should be no less than twelve arm's lengths. If they are directly opposite, facing the Qibla and both align with the northern direction, seven arm's lengths are sufficient.

If a person falls into a narrow well and cannot be removed, you should not perform ablution from that well, and it should be abandoned and turned into a grave. If the person can be removed, they should be taken out, washed, and buried. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his family)...

1. Daughters of Wardan: A small creature that develops in moist areas, often found in baths and water channels, and comes in various colors such as black, white, red, and yellow. (Majma' al-Bahrain: 2/488 - Ward).

قال (1):) حرمة الرجل المسلم ميتا كحرمته حيا سواء (2).
وإن أردت أن تجعل إلى جنب بالوعة بئرا، فإن كانت الأرض صلبة فاجعل بينهما خمسة أذرع، وإن كانت رخوة فسبعة أذرع (3).
وروي: إن كان بينهما أذرع (4) فلا بأس وإن كانت مبخرة (5) إذا كانت البئر أعلى (6) الوادي (7).
فإن قطرت قطرة خمر، أو نبيذ مسكر، في قدر فيه لحم ومرق كثير، أهريق المرق (8)، أو أطعم أهل الذمة، أو الكلب، ويغسل اللحم ويؤكل، وإن قطرت (9) (في القدر قطرة) (10) دم فلا بأس، فإن الدم تأكله النار.
وإن قطر خمر أو نبيذ (11) في عجين فقد فسد، ولا بأس أن تبيعه من اليهود

translation:
The respect for a Muslim man, whether in death or life, remains the same.

If you wish to place a well beside a drainage pit, if the ground is firm, there should be a distance of five cubits between them, and if the ground is soft, seven cubits. It is narrated that if there are a few cubits between them, there is no harm even if the well emits a foul odor, provided the well is situated higher in the valley.

If a drop of wine or intoxicating grape juice falls into a pot containing a lot of meat and broth, the broth should be discarded or given to non-Muslims or dogs; the meat should be washed and can be consumed. However, if a drop of blood falls into the pot, there is no issue, as the fire consumes the blood.

If wine or grape juice spills into dough, the dough becomes spoiled. However, it is permissible to sell it to Jews.

Chapter 5: Bathing Due to Janabah and Other Reasons

Know that the ritual bath (ghusl) for janabah is an obligatory duty, while other baths are considered Sunnah. If you intend to perform ghusl for janabah, wash your hands three times. Then, purify yourself, and pour three handfuls of water over your head. Use your fingers to separate your hair so that the water reaches the roots of all your hair. Do not leave a single hair on your head or beard without ensuring that water reaches beneath it, for it has been narrated that...

من ترك شعرة متعمدا لم يغسلها من الجنابة فهو في النار (١).
ثم صب الماء على رأسك وبدنك مرتين، وامرر يديك على بدنك كله، وخلل أذنيك باصبعيك، وكلما أصابه الماء فقد طهر (٢).
فإن أصابتك جنابة بالليل واغتسلت، فأصبحت ووجدت بثوبك جنابة (٣)، فلا إعادة عليك، إن كنت قد نظرت ولم تر شيئا، وإن لم تنظر (٤) فعليك الإعادة (٥).
وإذا دخلت الحمام ولم (٦) يكن عندك ما تغرف به ويداك قذرتان (٧)، فاضرب يدك في الماء وقل:
«بسم الله وبالله» وهذا مما قال الله عز وجل: ﴿وما جعل عليكم في الدين من حرج﴾ (8) (9).

translation:
If someone intentionally leaves even a single hair unwashed from a state of impurity (janabah), they will be in the fire (1). Then pour water over your head and body twice, and run your hands over your entire body, interlace your fingers in your ears, and whatever the water touches is purified (2). If you encounter a state of impurity in the night and perform the ritual washing (ghusl), then wake up to find impurity on your clothes (3), you do not need to repeat the washing if you have checked and seen nothing. However, if you did not check (4), then you must repeat it (5). 

If you enter the bath and have no means to pour the water and your hands are dirty (7), strike your hands in the water and say: "In the name of Allah and with Allah." This is part of what God, the Almighty, has mentioned: "He has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty" (8) (9).

وإذا دخلت الحمام فاغتسلت، وأصاب جسدك جنبا أو غيره فلا بأس (1).
وإذا اجتمع المسلم واليهودي والنصراني، إغتسل المسلم قبلهما من الحوض (2).
وإن كان بك جروح أو قروح وأجنبت (3)، فلا تغتسل إن خفت على نفسك (4).
ولا بأس أن تغتسل المرأة وزوجها من إناء واحد، ولكن تغتسل بفضله ولا يغتسل بفضلها (5).
ولا بأس أن تقرأ القرآن كله وأنت جنب، إلا العزائم التي يسجد فيها، وهي: سجدة لقمان (6)، وحم السجدة، والنجم، وسورة إقرأ باسم ربك (7).
ولا يجوز لك أن تمس المصحف وأنت جنب (8)، ولا بأس أن يقلب لك

translation:
If you enter the bathhouse to perform a full ablution (ghusl) and touch your body in a state of major ritual impurity or otherwise, there is no harm (1). When a Muslim, a Jew, and a Christian gather, the Muslim should bathe before them from the cistern (2). If you have wounds or sores and are in a state of major impurity (3), do not perform a full ablution if you fear for your health (4). 

It is permissible for a woman and her husband to bathe from the same vessel, but she should bathe from what is left of the water after him, and not the other way around (5). You may recite the entire Quran while in a state of major impurity, except the verses that require prostration, which are the prostration of Surah Luqman (6), Surah Ha-Mim, Surah An-Najm, and Surah Al-‘Alaq (7). 

It is not permissible for you to touch the Quran while in a state of major impurity (8), but it is permissible for someone to turn the pages for you.

الورق غيرك (1) وتنظر فيه (2) وتقرأ (3).
ولا تتوضأ بفضل الجنب والحائض (4)، ولا بأس أن يتناولا من المسجد ما أرادا ولا يضعان فيه شيئا، لأن ما فيه لا يقدران على أخذه من غيره، وهما قادران على وضع ما معهما في غيره (5).
ولا تأكل ولا تشرب وأنت جنب حتى تغسل فرجك وتتوضأ، فإنك إذا فعلت ذلك، خيف عليك البرص (6) (7).

translation:
Paper is not like you (1), and you look at it (2) and read (3). Do not perform ablution with the surplus water from a person in a state of major ritual impurity (janabah) or a menstruating woman (4). However, it is permissible for them to take what they desire from the mosque, but they should not place anything in it, because they cannot take what is in it from elsewhere, while they are able to place what they have elsewhere (5).

Do not eat or drink while you are in a state of major ritual impurity until you have washed your private parts and performed ablution, as it is feared that you may develop vitiligo (6) (7).

Abu Abdullah - peace be upon him - said: I dislike being in a state of major ritual impurity when the sun turns yellow, and when it rises while it is yellow (9).

وإن اغتسلت من الجنابة ووجدت بللا (1)، فإن كنت بلت قبل الغسل، فلا تعد الغسل، وإن كنت لم تبل قبل الغسل، فأعد الغسل (2).
وفي حديث آخر: إن لم تكن بلت، فتوضأ (3) ولا تغتسل، إنما ذلك من الحبائل (4) (5).
وإن احتلمت المرأة فأنزلت فليس عليها غسل (6).
وروي (أن عليها الغسل) (7) إذا أنزلت، فإن (8) لم تنزل فليس عليها شيء (9).
واعلم أن غسل الجنابة والحيض واحد (10).

translation:
If you have performed ghusl (ritual bath) for major impurity and find some unclear moisture, if you urinated before the ghusl, you do not need to repeat the ghusl. If you did not urinate before the ghusl, then you should repeat it.

In another narration: If you have not urinated, then perform wudu (ablution) and do not perform ghusl, for it is due to the veins of the lower back (as referred in some sources).

If a woman has a wet dream and experiences discharge, she does not need to perform ghusl.

However, it was narrated (that she does need to perform ghusl) if discharge occurs, and if there is no discharge, she has nothing upon her.

Know that the ghusl for major impurity and menstruation is the same.

وإذا حاضت المرأة وهي جنب فلا يضرها أن لا تغتسل من الجنابة حتى تطهر (1).
وإذا أجنبت ولم تجد الماء فتيمم بالصعيد، وإذا وجدت الماء فاغتسل وأعد الصلاة (2).
وروي: إن أجنبت في أرض ولم تجد إلا ماء جامدا، ولم تخلص إلى الصعيد، فصل بالتمسح، ثم لا تعد إلى الأرض التي يوبق (3) فيها دينك (4).
وإن عرقت في ثوبك وأنت جنب حتى يبتل ثوبك، فانضحه بشيء من ماء وصل فيه (5).
وقال والدي - رحمه الله - في رسالته إلي: إن عرقت في ثوبك وأنت جنب وكانت الجنابة من حلال، فحلال الصلاة فيه (6)، وإن كانت الجنابة (7) من حرام،

translation:
If a woman begins menstruating while in a state of major ritual impurity (junub), it is not obligatory for her to perform a ritual bath (ghusl) for the impurity until she becomes pure from menstruation (1). If someone becomes junub and cannot find water, they should perform dry ablution (tayammum) using clean earth. However, if they later find water, they should perform a ritual bath and repeat the prayer (2).

It is narrated that if one becomes junub in a place where only frozen water is available and access to earth for tayammum is not possible, they should pray by wiping themselves with whatever is handy, and then avoid returning to such a place that endangers your faith (3)(4). If you sweat in your clothing while being junub and your garment becomes wet, sprinkle it with some water and pray in it (5).

My father, may God have mercy on him, wrote in his letter to me: If you sweat in your clothing while being junub from a lawful cause, it is permissible to pray in it (6). However, if the junub was from an unlawful act (7), then further action may be required.

فحرام الصلاة فيه (1).
وإذا ارتمس الجنب في الماء إرتماسة واحدة أجزأه ذلك من غسله (2).
وإذا دخلت الحمام فلا تدلك رأسك ووجهك بمئزر، فإنه يذهب بماء الوجه، ولا تدلك تحت قدميك بالخزف، فإنه يورث البرص، ولا تستلق على قفاك فيه، فإنه يورث داء الدبيلة (3)، ولا تضطجع فيه، فإنه يذيب شحم الكليتين (4).
ولا تدخله بغير مئزر، فإنه من الإيمان (5).
وإن رأيت في منامك أنك تجامع ووجدت الشهوة، فانتبهت ولم تر بثيابك ولا (في جسدك) (6) شيئا فلا غسل عليك، وإن وجدت بلة أيضا، إلا أن يسبقك الماء الأكبر (7).

translation:
Prayer in such a place is prohibited (1). If a person in a state of major ritual impurity (junub) immerses themselves once in water, that suffices for their ritual washing (ghusl) (2). When entering the bathhouse, do not scrub your head and face with a loincloth, as it takes away the water of the face (dignity), and do not scrub the soles of your feet with pottery, as it can cause leprosy. Do not lie on your back there, as it brings about the disease of the tonsils (dabilah) (3), and do not recline, as it melts the fat around the kidneys (4). Do not enter without a loincloth, as it is part of faith (5). If in a dream you see yourself engaging in intercourse and feel desire, but upon waking you find nothing on your clothes or body (6), then no ritual washing is required, even if you also find moisture, unless seminal fluid comes forth (7).

ولا بأس أن يختضب الجنب، ويجنب وهو مختضب (1)، ويحتجم (2)، ويذكر الله (3) ويتنور، ويذبح (4)، ويلبس الخاتم (5)، وينام في المسجد ويمر فيه (6)، ويجنب أول الليل وينام إلى آخره (7).
ولا بأس بقراءة القرآن في الحمام ما لم ترد به الصوت (8)، ولا بأس بأن تنكح فيه (9).

translation:
And there is no harm if a person in the state of major ritual impurity (janabah) dyes their hair, remains in this state while doing so (1), undergoes cupping therapy (2), remembers Allah (3), uses depilatories, slaughters animals (4), wears a ring (5), sleeps in the mosque and passes through it (6), and becomes in the state of janabah at the beginning of the night and sleeps until the end of it (7).

There is no harm in reciting the Quran in the bathhouse as long as it is not out loud (8), and there is no harm in getting married there (9).

text:
وباء الشعر، ولا تستاك (1) فيه، فإنه يورث وباء الأسنان (2).
وإن جامعت مفاخذة حتى تهريق الماء، فعليك الغسل وليس على المرأة، إنما عليها غسل الفخذين (3).
وإن اغتسلت في وهدة (4) وخشيت أن يرجع ما ينصب عنك (5) إلى الماء الذي تغتسل منه، أخذت كفا وصببته أمامك وكفا عن يمينك، وكفا عن يسارك وكفا خلفك (6)، واغتسلت منه (7).

والثاني: أن المراد منه بل جسده، ثم الاغتسال به، ليتعجل الاغتسال قبل انحدار الماء المنفصل عن جسده إلى الماء.

ثانيا: أن يكون الغسل مختصا بحال الاضطرار.

translation:
The Epidemic of Poetic Infection and Refrain from Using Siwak in It: for it causes dental maladies.

If one engages in pre-ejaculatory sexual activity leading to orgasm, they are obligated to perform full ablution (ghusl), while the woman only needs to wash her thighs.

If you perform ghusl in a depression of the ground and fear that the water flowing away from you would return to the original body of water, you should take a handful of water and pour it in front of you, another to your right, another to your left, and another behind you, then perform ghusl with that.

1 - "Testak" in manuscript B.
2 - As narrated in "Illal al-Shara'i," page 292, within Hadith 1, similar context in "Al-Faqih," volume 1, page 64 within Hadith 19, both referenced in "Al-Wasa'il," volume 2, page 45 - Chapters on Bath Etiquette - Chapter 13 Hadith 2 and its continuation Hadith 3.
3 - Referenced in "Al-Mustadrak," volume 1, page 456, Hadith 8. Similar content in "Fiqh al-Ridha," page 236. Supported by narrations in "Al-Faqih," volume 1, page 47, Hadith 8, "Al-Tahdhib," volume 1, page 124, Hadith 26, "Al-Istibsar," volume 1, page 111, Hadith 1, referenced in "Al-Wasa'il," volume 2, page 199 - Chapters on Janabah - Chapter 11 Hadith 1.
4 - Wahda: a low point in the ground, referenced in "Majma' al-Bahrain," volume 2, page 566 - Wahd.
