translation:
Visiting the House: When you arrive at the House on the Day of Sacrifice, stand (1) at the door of the mosque and say: O Allah, help me with my pilgrimage, and grant me safety (in it and from it) (2). I ask you, like a sick (3) and humiliated person acknowledging his sin, to forgive my sins, (and fulfill my needs) (4). O Allah, I am Your servant, the land is Your land, and the House is Your House. I have come (5) seeking Your mercy and desiring Your approval, following Your command and content with Your words (6). I beseech You like one desperate for Your help, obedient to Your command, fearful of Your punishment, and dreading Your retribution. I ask You to grant me Your pardon and protect me with Your mercy from the Fire (7).

Approaching (8) the Black Stone: Then proceed to the Black Stone and touch it. If you cannot, then touch it with your hand and kiss your hand (9). If you are still unable, then face it, gesture towards it with your hand, kiss your hand, and say the same supplication as you did when you circumambulated the House upon arriving (10) in Mecca (11).

text:
وطف (1) بالبيت سبعة أشواط كما وصفت لك، ثم صل ركعتين عند مقام إبراهيم - عليه السلام - تقرأ فيهما (قل (2) هو الله أحد) و (قل يا أيها الكافرون).
ثم ارجع إلى الحجر الأسود فقبله إن استطعت، واستلمه وكبر للخروج إلى الصفا.
(ثم اخرج إلى الصفا) (3) واصعد عليه، واصنع عليه كما صنعت يوم قدمت مكة، تطوف بينهما سبعة أشواط، تبدأ بالصفا وتختم بالمروة، فإذا فعلت ذلك فقد أحللت من كل شيء أحرمت منه إلا النساء.
ثم ارجع إلى البيت فطف به أسبوعا، وهو طواف النساء، ثم صل ركعتين عند مقام إبراهيم - عليه السلام -، أو حيث شئت من المسجد، فإنه قد حل لك النساء، وفرغت من حجك كله إلا رمي الجمار، وأحللت من كل شيء أحرمت منه (4).
ثم ارجع إلى منى ولا تبت ليالي (5) التشريق إلا بها، فان بت في غيرها فعليك دم شاة، وإن خرجت بعد نصف الليل فلا يضرك أن تصبح في غيرها (6).

translation:
Circumambulate the House seven times as I have described to you, then pray two units (rak'ahs) at the Station of Abraham, peace be upon him, reciting in them "Say: He is Allah, the One" and "Say: O you disbelievers." 

Then return to the Black Stone and kiss it if you are able, touch it, and proclaim the greatness of Allah as you head towards al-Safa. Then proceed to al-Safa and ascend it, performing as you did when you first arrived in Mecca. You shall walk between al-Safa and al-Marwah seven times, beginning at al-Safa and concluding at al-Marwah. Once you have completed this, you will have exited the state of Ihram for everything except women.

Then return to the House and perform another seven rounds, this is the Tawaf of Women, then pray two units at the Station of Abraham, peace be upon him, or anywhere you wish within the mosque. At this point, women become permissible for you, and you will have completed your Hajj except for the stoning of the Jamarat, having exited the state of Ihram entirely.

Then return to Mina and do not spend the nights of Tashreeq elsewhere, for if you do so, you must offer the sacrifice of a sheep. If you depart after midnight, staying elsewhere by morning will not harm you.

text:
رمي (1) الجمار وارم الجمار في كل يوم بعد طلوع الشمس إلى الزوال، وكلما قرب من الزوال فهو (2) أفضل (3)، وقل كما قلت يوم رميت جمرة العقبة يوم النحر، وابدأ بالجمرة الأولى فارمها بسبع حصيات من يسارها في بطن الوادي، وقل مثل (4) ما قلت يوم النحر حين (5) رميت جمرة العقبة.
ثم قف على يسار الطريق، واستقبل البيت، واحمد الله واثن عليه، وصل على النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - ، (ثم تقدم قليلا وادع الله، واسأله أن يتقبل منك) (6)، (ثم تقدم قليلا) (7)، ثم افعل ذلك عند الوسطى ترميها بسبع حصيات، ثم اصنع كما صنعت بالأولى (8) (وتقف وتدعو الله كما دعوت في الأولى) (9).
ثم امض إلى الثالثة وعليك السكينة والوقار فارمها بسبع (10) حصيات، ولا

translation:
**Throwing the Jamarat**

Perform the ritual of throwing the Jamarat each day after the sun has risen until midday. The closer it is to midday, the better. Recite the same supplication as the one you did when you threw the Jamrat al-Aqabah on the Day of Sacrifice. Start with the first Jamarah and throw seven pebbles from the left side into the valley. Say the same supplications as you did on the Day of Sacrifice when you threw the Jamrat al-Aqabah.

Then stand to the left of the path, face the House (Kaaba), praise Allah, and send blessings upon the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him). Move forward slightly and pray to Allah, asking Him to accept it from you. Then proceed a bit further and do the same at the Middle Jamarah, throwing seven pebbles, and perform as you did with the first one, standing and praying to Allah as you did the first time.

Then proceed to the third Jamarah with calmness and dignity, throwing seven pebbles, and do not stop.

text:
تقف عندها (1).
فإذا كان يوم النفر الأخير وهو اليوم الرابع من الأضحى، فأخرج وارم الجمار كما رميت في اليوم الثاني والثالث تمام سبعين حصاة، فإذا فرغت منها فاستقبل منى بوجهك، واسأل الله (2) أن يتقبل (3) منك، وادع بما بدا لك (4).
الإفاضة من منى ثم أفض منها إلى مكة مهللا، ممجدا، داعيا، فإذا بلغت مسجد النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - وهو مسجد الحصباء (5) فاستلق فيه على قفاك، واسترح فيه (6) هنيئة (7).
ثم ادخل مكة وعليك السكينة والوقار وقد فرغت من كل شيء لزمك من حج أو (8) عمرة (9).
وابتع بدرهم تمرا وتصدق به، يكون كفارة لما دخل عليك في إحرامك مما

translation:
Stand at it (1). If it is the day of the final departure, which is the fourth day of Eid al-Adha, go out and throw the pebbles, as you did on the second and third days, completing seventy pebbles. Once you have finished, face Mina and ask God (2) to accept (3) it from you, and pray as much as you wish (4).

Depart from Mina and head to Mecca while chanting "Labbayk" and glorifying God. When you reach the Prophet's Mosque - peace be upon him and his family - which is the Masjid of Al-Hasba (5), lie on your back and rest there (6) briefly (7). Then enter Mecca with tranquility and reverence, having completed everything required of you for Hajj or (8) Umrah (9).

Buy some dates with a dirham and give it in charity, as an expiation for any errors during your state of Ihram.

لا تعلم (١).
فان أحببت أن تدخل الكعبة فاغتسل قبل أن تدخلها، ثم قل: اللهم إنك قلت: ﴿ومن دخله كان آمنا﴾ (2) فآمني من النار.
ثم تصلي (3) بين الأسطوانتين على الرخامة (4) الحمراء ركعتين، تقرأ في الركعة الأولى «حم السجدة»، وفي الثانية عدد آيها من القرآن (5)، ثم تقول: يا الله يا الله يا الله، يا عظيم يا عظيم يا عظيم (6)، أرجوك للعظيم، أسألك يا عظيم (أن تغفر (7)) لي الذنب (8) العظيم، فإنه لا يغفر الذنب (9) العظيم إلا العظيم، لا إله إلا أنت. ولا تدخلها (بحذاء ولا بخف) (10)، ولا تبزق فيها، ولا تمتخط (11) (12).

translation:
Do not learn (1). If you wish to enter the Kaaba, perform a ritual washing (ghusl) before entering. Then say: "O Allah, You have said: 'And whoever enters it shall be safe' (2), so grant me safety from the fire." Then perform two units of prayer (3) between the two columns on the red marble (4), reciting the chapter "Ha Meem Sajdah" in the first unit, and the equivalent number of its verses from the Quran (5) in the second unit. Then say: "O Allah, O Allah, O Allah, O Mighty, O Mighty, O Mighty (6), I implore You, O Mighty One, I ask You, O Mighty One, to forgive (7) the great sin (8), for there is none who can forgive the great sin (9) except the Mighty One. There is no deity but You." Do not enter with shoes or sandals (10), and do not spit or blow your nose in there (11) (12).

text:
وداع البيت فإذا أردت وداع البيت فطف به أسبوعا، ثم صل ركعتين حيث أحببت من المسجد وائت الحطيم - والحطيم ما بين باب البيت والحجر الأسود - فتعلق بالأستار وأنت قائم، فاحمد الله واثن عليه، وصل على النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - وأهل بيته، ثم قل: اللهم عبدك وابن (عبدك وابن أمتك) (1)، حملته على دوابك، وسيرته في بلادك، حتى أقدمته بيتك الحرام، وقد كان في أملي ورجائي أن تغفر لي، فان كنت (يا رب) (2) قد فعلت ذلك (3) (فازدد عني رضا) (4)، وقربني إليك زلفى، وإن لم تكن فعلت يا رب ذلك (5) فمن الآن (فاغفر لي) (6) قبل أن تنأى داري عن (7) بيتك (8)، غير راغب عنه ولا مستبدل به، هذا أوان انصرافي إن كنت قد أذنت لي، اللهم فاحفظني من بين يدي ومن خلفي، ومن تحتي ومن فوقي، وعن يميني وعن شمالي، حتى تقدمني أهلي صالحا، فإذا أقدمتني أهلي فلا تخل (9) مني، واكفني مؤنة عيالي ومؤنة خلقك.
فإذا بلغت باب الحناطين فانظر إلى الكعبة وخر ساجدا، واسأل الله أن يتقبل منك ولا يجعله آخر العهد منك، ثم تقول وأنت مار: آئبون تائبون حامدون لربنا شاكرون (10)، إلى الله راغبون، وإلى الله راجعون، وصلى الله على محمد وآله وسلم تسليما (11) (كثيرا، وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل) (12) (13).

translation:
Farewell to the House: When you wish to bid farewell to the House, circumambulate it seven times, then perform two units of prayer anywhere you like in the mosque. Then go to the Hijr Ismail—the area between the door of the House and the Black Stone—and while standing, hold on to the curtains, and praise and thank God, and send blessings upon the Prophet—peace and blessings be upon him and his family. Then say: "O Allah, your servant and the son of your servant (and the son of your maidservant), whom You have carried on Your creatures and enabled to travel in Your lands until You brought him to Your sacred house. It was in my hopes and aspirations that You would forgive me. If You have, my Lord, already done this, then gain even more satisfaction with me and bring me nearer to You. And if You have not, my Lord, then forgive me now before my house distances itself from Your House. I turn away from it neither eagerly nor with substitution in mind. This is the time of my departure if You have granted me leave. O Allah, protect me from in front of me, behind me, beneath me, above me, on my right, and on my left, until You bring me back to my family in safety. And when You do, do not drain me of Your blessings, and suffice for me the needs of my family and Your creation."

When you reach the Gate of the Grain Merchants, look at the Kaaba and prostrate, asking Allah to accept from you and not make this the last encounter. As you walk away, say: "Returning, repenting, praising, and grateful to our Lord; seeking God, and returning to God. May God’s blessings and peace be upon Muhammad and his family abundantly. God suffices us, and He is the best disposer of affairs."

This translation includes interpretations and religious context relevant to the prayer's original meaning and practice.

text:
باب ثواب الأعمال عليك بقول: لا إله إلا الله، فإن من قالها دخل الجنة (1).
وقال رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - ليس على أصحاب لا إله إلا الله وحشة في قبورهم، كأني أنظر إليهم ينفضون رؤوسهم ويقولون: الحمد لله الذي صدقنا وعده (2).
وقال - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -: ما من عبد مسلم يقول: لا إله إلا الله يمد بها صوته فيفرغ، حتى تتناثر ذنوبه تحت قدميه، كما يتناثر ورق الشجر منها (3).
وعليك بقول: أشهد أن لا إله إلا الله وحده لا شريك له، إلها واحدا أحدا صمدا، لم يتخذ صاحبة ولا ولدا، فإن من قاله (4) كتب الله له خمسا وأربعين ألف ألف حسنة، ومحى عنه خمسا وأربعين ألف ألف سيئة، ورفع له خمسا وأربعين ألف ألف درجة، وكان كمن قرأ القرآن اثني عشر مرة، وبنى الله له بيتا في الجنة (5).

translation:
Chapter on the Reward of Deeds
Adhere to saying: "There is no deity but Allah," for whoever says it shall enter Paradise (1).
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said, "There is no desolation for the companions of 'There is no deity but Allah' in their graves, as if I can see them shaking their heads and saying: Praise be to Allah, who fulfilled His promise to us." (2)
He (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) also said: "No Muslim servant says: 'There is no deity but Allah,' prolonging his voice until he finishes, except that his sins scatter under his feet, just as leaves scatter from a tree." (3)
And adhere to saying: "I bear witness that there is no deity but Allah, alone, having no partner, one God, eternal, who did not take a consort nor a child." For whoever says it (4), Allah writes for him forty-five billion rewards, erases forty-five billion sins from him, elevates him forty-five billion degrees, and it is as if he has recited the Qur'an twelve times, and Allah builds him a house in Paradise (5).

1 - Rewards of Deeds: 22, in various narrations, as well as in Bihar: 3/13, Hadith 29 from Al-Ghawali Al-La'ali. Also in Al-Mahasin: 34, Hadith 27, Al-Tawhid: 20, Hadith 8, and 22, Hadith 15, and so on in others.
2 - Referenced from Al-Wasa'il: 7/215 - Chapters of Remembrance - Chapter 45, Hadith 3. See also Al-Mahasin: 34, Hadith 27.
3 - Referenced from Al-Wasa'il: 7/215 - Chapters of Remembrance - Chapter 45, continuations of Hadith 3, and in Hadith 1 and continuations of Hadith 2 from Rewards of Deeds: 20, Hadith 1, and in Al-Tawhid: 22, continuation of Hadith 14 similarly. Also in Makarem Al-Akhlaq: 325 similarly.
4 - This specific wording is according to "Kh L Sh" and in other versions, it reads "says it".

text:
ورويت أنه جاء جبرئيل - عليه السلام - إلى النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - فقال: يا محمد، طوبى لمن قال من أمتك: لا إله إلا الله، وحده وحده وحده (1).
ورويت أنه من قال في كل يوم ثلاثين مرة: لا إله إلا الله الملك الحق المبين، استقبل الغنى، واستدبر الفقر، وقرع باب الجنة (2).
وعليك بالتكبير عند المساء، فإني رويت أنه من كبر الله عند المساء مائة مرة كان كمن أعتق مائة نسمة (3).
وعليك بقول: سبحان الله وبحمده، سبحان الله العظيم، فإنه من قال ذلك من غير تعجب، محى الله عنه ألف سيئة، وأثبت له ألف حسنة، وكتب الله (4) له ألف شفاعة، ورفعت له ألف درجة، وخلق الله من تلك الكلمة طيرا أبيض يقول: سبحان الله وبحمده، سبحان الله العظيم، ويذكر لقائلها (5).
وعليك بكثرة التحميد، فما أنعم الله على عبد نعمة صغرت أو (6) كبرت

translation:
Gabriel - peace be upon him - came to the Prophet - peace and blessings be upon him and his family - and said: O Muhammad, blessed are those of your community who say: "There is no god but Allah, alone, alone, alone" (1).

It is narrated that whoever says thirty times every day: "There is no god but Allah, the Sovereign, the Clear Truth," will face prosperity, turn away from poverty, and knock on the gates of Paradise (2).

And you should commit to saying "Allahu Akbar" (Allah is the Greatest) in the evening, for it is narrated that whoever says it one hundred times in the evening, it is as if they have freed one hundred slaves (3).

And you should frequently say: "Subhan Allah wa bihamdihi, Subhan Allah al-'Azim" (Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him, Glory be to Allah, the Almighty), for whoever says this without arrogance, Allah will erase from them a thousand sins, record for them a thousand good deeds, grant them a thousand intercessions, elevate them by a thousand degrees, and create from this phrase a white bird that says: "Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him, Glory be to Allah, the Almighty," and it will speak on behalf of the one who said it (5).

And you should engage in much "Tahmid" (praising Allah), for whatever blessing Allah bestows upon a servant, whether it is small or (6) great...

text:
فقال: الحمد لله (رب العالمين) (1) إلا أدى شكرها (2).
وعليك بالاستغفار، فإنه روي (3) عن أبي عبد الله، وآبائه - عليهم السلام - أنه قال: من استغفر الله عز وجل في يوم مائة مرة غفر الله له سبعمائة ذنب، (ولا خير في عبد يذنب في يوم سبعمائة ذنب) (4) (5).
وعليك بهذا الدعاء: الحمد لله الذي علا فقهر، والحمد لله الذي بطن فخبر (والحمد لله الذي ملك فقدر) (6)، والحمد لله الذي يحيي الموتى، (ويميت الأحياء) (7) وهو على كل شيء قدير، فإن من قالها ثلاث مرات خرج من الذنوب كيوم (8) ولدته أمه (9).
وعليك بالدعاء فإنه يرد القضاء المبرم - وهو الموت -، ويزيد في العمر (10).
وعليك بصدقة السر فإنها تطفئ غضب الرب (11)، وتدفع ميتة السوء (12).

translation:
He said, "Praise be to Allah, the Lord of all worlds," except to have given thanks for it. And you should seek forgiveness, for it is reported from Abu Abdullah and his forefathers, peace be upon them, that he said: "Whoever seeks forgiveness from Allah Almighty a hundred times a day, Allah will forgive him seven hundred sins. And there is no good in a servant who sins seven hundred times a day."

You should also recite this supplication: "Praise be to Allah who is exalted and dominant, praise be to Allah who is hidden yet knowledgeable, praise be to Allah who possesses power and authority, praise be to Allah who gives life to the dead and causes the living to die, and He is capable of all things." Whoever says this three times will be free from sins as on the day his mother gave birth to him.

You should dedicate yourself to prayer, as it can avert decreed judgment — which is death — and increase lifespan. You should also give secret charity because it extinguishes the anger of the Lord and wards off a bad death.

ورويت أن الصدقة يدفع (1) بها عن الرجل الظلوم (2).
ورويت أن الله تبارك وتعالى قال: ما من شيء إلا وقد وكلت به شيئا إلا الصدقة، فإني أتولاها بيدي، أقبضها من صاحبها فأربيها له (3) عندي، كما يربي الرجل فصيله (4) وفلوه (5)، حتى يأتي يوم القيامة وهي له عندي أعظم من جبل أحد (6).
وقال رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -: باكروا بالصدقة فإن البلايا لا تتخطاها (7).
وعليك بالبر وصلة الرحم، فإنهما يزيدان في العمر، ويهونان الحساب (8).
وعليك بقول: لا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله، فان من قالها فقد فوض أمره إلى الله وحق على الله أن يكفيه (9).

translation:
It is narrated that charity protects (1) a person from oppression (2). It is also narrated that God Almighty said: "There is nothing that I have assigned to someone else except charity; I handle it with My own hands. I receive it from its giver and nurture it for them (3), just as a man nurtures his weaned camel (4) or foal (5), until the Day of Judgment when it will be greater in My presence than Mount Uhud (6)."

The Messenger of God, peace be upon him and his family, said: "Hasten to give charity, for calamities do not overtake it (7)."

Ensure to practice righteousness and maintain kinship ties, as these increase lifespan and ease the reckoning (8). 

Adopt the phrase: 'There is no might nor power except with God,' for whoever says it has entrusted their affair to God, and it is incumbent upon God to suffice them (9).

text:
وروي أن من قال: لا إله إلا الله، صرف الله عنه (تسعة وتسعين) (1) نوعا من أنواع البلايا أيسرها الخنق (2) (3).
وعليك بالصلاة على رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - فإني رويت أن رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - قال: أنا عند الميزان غدا (4)، فمن رجحت سيئاته على حسناته جئت بالصلاة علي حتى أثقل بها حسناته (5).
وروي عن أبي عبد الله - عليه السلام - أنه قال: كل دعاء محجوب عن السماء حتى يصلى (6) على محمد وآل محمد (7).
وعليك بصلة الرحم، فإنها تزيد في العمر (8)، حتى أن الرجل ليكون أجله ثلاث سنين، فيكون وصولا للرحم (9) فيزيد الله في عمره ثلاثين سنة فيجعلها ثلاثا وثلاثين سنة (10)، ويكون أجله ثلاثا وثلاثين سنة، فيكون قاطعا لرحمه فينقصه الله

translation:
It is narrated that whoever says, "There is no god but Allah," Allah will drive away ninety-nine types of calamities from him, the least of which is suffocation.

And you should send blessings upon the Messenger of Allah - may Allah bless him and his family - for it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah - may Allah bless him and his family - said: "I will be by the Balance tomorrow. Whoever has more bad deeds than good, I will come with the blessings upon me until those good deeds outweigh the bad."

It is also narrated from Abu Abdullah - peace be upon him - that he said: "Every prayer is veiled from the heavens until blessings are sent upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad."

You should also maintain kinship ties, as they increase one's lifespan. It is said that a man's life span could be three years, but if he is one who maintains kinship, Allah increases his life by thirty years, making it thirty-three years. Conversely, if a man's life span is supposed to be thirty-three years and he severs his kinship ties, Allah reduces it.

(Note: The text refers to various sources and narrations, including different phrasing/styles in certain manuscripts noted in the footnotes.)

text:
ثلاثين سنة ويجعل أجله ثلاث سنين (1).
وعليك بقضاء حوائج المؤمنين، فإني رويت أنه من مشى لأخيه المسلم في حاجة كتب الله له (2) بكل خطوة عشر حسنات، وحط عنه عشر سيئات، ورفع له عشر درجات، ويعدل عتق عشر رقبات، وكان أفضل من اعتكاف شهر (3) في المسجد وصيامه (4).
وعليك بادخال السرور على المؤمنين، فإنه روي (5) عن أبي عبد الله - عليه السلام - أنه قال: من أدخل على مؤمن سرورا فقد أدخله على الله، ومن آذى مؤمنا فقد آذى الله عز وجل في عرشه، والله ينتقم ممن ظلمه (6).
وقال أبو جعفر - عليه السلام -: ما من عبد مؤمن يكسو مؤمنا ثوبا من عرى إلا كساه الله عز وجل من الثياب الخضر، وما من مؤمن يكسو مؤمنا ثوبا وهو عنه مستغن إلا كان في حفظ الله (7) ما بقيت منه خرقة (8).

translation:
Over a period of thirty years and makes his period three years (1).  

And you should fulfill the needs of the believers, for I have narrated that whoever goes to fulfill a need for his Muslim brother, Allah writes for him (2) ten good deeds for each step, erases ten sins, raises him ten degrees in rank, and it is equivalent to the freeing of ten slaves. It is better than retreating in the mosque for a month (3) and fasting (4).  

And you should bring joy to the believers, for it is narrated (5) from Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, that he said: Whoever brings joy into the heart of a believer has brought it to Allah, and whoever harms a believer has harmed Allah Almighty on His throne, and Allah will avenge whoever wrongs him (6).  

Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, said: There is no believing servant who clothes another believer to cover his nakedness but that Allah will clothe him in green garments, and there is no believer who clothes another believer while he is in need except that he remains under Allah’s protection (7) as long as there remains a shred (8).

text:
وما من مؤمن يطعم مؤمنا إلا أطعمه الله من ثمار الجنة، وما من مؤمن يسقي مؤمنا من ظمأ إلا سقاه الله من الرحيق المختوم (1) (2).
وقال أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام -: إذا زار المسلم المسلم قيل له: أيها الزائر طبت وطابت لك الجنة (3).
وقال - عليه السلام -: من ستر على أخيه عورة ستر الله عورته يوم القيامة (4).
وقال - عليه السلام -: أيما مسلم أقال مسلما في (1) بيع ندامة، أقاله (2) الله عز وجل عثرته يوم القيامة (3).
وعليكم (4) بتوقير المشايخ منكم، فإن من عرف فضل كبير لشيبته فوقره، آمنه الله من فزع (5) يوم القيامة (6).

translation:
There is no believer who feeds another believer except that Allah will provide him with fruits from Paradise. And there is no believer who gives another believer a drink to quench his thirst except that Allah will give him a drink from the sealed nectar. 

Abu Abdullah - peace be upon him - said: When a Muslim visits another Muslim, it is said to him, "Oh visitor, may you be good and may Paradise be open for you."

He also said - peace be upon him: Whoever conceals a fault of his brother, Allah will conceal his faults on the Day of Judgment.

Moreover, he said - peace be upon him: Any Muslim who releases another Muslim from a regretted sale, Allah, the Exalted, will remove his stumbling on the Day of Judgment.

And you (all) should respect your elders, for whoever recognizes the merit of an elder's gray hair and respects him, Allah will secure him from the fear of the Day of Judgment.

باب (1) النكاح إن الله تبارك وتعالى أنزل على آدم حوراء من الجنة، فأنكحها بعض ولده وأنكح إبنا له آخر ابنة (2) الجان، فما كان في الناس من جمال (أو حسن خلق) (3) فهو من الحوراء، وما كان فيهم من سوء خلق أو غضب فمن الجان (4).
وعليك بالتزويج، فإن رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - قال: من سره أن يلقى الله طاهرا مطهرا (5) فليلقه بزوجة، ومن ترك التزويج مخافة العيلة (6) فقد أساء الظن بالله (7).
(وقال - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -: من تزوج أحرز نصف دينه، فليتق الله في النصف الباقي) (8) (9).

translation:
Chapter (1) Marriage

Indeed, Allah the Blessed and Exalted sent down to Adam a maiden from Paradise, and Adam married her to one of his children and gave another son of his a daughter from the jinn to marry. Therefore, the beauty (or good nature) found among people comes from the maiden, while any ill-nature or anger comes from the jinn.

You should pursue marriage, for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: "Whoever wishes to meet Allah in a pure and immaculate state should meet Him with a spouse. Whoever avoids marriage out of fear of poverty (or penury) has an ill opinion of Allah."

The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, also said: "Whoever marries has secured half of his religion, so let him fear Allah regarding the remaining half." 

References to similar passages can be found in various Islamic texts such as "Al-Faqih," "Wasa'il al-Shi'a," "Bihar al-Anwar," and "Al-Kafi." These references discuss the implications and importance of marriage in Islam, highlighting how it fulfills a significant part of one's faith.

text:
فإذا أردت التزويج فصل ركعتين، واحمد الله وارفع يديك، وقل: اللهم إني أريد أن أتزوج فقدر لي من النساء أعفهن فرجا، وأحسنهن خلقا، وأحفظهن لي في نفسها ومالي، وأوسعهن رزقا، وأعظمهن بركة، وقيض (1) لي منها ولدا طيبا تجعله لي (2) خلفا صالحا في حياتي وبعد موتي (3).
وإذا دخلت (4) عليك فخذ بناصيتها، واستقبل بها القبلة، وقل: اللهم بأمانتك أخذتها، وبكلماتك (5) (استحللت فرجها) (6)، فإن قضيت لي منها ولدا فاجعله مباركا تقيا من شيعة آل محمد - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -، ولا تجعل للشيطان فيه شركا (7) ولا نصيبا (8).
وإذا أردت الجماع فقل: اللهم ارزقني ولدا، واجعله زكيا تقيا، ليس في خلقه زيادة ولا نقصان، واجعل عاقبته إلى الخير (9).
وإذا تزوجت فانظر أن لا يجاوز (10) مهرها مهر السنة، وهي خمسمائة درهم، فعلى هذا تزوج رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - نساءه، وعليه زوج بناته (11) (12).

translation:
If you wish to get married, perform two units of prayer, praise Allah, raise your hands, and say: "O Allah, I desire to marry, so decree for me from among the women the one who is the chaste in exit, the best in character, the most protective of me in herself and my wealth, the most abundant in provision, and the greatest in blessing. Ordain for me from her good offspring whom You make a righteous successor during my life and after my death."

When she comes to you, take hold of her forelock, face the qibla with her, and say: "O Allah, with Your trust I have taken her, and by Your words I have made her intimate with me. If You decree for me a child from her, make him blessed, pious, and among the followers of the household of Muhammad - peace and blessings be upon him and his family. Do not give Satan any share or part in him."

If you intend to have intercourse, say: "O Allah, bless me with a child, and make him righteous and devout, without any excess or deficiency in his creation, and make his end successful."

When you marry, ensure that her dowry does not exceed the dowry of the Sunnah, which is five hundred dirhams. Thus, the Messenger of Allah - peace and blessings be upon him and his family - married his wives, and thus he married off his daughters.

text:
وصار مهر السنة خمسمائة درهم، لأن الله تبارك وتعالى أوجب على نفسه ألا يكبر مؤمن مائة تكبيرة، ولا يسبحه (مائة تسبيحة) (1)، ولا يحمده مائة تحميدة، ولا يهلله مائة تهليلة، ولا يصلي على النبي وآله (2) مائة مرة، ثم يقول: اللهم زوجني من الحور العين، إلا زوجه الله حوراء من الجنة، وجعل ذلك مهرها (3).
واعلم أن النساء أربع: جامع مجمع، وربيع مربع، وكرب مقمع، وغل قمل (4).
جامع مجمع: أي كثيرة الخير مخصبة، وربيع مربع: التي في حجرها ولد وفي بطنها آخر، وكرب مقمع: أي سيئة الخلق مع زوجها، وغل قمل: أي هي عند زوجها كالغل القمل، وهو (غل من) (5) جلد فيه شعر، يقع فيه القمل فيأكله فلا يتهيأ (6) أن يحذر (7) منه شيئا، (وهو مثل للعرب) (8) (9).

translation:
The annual dowry has been set at five hundred dirhams because Allah, Blessed and Exalted, has promised Himself that if a believer praises Him a hundred times, glorifies Him a hundred times, praises Him a hundred times, exclaims His greatness a hundred times, or sends prayers upon the Prophet and his family a hundred times, and then says, "O Allah, marry me to the maidens of paradise," Allah will marry him to a maiden from paradise and that will be her dowry.

And know that there are four types of women: "a gathering of goodness," "a nurturing spring," "a distressing trouble," and "a tormenting shackle."

"A gathering of goodness" refers to a woman who is abundant in goodness and fertility. "A nurturing spring" is one who has a child in her care and another in her womb. "A distressing trouble" describes a woman who is ill-natured with her husband. "A tormenting shackle" is akin to a leather collar that harbors lice, and no care or caution can prevent it, which is a metaphor used by the Arabs.

Poem (1): Verily, women are created (2) diverse * He who finds a righteous one among them, he is blessed. Some of them are like the crescent moon when it appears * to its companion, and some are like darkness. Among them are bounty and passion * and one who stumbles upon them shall find no retaliation.

There are three types: A fertile, loving woman who helps her husband against the hardships of life for this world and the hereafter, and does not ally with life against him; a barren woman, neither beautiful nor virtuous, who aids her husband in nothing good; and a tumultuous woman (3): she is always quarreling with her husband. Then there is the woman who is frequently out of the house: the one who beautifies herself (4) and does not cover herself from men (5), never staying at home, whenever her husband seeks her, she is out; and a critical woman: one who speaks ill of others (7).

وقال النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - إياكم وخضراء الدمن، قيل: يا رسول الله وما خضراء الدمن (١)؟ قال:
المرأة الحسناء في منبت السوء (٢).
وكان رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - إذا أراد أن يتزوج امرأة بعث إليها، (وقال: شمي) (٣) ليتها فان طاب ليتها طاب عرفها، وإن درم كعبها عظم كعثبها (٤) (٥).
إعلم أن الليت: صفحة العنق، والعرف: رائحة العود وكل شيء طيب، ومنه قول الله عز وجل: ﴿عرفها لهم﴾ (6) أي طيبها لهم (7)، ومعنى قوله: درم كعبها، التي كثر لحم كعبها، ويقال: امرأة درماء، إذا كانت كثيرة لحم القدم والكعب، والكعثب: الفرج (8).
وقال أمير المؤمنين - عليه السلام -: تزوجوا عيناء (9) (سمراء عجزاء) (10) مربوعة، فان كرهتها فعلي الصداق (11).

translation:
The Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said, "Beware of the greenery of dung." It was asked, "O Messenger of Allah, what is the greenery of dung?" He replied, "A beautiful woman raised in a bad environment."

When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) intended to marry a woman, he would send for her and say, "Smell her neck. If her neck smells nice, her fragrance is pleasant. If her ankles are thick, her pudenda is muscular."

Understand that "neck" refers to the nape, and "fragrance" refers to the scent of incense and everything pleasant, as mentioned in Allah's words: "He introduced them to [its fragrance]" meaning He made it pleasant for them. The phrase "thick ankles" indicates a woman with fleshy feet and ankles, and "pudenda" refers to the private area.

Imam Ali (peace be upon him) said, "Marry wide-eyed, olive-skinned, full-figured women of moderate height. If you dislike her, I will take care of the dowry." 

(Note: The historical and cultural context of these sayings regard traditional views on marriage and women's attributes. These views are reflective of their time and may not align with contemporary perspectives.)

text:
وقال أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام -: النظر إلى المرأة الجميلة يقطع البلغم - يعني المرأة الجميلة (١) الحسنة الوجه - والنظر إلى المرأة السوء يهيج المرة (٢) السوداء - يعني السوءة السمجة القبيحة الوجه - (٣).
وإذا خطب إليك رجل رضيت دينه وخلقه (٤) وأمانته فزوجه، فإن الله يقول: (إن يكونوا فقراء يغنهم الله من فضله (٥)) (٦).
(وقال أبو جعفر - عليه السلام -:) (٧) إذا خطب إليكم رجل فرضيتم دينه وأمانته فزوجوه، و ﴿إلا تفعلوه تكن فتنة في الأرض وفساد كبير﴾ (٨) (٩).
ولا تتزوج الزانية ولا تزوج الزاني حتى (١٠) تعرف منهما التوبة، فإن الله عز وجل يقول: ﴿الزاني لا ينكح إلا زانية أو مشركة والزانية لا ينكحها إلا زان أو مشرك وحرم ذلك على المؤمنين﴾ (11) (12).

translation:
Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said: “Looking at a beautiful woman dispels phlegm,” meaning a woman with a good and pleasing face. “And looking at an ill-natured woman provokes black bile,” meaning a woman who has an unpleasant and unattractive face.

When a man whose religion, character, and trustworthiness you approve comes to propose marriage, marry him, for God says, “If they are poor, God will enrich them out of His bounty” [Surah An-Nur, 24:32].

Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, also said: “If a man proposes to you and you are pleased with his faith and trustworthiness, marry him, or else there will be a great tribulation and widespread corruption on earth.” [Surah Al-Anfal, 8:73].

Do not marry an adulterous woman or give an adulterous man in marriage until you ascertain their repentance. For God, the Almighty, says: “An adulterer marries none but an adulteress or an idolatress, and an adulteress only marries an adulterer or an idolater. And this is forbidden for the believers” [Surah An-Nur, 24:3].

ولا تتزوج بالمطلقات ثلاثا في مجلس واحد، فإنهن ذوات أزواج (1)، فان كنت (لابد فاعلا) (2)، فدعها حتى تطهر، ثم ائت زوجها ومعك رجلان، فقل له: قد طلقت فلانة؟ فإذا قال: نعم، فاتركها ثلاثة أشهر، ثم اخطبها إلى نفسك (3).
ولا تتزوج الناصبية (4)، ولا تزوج ابنتك ناصبيا (5) (6).
ولا بأس أن تتزوج في الشكاك، ولا تزوجهم، فإن (7) المرأة تأخذ من أدب زوجها، ويقهرها على دينه (8).

translation:
Do not marry a woman who has been divorced thrice in a single council session, as they are considered to have husbands. If you absolutely must do so, wait until she is purified, then go to her former husband with two witnesses and ask him, "Have you divorced so-and-so?" If he says, "Yes," then leave her for three months before proposing to her for marriage.

Do not marry a woman of Nasibi beliefs, and do not wed your daughter to a Nasibi. It is permissible, however, to marry those who are doubtful in faith, but do not give them in marriage, for a woman absorbs the character of her husband and he may compel her to follow his religion.

text:
ولا بأس بتزويج (اليهودية و) (1) النصرانية (2).
فان تزوجت يهودية [أو نصرانية] (3) فامنعها من شرب الخمر وأكل لحم الخنزير، واعلم أن عليك في دينك في تزويجك إياها غضاضة (4) (5).
وتزويج المجوسية محرم (6)، ولكن إذا كان للرجل أمة مجوسية فلا بأس أن يطأها، ويعزل عنها، ولا يطلب ولدها (7).
ولا يجوز لك أن تتزوج من أهل الكتاب ولا من الإماء إلا اثنتين، ولك أن تتزوج من الحرائر المسلمات أربعا (8).

translation:
It is permissible to marry a Jewish or Christian woman. If you marry a Jewish or [Christian] woman, prevent her from drinking wine and eating pork, and be aware that marrying her involves some disgrace in your faith.

Marriage to a Zoroastrian woman is forbidden, but if a man has a Zoroastrian concubine, it is permissible for him to have relations with her without seeking to have children with her.

You are not allowed to marry more than two women from the People of the Book or concubines, but you may marry up to four free Muslim women.

text:
ويتزوج العبد بحرتين أو أربع إماء (1).
ولا تتزوج (2) امرأة حتى تبلغ تسع سنين (3)، فان تزوجتها قبل أن تبلغ تسع سنين فأصابها عيب فأنت ضامن (4).
وإذا وضعت المرأة فلا بأس أن تتزوجها (5) من ساعته، ولكن لا (تدخل بها) (6) حتى تطهر (7).
وإذا ابتليت المرأة بشرب النبيذ فسكرت، فزوجت نفسها رجلا في سكرها، ثم أفاقت فأنكرت ذلك، ثم ظنت أن ذلك يلزمها فورعت منه، فأقامت مع الرجل على ذلك (8) التزويج، فإن التزويج واقع إذا أقامت معه بعد ما أفاقت، وهو رضاها

translation:
A servant may marry two free women or four female slaves. A woman should not be married off until she reaches the age of nine. If you marry her before she turns nine and she suffers a defect, you are responsible. If a woman gives birth, there is no problem in marrying her immediately, but do not consummate the marriage until she is purified. If a woman indulges in drinking wine and becomes intoxicated, then marries someone during her intoxication and later regains consciousness and denies the marriage, but then believes it is binding and remains with the man under that marriage, it is considered valid if she stays with him after regaining consciousness, indicating her consent.

These rulings appear in various Islamic legal texts, ensuring alignment with religious teachings and jurisprudence frameworks. References include works from sources such as Al-Mustadrak, Fiqh al-Ridha, and others, which discuss matters related to allowable numbers in marriages and the rules governing slave marriages, as well as precursors and impediments to marriage.

text:
والتزويج جائز عليها (1).
وإذا قال الرجل لأمته: أعتقتك (2) وجعلت (3) عتقك مهرك، فقد عتقت، وهي بالخيار إن شاءت تزوجته، وإن شاءت لم تتزوجه (4)، (فان تزوجته فليعطها شيئا) (5)، (وإن قال: قد تزوجتك وجعلت مهرك عتقك) (6)، فإن النكاح واجب (7)، ولا يعطها شيئا، وقد عتقت (8).
وإذا أعتقها وجعل عتقها صداقها، ثم طلقها قبل أن يدخل بها، فقد مضى عتقها، ويرتجع عليها سيدها بنصف (9) قيمة ثمنها، تسعى فيه، ولا عدة عليها منه (10).

translation:
Marriage is permissible for her.

If a man says to his female slave, "I have freed you and made your emancipation your dowry," she is freed and has the choice; if she wishes, she may marry him, and if she does not wish to, she need not marry him. If she marries him, he should give her something. However, if he says, "I have married you and made your dowry your emancipation," then the marriage is obligatory, and he is not required to give her anything, and she is freed.

If he frees her and makes her emancipation her dowry, and then divorces her before consummating the marriage, her emancipation is complete, but her master can reclaim half of her value, for which she must work to pay off, and there is no waiting period ('iddah) required from him.

References to various Islamic legal and historical texts are noted, which address these matters with slight variations in wording, indicating the legal discussions and interpretations of these rulings in Islamic jurisprudence.

وإذا تزوج الرجل جارية على أنها حرة، ثم جاء رجل فأقام البينة على أنها جاريته، فليأخذها وليأخذ (1) قيمة ولدها (2).
وإن تزوج الرجل امرأة فوجدها قرناء (3) أو عفلاء (4) أو برصاء أو مجنونة، أو كان بها زمانة (5) ظاهرة، كان له أن يردها إلى أهلها بغير طلاق، ويرتجع الزوج على وليها بما أصدقها إن كان أعطاها، وإن لم يكن أعطاها فلا شيء له (6).
وإن ابتلى رجل فلم يقدر على جماع امرأته، فرق بينهما إن شاءت (7).
وروي أنه تنتظر (8) به سنة، فان أتاها وإلا فارقته إن أحبت (9).

translation:
If a man marries a maiden under the premise that she is free, then another man comes forth with evidence proving that she is his slave, the latter may reclaim her and also demand the value of her child.

If a man marries a woman and discovers she has defects such as being unable to consummate the marriage, or has a physical deformity, leprosy, madness, or any evident ailment, he has the right to return her to her family without divorcing her. The husband can reclaim from her guardian whatever he gave her as a dowry if he had given her any. If he did not give her anything, he is entitled to nothing.

If a man is afflicted in a way that prevents him from consummating the marriage with his wife, separation is permissible if she desires it. It is narrated that they should wait one year; if he manages to consummate the marriage within this period, otherwise, she may choose to separate from him if she wishes. 

The scholarly references for these rulings are detailed in various classical Islamic texts, indicating their roots in historical legal discourse.

فان تزوج خصي امرأة وفرض لها صداقا، وهي تعلم أنه خصي فلا بأس، فان مكث معها حينا ثم طلقها فعليها العدة (1).
فإذا تزوج رجل (2) امرأة حرمت عليه ابنتها إذا دخل بالأم، فإن لم يكن دخل بالأم فلا بأس أن يتزوج الابنة، وإذا تزوج البنت فدخل بها أو لم يدخل فقد حرمت عليه الأم (3).

واعلم أن الربائب حرام، كن في الحجور أو لم يكن (5).

translation:
If a eunuch marries a woman and assigns her a dowry, and she is aware that he is a eunuch, there is no issue. If he stays with her for a while and then divorces her, she must observe the waiting period (iddah) (1).

When a man marries a woman, her daughter becomes forbidden to him if he has consummated the marriage with the mother. If he has not consummated the marriage with the mother, it is permissible for him to marry the daughter. However, if he marries the daughter and consummates the marriage with her or does not, the mother becomes prohibited to him (3).

It is narrated that the case is the same for both mother and daughter; if he has not consummated the marriage with either, the other is permissible for him (4).

Be aware that stepdaughters are prohibited, whether they were under his guardianship or not (5).

وإن تزوجت حرة مملوكا على أنه حر، ثم علمت بعد ذلك أنه مملوك، فهي أملك بنفسها، إن شاءت أقرت معه، وإن شاءت فلا، فإن كان (2) دخل بها فلها الصداق، وإن لم يكن دخل بها فليس لها شيء، وإن دخل بها بعد ما علمت أنه مملوك وأقرت معه، فهو أملك بها (3).

translation:
If a eunuch deceives a woman by hiding that he is a eunuch, they are to be separated, and she is entitled to retrieve her bridal gift, and he shall be punished physically.

If a free woman marries a slave believing him to be free, and later discovers he is a slave, she holds the choice over her own situation; she may remain with him if she wishes or leave him. If he has consummated the marriage with her, she is entitled to keep the bridal gift. However, if he has not consummated the marriage, she is entitled to nothing. If she continues to live with him after learning he is a slave and consents to the union, he retains the authority over her.

If a man marries a slave woman under the belief that she is free, and she has concealed her true status, should the one who arranged the marriage be her guardian, he can reclaim what was taken from him. The guardians of the woman are entitled to a tenth of her value if she is a virgin; if she is not, they are owed half of that tenth for the benefits taken from her. She is required to observe the waiting period for a slave before remarrying. If she bears a child, he is considered legitimate.

The references indicate various sources of these rulings, each providing slight variations in the descriptions or requirements.

حر إذا كان النكاح بغير إذن المولى (1).
وإن أبقت مملوكة من مواليها، فأتت قبيلة فادعت أنها حرة، فتزوجها رجل فظفر بها مواليها بعد ذلك وقد ولدت أولادا، فإن أقام الزوج البينة على أنه تزوجها على أنها حرة، أعتق ولدها وذهب القوم بأمتهم، وإن لم يقم البينة، أوجع ظهره واسترق ولده (2).

A person is free if the marriage is contracted without the master's permission (1).

If a female slave escapes from her masters and goes to a tribe, claiming to be free, and a man marries her, but her masters later find her and she has given birth to children, if the husband provides evidence that he married her believing she was free, her child will be freed, and the masters will take back their slave. If he cannot present evidence, he will be punished, and his child will be enslaved (2).

It is important to note that a marriage can only be annulled for four reasons (3): leprosy, insanity, madness, and severe deformity (4)(5). However, it is narrated in hadith that blindness and lameness are also grounds for annulment (6).

وإذا تزوج الرجل المرأة الثيب فزعمت أنه لم يقربها، فالقول في ذلك قول الزوج، وعليه أن يحلف بالله لقد جامعها لأنها المدعية، وإن تزوجها وهي بكر فزعمت أنه لم يصل إليها، فإن مثل هذا تعرفه النساء، فلينظر إليها من يوثق به منهن، فان ذكرت أنها عذراء فعلى الإمام أن يؤجله سنة، فان وصل إليها وإلا فرق بينهما، وأعطيت نصف الصداق، ولا عدة عليها منه (1).
وإذا تزوج الرجل المرأة وابتلي ولم يقدر على الجماع، فارقته إن شاءت (2).
والعنين يتربص به سنة، ثم إن شاءت امرأته تزوجت، وإن شاءت أقامت (3).
وسئل الصادق - عليه السلام - عن أختين اهديتا لأخوين في ليلة واحدة، فأدخلت (4) امرأة هذا على هذا، وامرأة هذا على هذا، قال: فلكل واحد منهما الصداق بالغشيان، فإن كان وليهما تعمد ذلك أغرم الصداق، ولا يقرب واحد (5) منهما امرأته حتى تنقضي العدة، فإذا انقضت العدة صارت كل واحدة منهما إلى زوجها الأول بالنكاح الأول.
قيل له (6): فان ماتتا قبل انقضاء العدة؟ قال - عليه السلام -: يرجع الزوجان بنصف الصداق على ورثتهما فيرثانهما الرجلان.

translation:
If a man marries a woman who has been previously married and she claims that he has not been intimate with her, then the man's statement is taken as true, and he must swear by God that he has consummated the marriage, as she is the one making the claim. However, if he married her when she was a virgin and she claims he did not reach her, such matters are known by women. A trustworthy woman should be asked to examine her, and if it is determined that she is still a virgin, the imam should give a period of one year. If he consummates the marriage within that time, all is well; if not, they should be separated, and she is entitled to half of the dowry, with no waiting period required for her from him.

If a man marries a woman and is afflicted with an inability to consummate the marriage, she may choose to separate from him.

Regarding a man who is impotent, he is given a year to recover. If after that time his wife wishes to marry another, she may do so, or she may choose to remain with him.

Al-Sadiq (peace be upon him) was asked about two sisters who were given in marriage to two brothers on the same night, but each woman was mistakenly sent to the other's husband. For each of them, the dowry is due upon consummation. If their guardians intentionally caused this mix-up, the dowry is taken from them. Neither man should be intimate with either woman until the waiting period ends. When the waiting period has ended, each woman returns to her original and rightful husband from the first marriage.

He was asked: what if they die before the waiting period ends? He (peace be upon him) said: the husbands return half of the dowry from the inheritance of the wives, and the husbands are the heirs.

قيل: فان مات الزوجان وهما في العدة؟ قال - عليه السلام -: ترثانهما، ولهما نصف المهر المسمى، وعليهما العدة، ثم (1) بعد ما تفرغان من العدة الأولى تعتدان عدة المتوفى عنها زوجها (2).
وإذا أتى الرجل قوما فخطب إليهم وقال: أنا فلان بن فلان، من بني فلان فوجد على غير ذلك، إما دعي (3) وإما عبد لقوم (4)، فإن عليا - عليه السلام - قضى في رجل له ابنتان، إحداهما لمهيرة (5)، والأخرى (لأم ولد) (6)، فزوج ابنة المهيرة، حتى إذا كان ليلة البناء، أدخل عليه ابنة أم الولد فوقع عليها، إنها ترد عليه امرأته التي تزوج، وترد هذه على أبيها، ويكون مهرها على أبيها (7).

translation:
It was said: If the spouses die while one of them is in the waiting period ('iddah), he (peace be upon him) said: They inherit from each other, and they are entitled to half of the named dowry, and they must observe the waiting period. Then (1), after they complete the first waiting period, they observe the waiting period for the wife whose husband has passed away (2).

If a man goes to a people and proposes, claiming to be so-and-so, from such-and-such tribe, and it is found otherwise, either he is falsely claiming lineage (3) or is a slave belonging to some people (4), then Ali (peace be upon him) ruled concerning a man who had two daughters, one of free lineage (5), and the other (the daughter of a slave woman) (6). He married off the daughter of free lineage, but when it was the night of consummation, he brought the daughter of the slave woman, and he consummated the marriage with her. In such a case, he would return to him the wife he married, and the other would go back to her father, and her dowry would be upon her father (7).

If a man wishes to marry off his daughter to another man, but her paternal grandfather wishes to marry her off to someone else, the right of marriage belongs to the grandfather, and the father does not have any say in the matter (8), (if her father marries her off to…).

رجل وزوجها جدها من رجل آخر) (1)، فالتزويج للذي زوجها أولا (2).
ولا بأس بأن تتزوج الحرة على الأمة، ولا تتزوج الأمة على الحرة، فان من تزوج أمة على حرة فنكاحه باطل (3).
وإذا تزوجت الحرة على الأمة فاقسم للحرة ضعف (4) ما تقسم للأمة، تكون عند الحرة ليلتين وعند الأمة ليلة (5).
وإذا اشترى الرجل جارية لم تحض، ولم يكن صاحبها يطأها (6)، فإن أمرها شديد، فان أتاها فلا ينزل حتى يتبين أحبلى هي أم لا؟ ويستبين (7) ذلك في خمس (8) وأربعين ليلة (9).

translation:
A man and her husband, who is her grandfather from another man, so the marriage is valid for the one who married her first. 

There is no harm in a free woman marrying a slave woman, but a slave woman cannot marry a free woman. If a man marries a slave woman while having a free wife, the marriage is invalid. 

If a free woman is married to a slave woman, the free woman should be given twice the allowance of nights compared to the slave woman, meaning she stays with the free woman for two nights and with the slave woman for one night. 

If a man buys a girl who has not yet menstruated and her previous owner did not have marital relations with her, it is a serious matter. If he chooses to approach her, he should not engage in intercourse until it is clear whether she is pregnant or not, which can be determined after forty-five days. 

References are given to clarifications and legal rulings in Islamic jurisprudence texts such as Al-Kafi, Al-Faqih, and Al-Tahdhib, as well as other works.

text:
ولا يصلح (1) (للأعرابي أن يتزوج مهاجرة يخرج بها من أرض الهجرة فينفرد بها) (2)، إلا أن يكون من قوم قد عرفوا السنة والهيئة، فان أقام بها في أرض الهجرة فهو مهاجر (3).
ولا بأس أن يحل الرجل لأخيه فرج جاريته (4).
واعلم أن النصراني إذا أسلمت امرأته فهو أملك ببضعها، وليس له أن يخرجها (5) من دار (الإسلام إلى دار) (6) الهجرة، وإن كانت بأرض (7) أخرى أتت دار الإسلام (8)، ولا يبيت معها النصراني في دار الهجرة، ويأتيها بالنهار إن شاء (9).
وإن هي ولدت وكبر ولدها فإنهم يخيرون على (10) الإسلام والكفر، فان اختاروا الإسلام فهي أحق بهم، وليس له أن يجبرهم على أي (11) شيء (12).
وإذا أسلمت المرأة وزوجها على غير الإسلام، فإن كان مجوسيا فرق

text:
بينهما (1).
ولا بأس إذا كان للرجل امرأتان أن يفضل إحداهما على الأخرى (2).
وإذا ولت امرأة أمرها رجلا، فقالت: زوجني فلانا، فقال: لا أزوجك (3) حتى تشهدي أن أمرك بيدي، فأشهدت له، فقال عند التزويج للذي يخطبها: يا فلان، عليك كذا وكذا؟ قال: نعم، فقال هو للقوم:
اشهدوا أن ذلك لها عندي، وقد زوجتها نفسي (4)، فقالت المرأة: ما كنت لأتزوجك ولا كرامة، ولا أمري إلا بيدي، وما (5) وليتك أمري إلا حياء من الكلام، فإنها تنزع منه، ويوجع رأسه (6).
ولا تتزوج والقمر في العقرب، فإنه من فعل ذلك لم ير الحسنى (7).

translation:
Between them (1).  

It is not objectionable if a man has two wives and favors one over the other (2).  

If a woman appoints a man to handle her affairs and says, "Marry me to so-and-so," and he replies, "I will not marry you until you testify that your matter is in my hands," and she testifies to him, and when arranging the marriage, he says to the one proposing to her, "O so-and-so, such and such is upon you?" and he replies, "Yes," he then says to the people, "Bear witness that this is upon her from me, and I have married her to myself (4)." Then, the woman says, "I would not marry you, no honor, and my matter is only in my hands, and I only entrusted you with my affair out of shyness of speaking." In this case, she can withdraw from him, and it causes him distress (6).  

Do not marry during the moon in Scorpio, for whoever does so will not see good (7).

ولا تجامع في أول الشهر، وفي وسطه، وفي آخره، فإنه من فعل ذلك فليسلم لسقط الولد، وإن تم أوشك أن يكون مجنونا، أما ترى أن المجنون أكثر ما يصرع في أول الشهر، ووسطه، وآخره؟ (1)، ولا تجامع مستقبل القبلة، ولا مستدبرها (2)، ولا تجامع في السفينة (3).
ولا تجامع عند طلوع الشمس وعند غروبها، ولا تجامع في اليوم الذي تنكسف فيه الشمس، ولا في الليلة التي ينكسف فيها القمر، ولا في الزلزلة، والريح الصفراء، والسوداء، والحمراء، فإنه من فعل ذلك وقد بلغه الحديث رأى في ولده ما يكره (4).
ولا تجامع في شهر رمضان بالنهار، فإنه من فعل ذلك كان عليه عتق رقبة أو

translation:
Do not engage in marital relations at the beginning of the month, in the middle, or at the end, for whoever does so, may a miscarriage occur to the child. And if the pregnancy is completed, the child might be prone to madness. Do you not see that lunacy often strikes at the beginning, middle, or end of the month? Do not engage in marital relations facing the Qibla, nor with your back to it. Do not engage in marital relations on a ship.

Do not engage in marital relations at sunrise or sunset, nor on the day the sun is eclipsed, or the night the moon is eclipsed, or during an earthquake, yellow wind, black wind, or red wind. Whoever does so, having heard this tradition, may see undesirable traits in their child.

Do not engage in marital relations during the daylight hours of Ramadan. Whoever does so must either free a slave...

text:
صيام شهرين متتابعين أو إطعام ستين مسكينا، لكل مسكين مد من طعام، وعليه قضاء ذلك اليوم، وأنى له بمثله؟ (1).
ولا بأس أن تجامع في شهر رمضان بالليل (2)، وتغتسل قبل أن تنام (3).
وإذا كنت في سفر وجب عليك فيه التقصير في شهر رمضان (4)، فلا تجامع لحرمة شهر رمضان (5)، وإن فعلت (فليس عليك شيء) (6) (7).

translation:
Fasting for two consecutive months, or feeding sixty poor people, giving each person a measure of food, and one must make up the missed day. But how can one find an equivalent for it? (1).

It is permissible to have intercourse during the night in the month of Ramadan (2), and one should perform ablution before sleeping (3).

If you are traveling, you must shorten your prayers during Ramadan (4), so do not engage in intercourse out of respect for the sanctity of the month (5). If you do (there is no penalty on you) (6) (7).

ولا تجامع امرأة (١) حائضا، فإن الله تبارك وتعالى نهى عن ذلك فقال (٢): ﴿ولا تقربوهن حتى يطهرن﴾ (3) عنى بذلك الغسل من (4) الحيض (5).
وإن جامعتها وهي حائض في أول الحيض فعليك أن تتصدق بدينار، وإن كان في وسطه فنصف دينار، وإن كان في آخره فربع دينار (6).
وإن جامعت أمتك وهي حائض تصدقت بثلاثة أمداد من طعام (7).
وإن كنت شبقا (8) وقد طهرت المرأة، وأردت أن تجامعها قبل الغسل، فمرها أن تغسل فرجها، ثم افعل (9).
وإن ادعت المرأة على زوجها أنه عنين، وأنكر الرجل أن يكون ذلك، فإن الحكم فيه أن يقعد الرجل في ماء بارد، فان استرخى ذكره فهو عنين، وإن تشنج فليس بعنين (10).
واعلم أن الظهار على وجهين: أحدهما، أن يقول الرجل لامرأته: هي عليه

translation: Do not engage in intimate relations with a menstruating woman, for God, blessed and exalted be He, has forbidden this, as stated: "Do not approach them until they have purified themselves" [Quran 2:222], meaning the purification from menstruation. If you have intimate relations with a woman who is menstruating at the beginning of her period, you must give charity equal to a dinar, if in the middle, half a dinar, and if at the end, a quarter dinar. If you engage with your slave woman during her menstruation, give charity equivalent to three measures of food. If you are overcome with desire and the woman has become pure, and you wish to engage with her before she has washed, instruct her to wash her private area, and then proceed. If a woman claims her husband is impotent and the man denies it, the judgment requires the man to sit in cold water; if his member becomes flaccid, he is impotent; if it becomes tense, he is not. Be aware that Zihar (a form of divorce) has two forms: one is when a man says to his wife: "She is like...".

text:
كظهر أمه ويسكت (1)، فعليه الكفارة من قبل أن يجامع (2)، فان جامع من قبل أن يكفر لزمته كفارة أخرى، ومتى جامع (من قبل أن يكفر لزمته كفارة أخرى) (3)، فإن قال: هي عليه كظهر أمه إن فعل كذا وكذا، أو (4) فعلت كذا وكذا، فليس عليه الكفارة حتى يفعل ذلك الشيء ويجامع، فتلزمه الكفارة إذا فعل ما حلف عليه (5).
فإن طلقها سقطت عنه الكفارة، فان راجعها لزمته، فان تركها حتى يمضي (6) أجلها، وتزوجها رجل آخر وطلقها، وأراد الأول أن يتزوجها لم تلزمه الكفارة (7).
والكفارة: تحرير رقبة، فمن لم يجد فصيام شهرين متتابعين من قبل أن يتماسا، فمن (8) لم يستطع فاطعام ستين مسكينا، لكل مسكين مد، فإن لم يجد تصدق بما يطيق (9).

translation:
If one compares his wife to his mother's back and remains silent, he must offer expiation before having intercourse. If he has intercourse before expiating, he is obliged to offer another expiation each time he does so before expiating. Should he say, “She is to me as the back of my mother if I do such and such,” or “if I did such and such,” he is not required to offer expiation until he does that specific thing and has intercourse, at which point expiation becomes obligatory upon fulfilling what he vowed.

If he divorces her, the expiation obligation is lifted. If he reconciles with her, it becomes obligatory again. However, if he leaves her until her waiting period ends, and she marries another man and is then divorced, if the first husband wishes to remarry her, he is not obliged to expiate.

The expiation involves freeing a slave, and if that is not possible, fasting for two consecutive months before having any intimate contact. If one is unable to fast, feeding sixty needy people, giving each a measure of food, is required. If he cannot afford that, he should give in charity according to his means. 

These legal rulings are discussed in detail within Islamic jurisprudence sources such as "Fiqh al-Rida," "Al-Faqih," "Tahdhib," "Istibsar," and corroborated by other traditions.

وروي أن أبا عبد الله - عليه السلام - قال: إذا قال الرجل لامرأته: هي عليه كظهر أمه، فليس عليه شيء (إذا لم) (2) ينو بذلك التحريم (3).
وقال أبو جعفر - عليه السلام -: ما أحب للرجل (4) المسلم (5) أن يتزوج ضرة (6) كانت لأمه مع غير أبيه (7).
وإذا تزوج الرجل امرأة على حكمها أو على حكمه، فمات قبل أن يدخل بها، فلها المتعة والميراث، ولا مهر لها، وإن طلقها لم يجاوز بحكمها عليه (8) خمسمائة درهم مهور نساء النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - (9).

In another narration, it is stated that if a person cannot afford to feed sixty poor people, they should fast for eighteen days.

It is also narrated that Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said: "If a man tells his wife, 'You are to me like my mother's back,' he owes nothing unless he intends by that to prohibit her."

Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, said: "I do not encourage a Muslim man to marry a co-wife who was once married to his mother along with someone other than his father."

If a man marries a woman under her condition or his and dies before consummating the marriage, she is entitled to maintenance and inheritance, but not a dower. If he divorces her, he must not exceed her condition upon him, which is five hundred dirhams, similar to the dowers of the women of the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family.

translation:
If you love a woman and your parents prefer someone else, marry the one you love and leave the one your parents favor. There is no harm for a man to marry a woman with whom he has committed adultery; this is like a man who stole dates from a palm tree and then bought them afterwards. If he committed adultery with her mother, there is no objection to marrying her daughter, her sister, or her after the mother. If he has a wife and then marries her mother, daughter, or sister and consummates the marriage, upon realizing the mistake, he must separate from the latter, and his first wife remains his own. He should not approach her until the womb of the woman he separated from is cleared.

If a man commits adultery with his father's wife, his son's wife, or with his father's or son's slave girl, this does not prohibit the woman from her husband, nor does it make the slave girl forbidden to her master. This prohibition applies only when the action was permissible. If it is permissible, that slave girl is never lawful for his son anymore.

ولا تحل القابلة للمولود ولا ابنتها، وهي كبعض أمهاته (9).

translation:
Permissible (halal) relationships do not extend to the son or the father. If a man marries a woman and commits adultery with her before consummating the marriage, she becomes impermissible for him because he is considered an adulterer. They must be separated, and he is entitled to give her half of the dowry.

In another narration, the adulterer is subjected to the legal punishment, his head is shaved, he is separated from his wife, and he is exiled for a year. If a woman commits adultery before the man consummates the marriage with her, they must be separated, and she is not entitled to the dowry since the wrongdoing originates from her side.

Furthermore, the midwife is not permissible for the newborn nor her daughter, as she is akin to one of the mothers.

References from religious texts are cited throughout, indicating sources from various collections such as "Al-Kafi," "Al-Faqih," "Tahdhib," among others, which contribute to these rulings.

وفي حديث آخر: إن قبلت ومرت فالقوابل أكثر من ذلك، وإن قبلت وربت حرمت عليه (1).
وإذا تزوج الرجل المرأة فأرخى الستر، وأغلق الباب، ثم أنكرا جميعا المجامعة (2) فلا يصدقان، لأنها تدفع عن نفسها العدة، ويدفع عن نفسه المهر (3).

وإذا نظر الرجل إلى امرأة نظر شهوة، ونظر منها إلى ما يحرم على غيره، لم تحل لأبيه (8)، ولا لابنه (9) (10).
وإذا تزوج الرجل في مرضه ودخل بها ورثته، وإن لم يدخل بها لم ترثه،

translation:
In another narration: If she consents and it passes, then midwives are more than that; and if she consents and raises, it is forbidden for him. 

When a man marries a woman, draws the curtain, and closes the door, then both deny consummation, they are not to be believed, because she may be trying to avoid the waiting period ('iddah), and he may be trying to avoid paying the dowry. 

It is not permissible for a person in the state of Ihram (ritual consecration during pilgrimage) to marry or arrange marriage for someone not in Ihram. If he marries while in Ihram, they are to be separated, and she is never lawful for him. 

If a man looks at a woman with lustful intent and sees what is unlawful for others to see, she does not become lawful for his father or son.

If a man marries while ill and consummates the marriage, she inherits from him. If he does not consummate the marriage, she does not inherit from him.

ونكاحه باطل (1).
وإذا تزوج الرجل امرأة بألف درهم، فأعطاها عبدا له آبقا وبردا (2) حبرة بالألف التي أصدقها، فلا بأس بذلك إذا هي قبضت الثوب ورضيت بالعبد، فان طلقها قبل أن يدخل بها فلا مهر لها، وترد عليه خمسمائة درهم، ويكون العبد (3) لها (4).
وإذا تزوج الرجل امرأة في عدتها ولم يعلم، وكانت هي قد علمت أنه قد (5) بقي من عدتها، ثم قذفها بعد علمه بذلك، فان كانت علمت (أن الذي عملت محرم) (6) عليها، فقدمت (7) على ذلك، فإن عليها الحد حد الزاني، ولا أرى على زوجها حين قذفها شيئا، فان فعلت بجهالة منها، ثم قذفها ضرب قاذفها الحد، وفرق بينهما، وتعتد من عدتها الأولى، وتعتد بعد ذلك عدة كاملة (8).
ولا تنكح المرأة (9) على عمتها، ولا على خالتها، ولا على ابنة أختها، ولا على ابنة أخيها، ولا على أختها من الرضاعة (10).

translation:
Marriage to such a woman is invalid (1).
If a man marries a woman with a dowry of a thousand dirhams and gives her a runaway slave and a striped cloak (2) as the thousand dirhams, there is no problem with this if she accepts the cloak and consents to the slave. However, if he divorces her before consummating the marriage, she is entitled to no dowry but must return five hundred dirhams to him, and the slave (3) shall belong to her (4).

If a man marries a woman during her waiting period without knowing, and she was aware that her waiting period (5) had not yet ended, and then he accuses her after knowing this, if she knew that what she did was forbidden (6) and still proceeded (7) with it, she is liable to the penalty for adultery, and I see no fault on the husband when he accused her. However, if she acted out of ignorance and he accuses her, the accuser shall be punished with the penalty, they are to be separated, and she must complete her waiting period from the first marriage and then observe a full waiting period thereafter (8).

A woman may not be married (9) to her paternal or maternal aunt, nor may she be married to her niece, whether the daughter of her sister or brother, nor to her milk-sister (10).

وتزوج (1) الخالة على ابنة أختها (2).
وإذا كان للرجل امرأتان، فولدت كل واحدة منهما غلاما، فانطلقت إحدى امرأتيه فأرضعت جارية من عرض الناس، فلا ينبغي لابنه الآخر أن يتزوج بهذه الجارية (3).
وإذا حلبت المرأة من لبنها، فأسقت زوجها (لتحرم عليه) (4)، فليمسكها، وليضرب (5) ظهرها، ولا تحرم عليه (6).
وإذا (7) أرضعت امرأتك من لبن ولدك ولد امرأة أخرى فهو حرام (8).
وإذا أرضعت المرأة جارية ولزوجها ابن من غيرها، لم يجز للابن تزويجها (9).

translation:
If a man has two wives and each has given birth to a son, and one of the wives goes to nurse a girl from among the people, it is not permissible for the other son to marry this girl.

If a woman nurses another woman's child with her milk, which was intended for her own child, the act is forbidden.

If a woman expresses her milk and gives it to her husband with the intention of making it unlawful for him, he should keep her as his wife and discipline her, as this does not make her forbidden to him.

If a woman breastfeeds another woman's child and the woman has a son from another wife, her son is not permitted to marry the girl.

This text includes references and annotations indicating various sources like "Nawadir Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Issa," "Al-Bihar," "Al-Faqih," "Al-Tahdhib," "Al-Istibsar," and "Al-Kafi," along with annotations on variations found in other texts or editions. Each annotation is connected to discussions about the regulations concerning breastfeeding and marital relationships as per Islamic jurisprudence.

translation:
The following passage explores the conditions under which breastfeeding establishes prohibitions in Islamic jurisprudence:

"Breastfeeding only creates prohibitions if it results in the growth of flesh and the strengthening of bones."

Abu Ja'far - peace be upon him - was asked if there is a specific limit to this, and he replied: "Breastfeeding does not prohibit unless it occurs for a day and a night, or for fifteen consecutive feedings with no interruptions."

It is narrated that breastfeeding does not create prohibitions unless it continues for fifteen days and nights without any feeding interruptions. Similarly, it is reported that it does not prohibit unless it occurs within two complete years. Another narration suggests that prohibitions only arise if breastfeeding occurs from one breast for an entire year.

References for these narrations can be found in various sources such as 'Al-Mukhtalif', 'Wasā'il al-Shīʿa', 'Al-Kāfi', 'Tahdhīb al-Aḥkām', and 'Al-Istibṣār', among others. Additionally, some narrations have differing interpretations, including considerations of precautionary measures, contextual applications, or interpretations based on specific conditions like breastfeeding from two different sources of milk, or considering the timeline as a condition for breastfeeding, similar to the two-year period.

It should be noted that some of these narrations are rare or not commonly acted upon by consensus, and were possibly expressed under specific circumstances or as restrictive conditions in comparison to those below fifteen feedings.

text:
وإذا أرضعت المرأة غلاما (1) مملوكا من لبنها حتى فطمته، فلا يحل لها بيعه، لأنه ابنها من الرضاعة (2).
وإذا تزوج الرجل امرأة، فولدت منه جارية، ثم ماتت المرأة، فتزوج أخرى فولدت منه، ثم أنها أرضعت من لبنها غلاما، فلا يجوز للغلام الذي أرضعته أن يتزوج ابنة الامرأة التي كانت تحت الرجل قبل المرأة الأخيرة، فإن الصادق - عليه السلام - يقول: ما أحب أن يتزوج ابنة فحل قد رضع من لبنه (3).
ولا يحرم الرضاع ثلاثين رضعة متفرقة (4).
وسأل رجل الصادق - عليه السلام -، فقال: أرضعت أمي جارية بلبني، قال: هي أختك من الرضاعة، قال:
فتحل لأخ لي من أمي لم ترضعها أمي بلبنه؟ قال: والفحل واحد؟ قال: نعم، هو أخي من أبي وأمي، فقال (5): اللبن للفحل، صار أبوك أباها، وأمك أمها (6).
وقال - عليه السلام -: رضاع اليهودية والنصرانية أحب إلي من رضاع الناصبية (7) (8).

translation:
When a woman breastfeeds a male child, who is a slave, with her milk until he is weaned, it is not permissible for her to sell him, as he becomes her son through breastfeeding.

If a man marries a woman who gives birth to a daughter for him, and then the woman dies, and he marries another woman who also gives birth to his child, and she breastfeeds a male child with her milk, it is not permissible for the boy she breastfed to marry the daughter of the woman who was with the man before the latter wife. This is because, as al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, says: "I do not like for a daughter to be married to a man who has been breastfed with her father's milk."

Breastfeeding does not prohibit marriage if it is done in thirty separate instances.

A man asked al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, saying: "My mother breastfed a girl with my milk." He replied: "She is your sister through breastfeeding." The man then asked: "Is she permissible for my brother from my mother, whom my mother did not breastfeed with his milk?" Al-Sadiq inquired: "Are they from the same father?" The man answered: "Yes, he is my brother from my father and mother." Al-Sadiq said: "The milk belongs to the father; thus, your father became her father, and your mother became her mother."

He also said, peace be upon him, “I prefer breastfeeding by a Jewish or Christian woman over a woman who follows the Nawasib sect.”

ولا يجوز مظاءرة (1) المجوسي، فأما أهل الكتاب - اليهود والنصارى - فلا بأس (2)، ولكن إذا أرضعوهم فامنعوهم من شرب الخمر، وأكل (3) لحم الخنزير (4).
وقال أمير المؤمنين علي - عليه السلام - في ابنة الأخ من الرضاعة: لا آمر به أحدا ولا أنهى عنه أحدا، وأنا ناه عنه نفسي وولدي (5).
وإن زعمت امرأة أنها أرضعت امرأة أو غلاما، ثم أنكرت ذلك صدقت، فان قالت: قد أرضعتهما (6) فلا تصدق ولا تنعم (7).
وإذا أرضعت جارية رجلا حل له بيعها إذا شاء، إلا أن لها حقا (8) عليه (9).
ولا يجوز للرجل أن يبيع أختا من الرضاعة، إلا إذا لم يجد ما ينفق عليها ولا

translation:
Translation:

---

One should not cooperate with a Zoroastrian, but there is no issue with the People of the Book—Jews and Christians. However, if they are nursing children, they should be prevented from drinking wine and eating pork.

Amir al-Mu'minin Ali - peace be upon him - said regarding the niece through breastfeeding: "I neither command it nor prohibit it for anyone, but I do prohibit it for myself and my children."

If a woman claims that she has nursed a woman or a boy and then denies it, she is to be believed. However, if she says she has nursed two, she is not to be believed nor rewarded.

If a servant girl breastfeeds a man, he may sell her if he wishes, except that she has a right over him.

A man is not permitted to sell a sister through breastfeeding unless he has nothing to support her with.

---

text:
ما يكسوها فلا بأس أن يبيعها (1).
وقال الصادق - عليه السلام -: لبن اليهودية والنصرانية والمجوسية أحب إلي من لبن ولد الزنا. ولا بأس بلبن ولد الزنا إذا جعل مولى الجارية الذي فجر بها في حل (2).
ولا يجوز للرجل أن يتزوج أخت أخيه من الرضاعة (3).
وقال النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - يحرم من الرضاع ما يحرم من النسب (4).

translation:
There is no harm in selling it if it is clothed (1). Al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, said: The milk of a Jewish, Christian, or Zoroastrian woman is more preferable to me than the milk of a child born out of wedlock. However, there is no issue with the milk of a child born out of wedlock if the master of the maid with whom adultery was committed gives consent (2).

A man is not permitted to marry his foster brother's sister (3). The Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, said: What is forbidden by lineage is also forbidden by breastfeeding (4).

Chapter on 'Aqiqah:

When a child is born to you, name them on the seventh day with the best of names, and give them a good nickname. If the child's name is Muhammad, do not nickname him Abu al-Qasim, nor Abu Bakr, nor Abu Isa, nor Abu al-Hakam, nor Abu al-Harith. Pierce the child's ear, shave their head, weigh the hair in silver, and give it as charity.

ولا يأكل الأبوان العقيقة، وإذا أكلت الأم منها (2) لم ترضعه (3).
وتطعم القابلة من العقيقة الرجل والورك (4) فإذا (5) أردت ذبحها فقل: بسم الله (6)، منك ولك عقيقة فلان بن فلان، على ملتك ودينك وسنة رسولك (7).

translation:
And if the child is a male, a male is sacrificed for him, and if female, then a female is sacrificed (1). The parents should not eat from the 'aqiqah, and if the mother eats from it (2), she should not breastfeed the child (3). The midwife should be given a portion from the 'aqiqah, specifically the shoulder or thigh (4). When you intend to slaughter it, say: "In the name of God (6), this is an 'aqiqah for so-and-so, the son of so-and-so, according to Your faith, Your religion, and the tradition of Your Messenger" (7). It is narrated from Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, that he said: If one does not perform the 'aqiqah for the child and offers a sacrifice instead, that suffices for (8) the 'aqiqah (9).

text:
باب المتعة إعلم أن رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - أحل المتعة، ولم يحرمها حتى قبض (1).
واعلم أنها لا تحل إلا لمن عرفها، وهي حرام (على من) (2) جهلها (3).
وإذا تمتع الرجل مريدا ثواب الله، وخلافا على من جهلها، لم يكلمها كلمة إلا كتب الله له بها حسنة، ولم يمد يده إليها إلا كتب الله له بها حسنة، فإذا دنى منها غفر الله له بذلك ذنبا، فإذا اغتسل غفر الله له بقدر ما مر من الماء على (شعره بعدد كل) (4) شعرة (5).
وقال رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -: لحقني جبرئيل فقال: يا محمد إن الله يقول: إني قد غفرت للمتمتعين (من أمتك) (6) من النساء (7).

translation:
Chapter on Temporary Marriage

Know that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, made temporary marriage (mut'ah) permissible and did not prohibit it until his death. And know that it is only permissible for those who understand it, and it is prohibited for those who are ignorant of it. If a man engages in temporary marriage seeking the reward from Allah and in opposition to those who lack understanding of it, he does not speak a word to her except that Allah records a good deed for him, nor does he extend his hand towards her except that Allah records another good deed for him. When he approaches her, Allah forgives him a sin for that, and when he performs the ritual washing (ghusl), Allah forgives him as much as the water passes over the number of every hair.

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: Gabriel came to me and said: O Muhammad, indeed Allah says: I have forgiven those who engage in temporary marriage (from your nation) with women. 

References are from sources such as "Al-Wasa'il" and "Al-Faqih," reflecting slightly differing narrations across these texts.

text:
ولا تتمتع إلا بعارفة، فإن لم تكن عارفة فاعرض عليها، فان قبلت (١) فتزوجها وإن أبت أن ترضى بقولك فدعها، وإياكم والكواشف، والدواعي، والبغايا، وذوات الأزواج، فالكواشف: هن اللواتي يكاشفن، وبيوتهن معلومة، ويؤتين، والدواعي: اللواتي يدعون إلى أنفسهن، وقد عرفن بالفساد، والبغايا: المعروفات بالزنا، وذوات الأزواج: المطلقات على غير السنة (٢).
واعلم أن من تمتع بزانية فهو زان، لأن الله يقول: ﴿الزاني لا ينكح إلا زانية أو مشركة والزانية لا ينكحها إلا زان أو مشرك وحرم ذلك على المؤمنين﴾ (3) (4).
ولا تتمتع إلا بامرأة قد بلغت عشر سنين (5).
ولا تتمتع بذوات الآباء من الأبكار إلا بإذن آبائهن (6).

translation:
Certainly, here's the translation:

---

Enjoy companionship only with a knowledgeable person. If she is not knowledgeable, then present your proposal to her. If she accepts, marry her; if she refuses to accept your word, then leave her. Beware of women who openly flaunt themselves, those who invite others to vice, prostitutes, and married women, for the women who flaunt themselves: they are those who openly display their bodies, and their houses are known, and are frequented by people. Those who invite others are known for their corruption, prostitutes are those infamous for adultery, and married women are those who are divorced contrary to religious principles.

Be aware that whoever takes pleasure with a prostitute is himself an adulterer, because Allah says: "The adulterer marries none but an adulteress or a polytheist, and the adulteress none marries her but an adulterer or a polytheist, and that is forbidden to the believers." (24:3)

Enjoy companionship only with a woman who is at least ten years old. Do not enjoy companionship with virgins who have fathers except with their fathers' permission.

translation:
A Jewish or Christian woman should not be married alongside a free Muslim woman, whether in a temporary marriage (mut'ah) or otherwise. 

It is permissible to look at a woman with whom one intends to enter into a temporary marriage. The minimum acceptable dowry for a temporary marriage is a dirham or more. It has also been narrated as two handfuls of wheat.

If you wish to proceed with such an arrangement, you should say to her: "Marry yourself to me according to the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Prophet, in a marriage that is not adultery, with the condition that I will not inherit from you, nor you from me, and I will not demand your child, for a specified period. If it pleases me, I will increase it, and you may increase it for me as well. If she bears a child during this period, it is not under your responsibility."

The references are from various Islamic texts, indicating consistency in this teaching and its origins in different hadith sources and scholarly works.

أن تنكره (1).
وإذا تزوجت المرأة متعة بمهر معلوم إلى أجل معلوم، وأعطيتها بعض مهرها ودخلت بها، ثم علمت أن لها زوجا، فلا تعطها مما بقي لها عليك شيئا، لأنها عصت الله (2).
وإذا تزوجت بامرأة متعة (إلى أجل) (3) مسمى، فلما انقضى أجلها أحببت أن تتزوج أختها، فلا تحل لك حتى تنقضي (4) عدتها (5).
ولا تتزوج بامرأة قد تمتعت بأمها (6).

translation:
If you deny it.

When a woman is married in a temporary marriage (mut'ah) with a specified dowry for a fixed term, and you have given her part of the dowry and consummated the marriage with her, but afterward, you find out that she has a husband, you should not give her anything from the remaining dowry as she has disobeyed God.

If you enter into a temporary marriage with a woman for a defined duration, and once the term ends, you wish to marry her sister, it is not permissible for you until her waiting period ('iddah) is over.

And you should not marry a woman if you have already been in a temporary marriage with her mother.

Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) was asked about temporary marriage, and he said it is like owning a slave woman. Her waiting period is forty-five nights. When the term is over, the separation occurs without the need for divorce. If he wishes to renew the marriage, he must give her something, whether little or much, but there is no inheritance between them if one of them dies.

translation:
The Fixed Period (1).

If a man marries a woman in a temporary marriage (mut'a), and then he dies, she must observe a waiting period ('iddah) of four months and ten days. If her days conclude and he is alive, she must adhere to a waiting period of one and a half menstrual cycles, similar to what is required of a slave woman. If she has stayed with him for several days, she must mourn (4). However, if she has been with him for only one day, two days, or merely an hour of the day, she must observe the waiting period but need not mourn (6).

باب الطلاق إعلم أن الطلاق لا يقع إلا على (1) طهر، من غير جماع، بشاهدين عدلين في مجلس واحد، بكلمة واحدة (2)، ولا يجوز أن يشهد على الطلاق في مجلس رجل، ويشهد بعد ذلك الثاني (3).
ولا يقع الطلاق باكراه ولا إجبار ولا على سكر، إلا أن يكون الرجل مريدا للطلاق (4).
والطلاق على وجوه كثيرة، فمنها: طلاق السنة، وهو أنه إذا أراد الرجل أن يطلق امرأته انتظر بها حتى تحيض وتطهر، فيطلقها تطليقة واحدة، ويشهد على ذلك شاهدين عدلين، ثم يدعها حتى تستوفي أقراءها (5)، وهي ثلاثة أطهار، أو ثلاثة أشهر إن كانت ممن لا تحيض ومثلها تحيض.

translation:
Chapter on Divorce

Know that a divorce becomes effective only under the following conditions: (1) during a period of purity, when the wife is not menstruating and has not had intercourse, and with the presence of two just witnesses, in a single sitting, and with a single pronouncement. (2) It is not permissible for one witness to be present at the time of pronouncement and the other to come later (3).

A divorce is not valid if it is done under coercion, compulsion, or intoxication, unless the man truly intends to divorce (4).

There are many forms of divorce, among them the "Sunnah Divorce," which occurs when a man wishes to divorce his wife; he waits until she menstruates and then becomes pure, then he pronounces a single divorce in the presence of two just witnesses, and then leaves her until she completes her waiting period (5), which is three menstrual cycles, or three months if she does not menstruate but is of an age where she would.
