translation:
If there is a property consisting of several units and the access for their owners is through a shared courtyard, and one of the owners sells a unit to another person, the owner of another unit may demand pre-emption (shuf'a). They are entitled to this right if they cannot move the entrance of the purchased unit to another location. However, if the entrance is relocated, then no one has the right of pre-emption against the new owner.

Be aware that pre-emption is only obligatory for a co-owner who has not yet divided the shared property. [It has been narrated that pre-emption rights correspond to the number of people involved. It has also been narrated that these rights apply to more than two individuals.] It has been narrated as well that once the boundaries are delineated, pre-emption is not applicable.

The guardian of an orphan holds the pre-emption right on behalf of the orphan, similar to their father. Additionally, an absentee owner is entitled to pre-emption.

- The references indicate various sources which discuss the rulings and conditions of pre-emption, reflecting slight variations in the text and interpretations among different scholars and collections.

text:
باب الأيمان، والنذور، والكفارات اليمين على وجهين، أحدهما: أن يحلف الرجل على شيء لا يلزمه أن يفعل فيحلف أنه يفعل ذلك الشيء، أو يحلف على ما يلزمه أن يفعل فعليه الكفارة إذا لم يفعله.
والأخرى على ثلاثة أوجه، فمنها: ما يؤجر الرجل عليه إذا حلف كاذبا ومنها: ما لا كفارة عليه فيها (1) ولا أجر له (2)، ومنها: ما لا كفارة عليه فيها، والعقوبة فيها دخول النار، فأما التي يؤجر الرجل عليها إذا حلف كاذبا (3) ولا (4) تلزمه الكفارة، فهو أن يحلف الرجل في خلاص امرئ مسلم أو خلاص ماله، وأما التي لا كفارة عليه ولا أجر له، فهو أن يحلف الرجل على شيء، ثم يجد ما هو خير من اليمين، فيترك اليمين ويرجع إلى الذي هو خير، وأما التي عقوبتها دخول النار فهو أن يحلف (5) الرجل على مال امرئ مسلم أو على حقه ظلما، فهذه يمين غموس

translation:
Chapter on Oaths, Vows, and Expiations

Oaths are of two types. The first type is when a person swears to do something that he is not required to do. If he takes an oath to do this thing or swears to do something he must, he is required to make an expiation if he does not fulfill it.

The second type is divided into three categories. Among these is an oath for which the person is rewarded if he swears falsely, an oath for which he incurs neither expiation (1) nor reward (2), and an oath for which there is no expiation, but the consequence is punishment in hellfire.

Regarding the oath for which a person is rewarded if he swears falsely (3) and for which no expiation is required, it is when a person swears to secure the release of a fellow Muslim or to protect his property. 

The oath for which he incurs neither expiation nor reward is when a person swears about something and later finds a better course of action, so he abandons the oath and opts for what is better.

The oath with the consequence of punishment being hellfire is when a person unjustly swears concerning the property or rights of a fellow Muslim. This type of oath is called the "immersive oath" (Yameen Ghamus).

توجب النار ولا كفارة عليه في الدنيا (1).
ولا يجوز إطعام الصغير في كفارة اليمين، ولكن صغيرين بكبير (2).
فإن لم تجد في الكفارة إلا رجلا أو رجلين فكرر عليهم حتى تستكمل (3) (4).
وإن قال رجل: إن كلم ذا قرابة له فعليه المشي إلى بيت الله، وكل ما يملكه في سبيل الله، وهو برئ من دين محمد - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -، فإنه يصوم ثلاثة أيام ويتصدق على عشرة مساكين (5).
وإن حلفت امرأة وقالت: كل ما أملك فهو في المساكين صدقة، وعلي المشي إلى بيت الله إن تزوجت، فعليها إذا تزوجت أن تتصدق بثلث مالها، وإن لم تتزوج فليس عليها شيء (6).

translation:
Fire is obligatory for him, and there is no expiation for him in this world (1).  
It is not permissible to feed a child as part of the expiation for an oath, but two small children can be equivalent to one adult (2).  
If you cannot find in the expiation except for one or two men, repeat upon them until you complete (3) (4).  
If a man says: If I speak to a relative, I must walk to the House of Allah, and all I own is for the sake of Allah, and I am free from the religion of Muhammad - peace be upon him and his family - then he must fast for three days and give alms to ten needy people (5).  
If a woman swears, saying: All I own will be given to the needy as charity, and I will walk to the House of Allah if I marry, then, if she marries, she must give away one-third of her wealth in charity. If she does not marry, then she is not obliged to do anything (6).

text:
واعلم أنه لا يمين في قطيعة رحم، ولا نذر في معصية، ولا يمين لولد مع والده، (ولا للمرأة) (1) مع زوجها، ولا للمملوك مع مولاه (2).
واعلم أن كفارة اليمين إطعام عشرة مساكين لكل مسكين مد، أو كسوتهم لكل رجل ثوبان (3)، أو تحرير رقبة، وهو بالخيار أي الثلاث فعل جاز، فإن لم يقدر على واحدة منها صام ثلاثة أيام متواليات (4).
والنذر على وجهين، أحدهما: أن يقول الرجل: إن كان كذا وكذا (5)، صمت أو (6) صليت أو حججت أو فعلت شيئا من الخير، فهو بالخيار إن شاء فعل وإن شاء لم يفعل، فان قال: إن كان كذا وكذا فلله عليه كذا وكذا، فهذا نذر واجب لا يسعه تركه، وعليه الوفاء به (7)، فان خالف لزمته الكفارة صيام شهرين

translation:
Know that there is no oath in severing family ties, no vow in committing a sin, and no oath for a child against their parent, (nor for a woman) with her husband, nor for a servant against their master.

Be aware that the expiation for breaking an oath is to feed ten needy people, giving each one a measure, or to clothe them with two garments each, or to free a slave. One has the choice to do any of these three, and if unable to do any of them, then one must fast for three consecutive days.

Vows are of two types: The first is when a person says, "If such and such happens, I will fast, pray, perform pilgrimage, or do some act of goodness." In this case, the person has the choice to fulfill it or not. However, if a person says, "If such and such happens, then I owe such and such to God," this becomes a binding vow that must not be abandoned, and the person is obligated to fulfill it. If they act contrary to it, they are obliged to expiate by fasting for two months.

متتابعين (1)، وروي كفارة يمين (2).
فان نذر رجل (3) أن يصوم كل سبت (أو أحد أو سائر الأيام) (4)، فليس له أن يتركه إلا من علة، (وليس عليه صومه في سفر ولا مرض، إلا أن يكون نوى ذلك) (5)، فان أفطر من غير علة، تصدق مكان كل يوم على عشرة (6) مساكين (7).
فان نذر أن يصوم يوما بعينه ما دام حيا، فوافق ذلك اليوم يوم عيد فطر أو أضحى أو أيام التشريق أو سافر أو مرض، فقد وضع الله عنه الصيام في هذه الأيام كلها، ويصوم يوما بدل يوم (8) (9).

translation:
If a man vows to fast every Saturday (or Sunday or other days), he cannot skip it unless due to a valid excuse, (and he is not obliged to fast if traveling or sick, unless he intended to do so). If he breaks the fast without a valid excuse, he must give charity to ten needy people for each missed day.

If he vows to fast on a specific day for the rest of his life, and that day coincides with Eid al-Fitr, Eid al-Adha, the Days of Tashreeq, or if he happens to be traveling or sick, Allah exempts him from fasting on these days. Instead, he should fast on another day in substitution.

References: In Al-Mustadrak, Al-Hidaya, and Al-Tahdhib, similar rulings are discussed, though some sources mention a different number of people to be given charity (seven instead of ten in some narratives).

وإن نذر رجل نذرا ولم يسم شيئا فهو بالخيار، إن شاء تصدق بشيء (١)، وإن شاء صلى ركعتين، وإن شاء صام يوما (٢).
وإذا نذر أن يتصدق (٣) بمال كثير ولم يسم مبلغه، فإن الكثير ثمانون دينارا (٤)، لقول الله عز وجل:
﴿لقد نصركم الله في مواطن كثيرة﴾ (5) وكانت ثمانين موطنا (6).
فان صام رجل يوما أو شهرا لم يسمه في النذر فأفطر فلا كفارة عليه، إنما عليه أن يصوم مكانه يوما أو شهرا على حسب ما نذر (7).

وإن نذر رجل أن يصوم يوما، فوقع ذلك اليوم على أهله، فعليه أن يصوم

translation:
If a man makes a vow without specifying anything, he has the choice: he can give charity of some sort, pray two units of prayer, or fast for a day. If he vows to give a large amount in charity without specifying the amount, then a large amount is considered to be eighty dinars, based on the saying of Allah the Exalted: "Allah has already given you victory in many regions," and these regions were eighty in count.

If a man vows to fast for a day or a month without specifying which day or month, and he breaks the fast, there is no atonement required. Instead, he must simply fast for a day or a month in place of it, according to what he vowed. However, if he vows to fast on a specific known day or month, he is obliged to fast on that day or month, and if he does not fast, or if he fasts and then breaks it, he must observe the atonement.

If a man vows to fast for a day and it turns out to be a day that involves his family, he is still obliged to fast. 

(Note: The text includes references to sources such as “Al-Mustadrak,” “Fiqh Al-Ridha,” “Al-Kafi,” and other Islamic jurisprudence texts which detail the religious and historical context of vows in Islam.)

يوما بدل يوم، ويعتق رقبة مؤمنة (1).
واعلم أن الأعمى لا يجزي في الرقبة، ويجزي الأقطع والأشل والأعور، ولا يجوز المقعد (2).
ويجزي في الظهار صبي ممن ولد في الإسلام (3).
فان حلف رجل غريمه أن لا يخرج من البلد إلا بعلمه، فلا يجوز له أن يخرج حتى يعلمه، فان خشي أن لا يدعه أن يخرج ويقع عليه وعلى عياله ضرر، فليخرج ولا شيء عليه (4).
وإذا ادعى عليك مالا ولم يكن على (5) بينة، فأراد المدعي أن يحلفك (6)، فان بلغ مقدار ثلاثين درهما فاعطه ولا تحلف، وإن كان أكثر من ثلاثين درهما (7) فاحلف ولا تعطه (8) (9).

Certainly! Here is a translation of the provided Arabic text into English:

---

A day for a day, and the freeing of a believing slave.

Be aware that a blind person does not satisfy the condition for freeing a slave, but an amputee, paralyzed, or one-eyed person does, and neither does a bed-ridden individual.

In the case of expiation (zihar), a boy born into Islam suffices.

If a man vows that his debtor should not leave the town without his knowledge, the debtor may not leave until he informs him. However, if he fears that informing him will prevent his departure and harm him and his family, he should leave without consequence.

If someone claims you owe them money and has no evidence, and the claimant wants you to swear, if the amount is up to thirty dirhams, give it to him and do not swear. But if it is more than thirty dirhams, swear and do not give it to him.

---

This passage appears to be a set of instructions dealing with religious matters such as expiation and oaths, related to Islamic jurisprudence.

باب الصيد والذبائح وإذا أردت أن ترسل كلبا على صيد فسم الله، فان أدركته حيا فاذبحه أنت وإن أدركته وقد قتله كلبك فكل منه وإن أكل (١) بعضه، فإن الله تعالى يقول: ﴿فكلوا مما أمسكن عليكم﴾ (2) (3).
وروي: كل ما أكل الكلب وإن أكل ثلثيه، كل ما أكل الكلب وإن (4) لم يبق منه (5) إلا بضعة واحدة (6).
وإذا لم تكن معك حديدة تذبحه بها فدع الكلب يقتله، ثم كل منه (7).

translation:
Chapter on Hunting and Slaughtering

If you intend to send a dog to hunt, then mention the name of Allah. If you reach the prey while it is still alive, you should slaughter it yourself. If you find that your dog has already killed it, then you may eat from it, even if it has consumed some of it. This is based on the words of Allah the Exalted: "So eat of what they catch for you" (Surah Al-Ma'idah: 4).

It has been narrated: Eat what the dog has eaten, even if it has consumed two-thirds of the prey; eat what the dog has eaten even if nothing remains but one piece.

If you do not have a sharp tool to slaughter it with, then allow the dog to kill it and then eat from it.

References to this ruling can be found in historical Islamic texts such as Al-Mustadrak, Fiqh Al-Ridha, Al-Kafi, Al-Tahdhib, and Al-Istibsar, with variations in the wording, as noted in numerous collections of hadith and tafsir works including the interpretations of Al-Ayyashi.

وإن أرسلت كلبك على (1) صيد وشاركه كلب آخر فلا تأكل منه، إلا أن تدرك ذكاته (2).
ولا تأكل ما (3) صيد بباز أو صقر أو فهد أو عقاب أو غير ذلك، إلا ما أدركت ذكاته، إلا الكلب المعلم (4)، ولا بأس بأكل ما قتله إذا كنت قد سميت عليه (5).
وإذا رميت سهمك (6) وسميت وأدركته وقد مات، فكله إذا كان في السهم زج (7) حديد، وإن وجدته من الغد وكان سهمك فيه، فلا بأس بأكله، إذا علمت أن سهمك قتله (8).
وإن رميته وهو على جبل، فسقط ومات فلا تأكله، وإن رميته فأصابه

translation:
If you send your dog to hunt and another dog shares in the catch, do not eat from it unless you are able to perform the ritual slaughter. Do not eat from what was hunted by a hawk, falcon, cheetah, eagle, or any other bird of prey unless you can perform the ritual slaughter, except if it involves a trained dog. It is permissible to eat what the trained dog has killed if you have mentioned God's name over it.

If you shoot an arrow and mention God's name, and the prey is found dead with the iron tip of the arrow still in it, you may eat it. If you find it the next day with your arrow in it, there is no harm in eating it, provided you are certain the arrow killed it.

If you shoot the prey while it is on a mountain and it falls and dies, do not eat it. If you shoot at it and it is injured...

text:
سهمك ووقع في الماء فمات (1)، فكله إذا كان رأسه خارجا من الماء، وإن (2) كان رأسه في الماء فلا تأكله (3).
ولا تأكل ما صيد بالحجر والبندق (4) (5).
وإذا (6) ذبحت فاستقبل بذبيحتك القبلة، ولا تنخعها حتى تموت، ولا تأكل من ذبيحة لم تذبح من مذبحها (7).
وإن امتنع عليك بعير وأنت تريد نحره أو بقرة أو شاة أو غير ذلك، فضربتها بالسيف وسميت، فلا بأس بأكله (8).
وإذا ذبحت فسبقت الحديدة فأبانت الرأس، فكله إذا خرج الدم (9).

translation:
When your arrow strikes an animal in the water and it dies, you may eat it if its head is above water, but if its head is submerged, do not eat it. Do not eat what has been hunted with a stone or a pellet. 

When you perform a ritual slaughter, direct the animal towards the Qibla, and do not sever the neck until it dies. Do not eat the meat from an animal that has not been slaughtered from its designated place. If a camel, cow, sheep, or any other animal resists and you wish to slaughter it, striking it with a sword after mentioning God's name, there is no harm in eating it.

If during slaughter, the blade reaches the neck too quickly and separates the head, you may eat it if the blood has flowed.

text:
والشاة إذا طرفت عينها أو ركضت برجلها أو حركت ذنبها فهي ذكية (1).
وإن ذبحت شاة ولم تتحرك، وخرج منها دم كثير عبيط (2)، فلا تأكل إلا أن يتحرك شيء منها كما ذكرناه (3).
ولا تأكل (4) من فريسة السبع، ولا الموقوذة (5)، ولا المنخنقة، ولا المتردية، ولا النطيحة، إلا أن (تدركها حية (6) فتذكيها) (7) (8).
وإذا ذبحت ذبيحة في بطنها ولد، فإن كان تاما فكله (9)، فإن ذكاته ذكاة أمه، وإن لم يكن تاما فلا تأكله (10).

translation:
And if a sheep blinks its eye, kicks with its leg, or wags its tail, it is considered properly slaughtered. (1) If a sheep is slaughtered and does not move, but a lot of fresh blood flows from it, do not eat it unless some part of it moves as previously mentioned. (3) Do not eat from the prey of wild beasts, nor from an animal that has been struck down with illness, nor the strangled, nor the one that has fallen from a height, nor the gored, unless (you find it alive (6) and perform proper slaughtering on it). (7) (8) If an animal is slaughtered and it has a fetus inside it, if it is fully developed, you may eat it (9), as its slaughtering is considered the same as its mother's. If it is not fully developed, do not eat it. (10)

text:
وروي إذا أشعر أو أوبر، فذكاته ذكاة أمه (١).
وإذا ذبحت البقر من المنحر فلا تأكلها، فإن البقر تذبح ولا تنحر، وما نحر فليس بذكي (٢).
ولا تأكل ذبيحة من ليس على دينك في الإسلام، ولا تأكل ذبيحة (اليهودي والنصراني والمجوسي) (٣)، إلا إذا سمعتهم (٤) يذكرون اسم (٥) الله عليها، فإذا ذكروا (٦) اسم الله فلا بأس بأكلها، فان الله يقول: ﴿ولا تأكلوا مما لم يذكر اسم الله عليه﴾ (٧) ويقول: ﴿فكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه إن كنتم بآياته مؤمنين﴾ (8) (9).
ولا بأس بذبيحة النساء (10) إذا ذكرن (11) اسم (12) الله (13).

translation:
Reportedly, if it is marked or branded, then its slaughter is considered the slaughter of its mother. If cattle are slaughtered from the neck, do not eat it, for cattle should not be slaughtered from this area but rather from the throat. What is slaughtered improperly is not considered properly slaughtered. Do not eat the meat of anyone who does not share your faith in Islam, nor the meat of (a Jew, a Christian, or a Magian), unless you hear them invoking the name of God upon it. If they invoke God's name, then it is permissible to eat it, for God says: "And do not eat of that upon which the name of God has not been mentioned" (6:121) and "So eat of that upon which the name of God has been mentioned if you believe in His revelations" (6:118).

Women's slaughtering is permissible if they invoke the name of God. References to these rulings are found in various Islamic texts, indicating scholarly discussions and the necessity of adhering to proper Islamic dietary laws. The differing interpretations suggest accommodations in cases of necessity or for the sake of dissimulation (taqiyya), such as when living in non-Muslim communities where eating the meat of non-Muslims may be necessitated.

text:
وسئل أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام - عن ذبائح النصارى، فقال: لا بأس بها، فقيل: فإنهم يذكرون عليها المسيح - عليه السلام -، فقال: إنما أرادوا بالمسيح الله (1).
وقد نهى - عليه السلام - في خبر عن أكل ذبيحة المجوسي (2).
ولا بأس بذبيحة المرأة والغلام إذا كان قد صلى وبلغ خمسة أشبار، وإذا كن نساء ليس معهن رجل فلتذبح أعلمهن، ولتذكر اسم الله عليه (3).
وسئل أبو جعفر - عليه السلام - عن سباع الطير والوحش حتى ذكر له القنافذ والوطواط (4) والحمير والبغال والخيل، فقال: ليس الحرام إلا ما حرم (5) الله في كتابه، وقد نهى رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - عن أكل لحوم الحمير يوم خيبر، وإنما نهاهم من أجل ظهورهم أن يفنوها، وليست الحمير بحرام، ثم قرأ هذه الآية: (قل لا أجد فيما أوحي إلي محرما على طاعم يطعمه إلا أن يكون ميتة أو دما مسفوحا أو لحم خنزير فإنه رجس أو فسقا أهل لغير الله به (6)) (7).
ولا بأس بأكل لحوم الحمر الوحشية (8).

translation:
Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) was asked about the slaughter of the Christians, and he said: "There is no harm in it." It was then said to him: "But they mention Christ (peace be upon him) over it," to which he replied: "They only intend God by Christ."

However, he (peace be upon him) prohibited in a narration the consumption of the Magian's slaughter.

There is no harm in the slaughter by a woman or a young boy if he has prayed and reached the height of five spans. If there are women without a man among them, the most knowledgeable of them should do the slaughtering and should mention the name of God over it.

Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him) was asked about predatory birds and beasts, and even hedgehogs, bats, donkeys, mules, and horses were mentioned to him. He said: "The only prohibited things are those which God has prohibited in His Book." The Messenger of God (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) forbade the consumption of donkey meat on the day of Khaybar, and he only forbade them from consuming it to preserve their mounts. Donkeys are not forbidden as such. Then he recited this verse: "Say: I do not find in what is revealed to me any forbidden food for one who wishes to eat it, unless it is carrion, or spilled blood, or the flesh of swine—for that surely is unclean—or an impiety offered to other than God."

There is no harm in eating the meat of wild donkeys.

text:
واعلم أن الضب والفأرة والقرد والخنزير مسوخ لا يجوز أكلها (1)، وكل مسخ حرام (2)، ولا تأكل الأرنب (فإنه مسخ حرام) (3) (4).
وقال رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - كل ذي ناب من السباع، ومخلب من الطير، والحمر الإنسية حرام (5).
والكلب نجس (6). ولا تأكل من السباع شيئا على الجملة (7). وإياك أن تجعل جلد الخنزير دلوا تستقي به الماء (8).

translation:
Be aware that the lizard, mouse, monkey, and pig are considered transformed creatures and should not be consumed. All creatures that have been transformed are forbidden. Do not eat rabbits, as they are also considered forbidden transformations.

The Messenger of Allah – peace be upon him and his family – said: "Every predator with fangs and every bird with talons, as well as domesticated donkeys, are haram (forbidden)."

Dogs are considered impure. Do not eat anything from predatory animals altogether. Be cautious not to use pig skin as a container for drawing water.

ولا تأكل اللحم نيا حتى يغيره الملح والنار (6). ولا بأس بأكل القديد وإن لم تمسه النار (7).
وسئل أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام - عن جدي رضع من لبن (8) خنزيرة حتى كبر وشب واشتد عظمه، ثم إن رجلا استفحله في غنمه (فخرج له نسل) (9)، فقال: أما ما (10) عرفت من نسله بعينه فلا تقربه، وأما ما لا تعرفه فكله ولا تسأل عنه، فإنه بمنزلة الجبن (11).

translation:
Do not eat the meat of a lamb that has suckled from a pig. It is permissible to ride Bukhati camels and drink their milk. Do not eat meat raw until it is altered by salt and fire. There is no issue with eating dried meat even if it has not been touched by fire.

Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, was asked about a young goat that had nursed from a pig until it grew and matured, and then a man allowed it to breed with his flock. As a result, offspring were born. Abu Abdullah said: As for the offspring you can identify specifically, avoid them. However, for those you cannot identify, you may eat them without hesitation, as they are akin to cheese.

translation:
The Prophet - peace be upon him - said: Do not drink the milk of the camels that feed on impurities, and if any of their sweat comes in contact with you, wash it off.

[A cow that feeds on impurities should be restrained for thirty days, a sheep for twenty days. It is narrated: restrain for ten days. A duck should be restrained for three days, and a chicken for three days. It is also narrated as one day until night. Fish that feed on impurities should be restrained for one day until night.]

والطير إذا ملك جناحية فهو لمن أخذه، إلا أن يعرف صاحبه فيرده عليه (1).
ولا يجوز أخذ الفراخ من أوكارها، في جبل أو بئر أو أجمة (2) حتى تنهض (3).
ويؤكل من الطير ما يدف (4)، ولا يؤكل ما يصف (5) (6).
وإن كان يصف ويدف، وكان دفيفه أكثر من صفيفه أكل، وإن كان صفيفه أكثر من دفيفه لم يؤكل (7).
واعلم أن ذكاة السمك والجراد أخذه (8).

translation:
The translation of the provided Arabic text is as follows:

---

A bird, if it possesses its wings, belongs to whoever captures it, unless its owner is known, in which case it should be returned to him (1). It is not permissible to take the chicks from their nests in a mountain, a well, or dense thickets (2) until they are able to fly (3).

Of the birds, those that flap while flying are permissible to eat (4), but those that glide are not (5) (6). If a bird both flaps and glides, and the flapping is more than the gliding, it is permitted to eat; but if the gliding is more than the flapping, it is not permitted (7).

Know that the proper method of preparing fish and locusts for consumption is simply to capture them (8).

(1) Referenced from Al-Mustadrak: 16/118, Hadith 1. Also mentioned in Fiqh al-Rida: 295 with a similar statement, and in Al-Faqih: 3/205, appendix of Hadith 24. Referenced in Al-Wasa'il: 23/389, Chapters of Hunting, section 36, Hadith 3; in Al-Kafi: 6/222, appendix of Hadith 3; and in Al-Tahdhib: 6/394, appendix of Hadith 26, and volume 9/61, appendix of Hadith 260 with slight variation in wording.

(2) "Ajmah" refers to dense vegetation. See Majma' al-Bahrayn: 1/41 - Ajam -.

(3) Referenced from Al-Mustadrak: 16/117, appendix of Hadith 3, and from Al-Hidayah: 79 with a similar statement. Also in Fiqh al-Rida: 295, and Al-Faqih: 3/205, appendix of Hadith 25 with a similar statement. In Al-Kafi: 6/216, within Hadith 2; Al-Tahdheeb: 9/14, within Hadith 52; page 21, within Hadith 86; and Al-Istibsar: 4/64, within Hadith 2, among others, cited in Al-Wasa'il: 23/380, Chapters of Hunting, section 28, Hadith 1. Found in Al-Mukhtalif: 689 from the author and his father with a similar statement.

(4) The term "Daf" refers to the flapping of wings. It is said: the bird flapped its wings: it moved them during flight, meaning it struck them together. See Majma' al-Bahrayn: 1/43 - Daf -.

(5) "Saf" refers to when a bird spreads its wings. See Al-Qamus Al-Muheet: 3/237.

وإذا كان اللحم مع الطحال في سفود (3)، أكل اللحم إذا كان فوق (الطحال، فإن كان أسفل من الطحال لم يؤكل، ويؤكل جوذابه (4)، لأن) (5) الطحال في حجاب، ولا ينزل منه إلا أن يثقب، فان ثقب سال منه، ولم يؤكل ما تحته من الجوذاب (6)، وإن جعلت سمكة يجوز أكلها مع جري أو غيرها مما لا يجوز أكله في سفود، أكلت التي لها فلوس (7) إذا كانت في السفود فوق الجري وفوق التي لا تؤكل (8)، فإن كانت أسفل من الجري لم (9) تؤكل (10).

translation:
If an animal is either alive or dead, a piece can be placed on fire; if it contracts, it is alive, but if it relaxes on the fire, it is dead. When meat is on a spit along with a spleen, the meat can be eaten if it is above the spleen. However, if it is below the spleen, it should not be eaten. You may eat the juices surrounding it because the spleen is within a casing that only releases juices if punctured. If a permissible fish is cooked together on a spit with a catfish or any other fish that is not permissible to eat, the permissible fish can be eaten if it is above the non-permissible one on the spit. If it is below the non-permissible fish, it should not be eaten. 

Do not drink from gold and silver vessels.

References to the texts supporting these rulings can be found in various Islamic legal texts and compilations such as "Al-Mustadrak," "Fiqh Al-Ridha," "Al-Faqih," and "Al-Kafi," among others. These works discuss the laws surrounding forbidden foods and the use of precious materials for drinking vessels, reflecting Islamic dietary and ethical guidelines.

translation:
The text discusses the punishment for adultery according to certain Islamic legal interpretations. Here's the translation:

"The face and the private parts (1), and they are flogged in the clothes they wore when they committed adultery, [and if they are found naked, they are flogged naked] (2) (3). If they repeat the act, they are flogged one hundred times; if they repeat it again, they are to be killed (4). 

If a man commits adultery with a woman who is (5) married and the man is unmarried, the man is punished by one hundred lashes, and the woman is stoned. If the woman is unmarried and the man is married, the man is stoned, and the woman is punished by one hundred lashes (7). If both are married, they are both flogged one hundred times, then stoned (8).

Stoning involves digging a pit for the individual, deep enough for him to stand with his neck at the level of the ground.

واعلم أن حرمة الدبر أعظم من حرمة الفرج، لأن الله أهلك أمة بحرمة الدبر، ولم يهلك أحدا بحرمة الفرج (2).
واعلم أن عقوبة من لاط بغلام أن يحرق بالنار، أو يهدم عليه حائط، أو يضرب ضربة بالسيف (3)، وإذا أحب التوبة تاب من غير أن يرفع خبره إلى إمام المسلمين (4)، فان رفع خبره إلى الإمام هلك، فإنه يقيم عليه إحدى هذه الحدود التي ذكرناها (5).

translation:
Be aware that sodomy refers to the act between the thighs, while committing the act through the anus is considered disbelief in Almighty God. Know that the sanctity of the anus is greater than that of the genitals, as God destroyed a nation due to the violation of the sanctity of the anus, but He did not destroy anyone for the violation of the sanctity of the genitals.

Additionally, know that the punishment for someone who engages in sodomy with a young boy is to be burned with fire, or to have a wall collapsed upon him, or to be struck with the sword. If he sincerely wishes to repent, he may do so without having his case brought before the leader of the Muslims. However, if his case is brought to the leader, he will face one of the aforementioned punishments that we have described.

It is also within the rights of the leader to pardon any sin between a servant and his Creator. If he pardons, his pardon is valid. 

The references indicated provide various sources from Islamic jurisprudence and hadith compilations, highlighting the historical and religious context in which these rulings and beliefs are discussed.

وإذا كان الذنب بين العبد والعبد فليس للإمام أن يعفو (1).
وإذا تاب اللوطي والزاني، فان الله يقبل توبتهما إذا عرف من نيتهما الصدق ولم يؤاخذهما به، وإن نويا التوبة في حال إقامة الحد عليهما فقد تخلصا في الآخرة، وإن لم ينويا التوبة كانا معاقبين في الآخرة، إلا أن يعفو تبارك وتعالى عنهما (2) (3).
واعلم أن الله أوحى إلى موسى - عليه السلام -، يا موسى بن عمران عف يعف أهلك، يا موسى [بن عمران إن أردت أن يكثر خير بيتك فإياك والزنا، (يا موسى بن) (4) عمران] (5) كما تدين تدان (6).
والبكر والبكرة إذا زنيا جلدا مائة جلدة، ثم ينفيان سنة إلى غير مصرهما (7).
وإذا جامع الرجل وليدة امرأته فعليه جلد مائة (8) (9).

translation:
If the sin is between one servant and another, it is not for the Imam to forgive. If a person who has committed sodomy or adultery repents, God accepts their repentance if their intention is sincere, and He does not hold them accountable. If they intend to repent while the punishment is being executed upon them, they are absolved in the hereafter. However, if they do not intend to repent, they will be punished in the hereafter unless God, the Blessed and Exalted, forgives them.

Know that God revealed to Moses, peace be upon him: "O Moses son of Imran, be forgiving so that your family may be forgiven. O Moses [son of Imran, if you wish for much good in your household, beware of adultery, (O Moses son of) Imran,] as you treat others, so you shall be treated."

If an unmarried man and woman commit adultery, each should be lashed one hundred times and then exiled for a year to a location outside their city. If a man has intercourse with the slave-girl of his wife, he should be lashed one hundred times.

This is referenced in various sources such as Al-Mustadrak, Al-Kafi, Al-Faqih, Al-Tahdhib, and others.

وإن زوج الرجل أمته رجلا، ثم وقع عليها، ضرب الحد (1).
وإن افتضت جارية جارية بيدها (2) فعليها المهر، وتضرب (3) الحد (4).
وإذا وقع الرجل على مكاتبته فإن كانت أدت الربع (5) ضرب الحد، وإن كان محصنا رجم، وإن لم تكن أدت شيئا فليس عليه شيء (6).
وإن زنى غلام صغير لم يدرك ابن عشر سنين بامرأة، جلد الغلام دون الحد، وتضرب المرأة الحد، وإن كانت محصنة لم ترجم، لأن الذي نكحها ليس بمدرك، ولو كان مدركا رجمت (7)، وكذلك إن زنى رجل بجارية لم تدرك، ضربت الجارية دون الحد، وضرب الرجل الحد تاما (8).

translation:
If a man marries his female slave to another man and then has intercourse with her himself, he is subject to the prescribed punishment (1). 

If a slave girl deflowers another slave girl with her hand (2), she owes a dowry and receives the prescribed punishment (3, 4). 

If a man has intercourse with his emancipated slave (mukatabah) and she has paid one-quarter (5) of the agreed price for her freedom, he is subject to the prescribed punishment, but if he is also married, he is stoned. If she has not paid anything towards her emancipation, no penalty applies to him (6). 

If a young boy under the age of ten commits adultery with a woman, the boy is flogged but not with the full punishment, while the woman receives the full punishment. If she is married, she is not stoned because the boy is not of age. If he were of age, she would be stoned (7). Similarly, if a man commits adultery with a minor girl, the girl is flogged but not with the full punishment, and the man receives the full punishment (8).

It is narrated that the Commander of the Faithful, Ali - peace be upon him - was presented with a case regarding a man who married off his slave girl to his own slave, and then [the text continues in historical references and Islamic legal implications].

text:
وطأها، فضربه الحد (1).
وإذا وجد (2) رجلان في لحاف واحد ضربا الحد مائة جلدة، [وإذا وجد امرأتان في لحاف واحد ضربتا مائة جلدة] (3) (4).
وضرب أمير المؤمنين - عليه السلام - رجلا تزوج امرأة في نفاسها قبل أن تطهر الحد (5).
وأتي رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - برجل كبير البطن عليل قد زنى، فأتى رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - بعرجون فيه مائة شمراخ (6)، فضربه ضربة (7) واحدة فكان (8) الحد، وكره أن يبطل حدا من حدود الله (9).
وقال أبو جعفر - عليه السلام -: لو أن رجلا أخذ حزمة من قضبان أو أصلا فيه

A man who commits adultery with her is subjected to the prescribed punishment (1). If two men are found under one blanket, they are each given the punishment of a hundred lashes. [If two women are found under one blanket, they each receive a hundred lashes as well] (3) (4).

The Commander of the Faithful - peace be upon him - imposed the punishment on a man who married a woman during her postpartum period before she had purified herself (5).

The Messenger of God - peace and blessings be upon him and his family - was approached with a man who had committed adultery, and he was heavyset and ill. The Messenger of God - peace and blessings be upon him and his family - was brought a branch with a hundred twigs (6), and he struck him once with it (7), which constituted the punishment, as he was reluctant to nullify any of God's prescribed punishments (9).

قضبان، فضربه ضربة واحدة أجزأه من عدة ما يريد أن يجلده عدة القضبان (1).
وقضى أمير المؤمنين - عليه السلام - في امرأة زنت فحبلت، فلما ولدت قتلت ولدها، فأمر بها (2) فجلدت مائة جلدة، ثم رجمت (3).
وقال - عليه السلام -: الإمام أحق من بدأ بالرجم (4).
وإذا تزوجت المرأة ولها زوج رجمت، وإن كان للذي تزوجها بينة على تزويجها (5)، وإلا ضرب الحد (6).
وقال أبو جعفر - عليه السلام -: المحصن يجلد مائة جلدة ويرجم، ومن لم يحصن يجلد مائة جلدة ولا ينفى، والذي قد أملك ولم يدخل بها يجلد مائة وينفى (7).

translation:
Metal rods: striking a person with a single blow suffices for multiple lashes that would otherwise be inflicted with a rod(1).

The Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, judged in the case of a woman who committed adultery and became pregnant. After she gave birth and then killed her child, he ordered her(2) to be lashed a hundred times and then stoned(3). 

He, peace be upon him, said, "The imam has more right than anyone to initiate the stoning"(4).

If a woman marries while already having a husband, she is to be stoned, even if the one who married her has evidence of the marriage(5); otherwise, the prescribed punishment is administered(6).

Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, said: an adulterer who is married is to be lashed a hundred times and then stoned, while an unmarried adulterer is to be lashed a hundred times but not exiled. A man who has contracted a marriage but has not consummated it is lashed a hundred times and exiled(7).

وإن أتى رجل امرأة فاحتملت ماءه فساحقت به امرأة فحملت، فان المرأة ترجم وتجلد الجارية الحد، ويلحق الولد بأبيه (1).
وإن تزوجت امرأة في عدتها، فان كانت في عدة طلاق لزوجها عليها فيها الرجعة رجمت، وإن كانت في عدة ليس لزوجها عليها فيها (2) رجعة ضربت الحد مائة جلدة، وإن كانت تزوجت في عدة من بعد موت زوجها من قبل انقضاء (3) الأربعة أشهر (4) والعشرة أيام فلا ترجم، وتجلد مائة جلدة (5).
ومن زنى بذات محرم يضرب ضربة بالسيف (أخذت منه ما أخذت،) (6) وهو إلى الإمام إذا رفعا إليه (7).
وإن غصب رجل امرأة (8) فرجها (9) قتل (محصنا كان أم غير محصن) (10) (11).

translation:
Certainly! Here is the translation of the provided Arabic text into English:

---

If a man approaches a woman and she becomes pregnant with his fluid, and then she engages in a lesbian act with another woman who becomes pregnant as a result, the woman is to be stoned, and the servant girl is to receive the punishment of lashes. The child is attributed to his father.

If a woman marries during her waiting period ('iddah), and if this waiting period is from a divorce in which her husband still has the right to take her back, she is to be stoned. If the waiting period is from a divorce in which her husband does not have the right to take her back, she is to receive the punishment of one hundred lashes. If she marries during the waiting period following the death of her husband before the completion of the four months and ten days, she is not to be stoned but is to receive one hundred lashes.

If someone commits adultery with a close relative, they are struck once with a sword, and what comes of it, comes of it, and it is up to the imam if they are brought before him.

If a man forcibly takes a woman's virginity, he is to be killed, whether he is married or not.

---

وإذا زنت المجنونة لم تحد (1)، وإذا زنى المجنون حد، [لأن المجنون يأتي وهي تؤتى] (2) (3).
وإن أوجب رجل على نفسه الحد، فلم يضرب حتى خولط وذهب عقله، فإن كان أوجب على نفسه الحد وهو صحيح لا علة به من ذهاب عقل، أقيم عليه الحد كائنا ما كان (4).
وإن زنى رجل في بلد وامرأته في بلد آخر، ضرب الحد مائة جلدة ولا (5) يرجم، وكذلك إذا كان معها في بلد وهو محبوس في سجن لا يقدر على الخروج إليها (6)، ولا تدخل هي عليه وزنى، عليه مائة جلدة لأنه بمنزلة الغائب (7).
وإن أخذت امرأة مع رجل قد فجر بها، فقالت المرأة: إستكرهني فإنه يدرأ (8) عنها الحد به (9)، لأنها قد أوقعت (10) شبهة (11).

translation:
If an insane woman commits adultery, she is not subjected to punishment, while an insane man who commits adultery is, [because the condition of the insane man is active, whereas that of the woman is passive]. 

If a man has deserved a punishment upon himself but was not subjected to it until he lost his sanity, the punishment is carried out on him as long as he declared it upon himself while fully sane and unaffected by any loss of sanity, regardless of his current state.

If a man commits adultery in one location while his wife is in another location, he is subjected to the punishment of one hundred lashes but not stoning. This also applies if he was with her in the same area but confined in prison without the ability to reach her, and she could not visit him. If he commits adultery, he receives one hundred lashes since he is considered as absent.

If a woman is caught with a man who has fornicated with her, and she claims that he coerced her, then the penalty is waived [from her] because she has created doubt about the situation.

These references and interpretations are documented in various Islamic legal texts including "Al-Kafi", "Al-Mustadrak", "Al-Faqih", and "Al-Tahdheeb", highlighting the varied interpretations across sources.

وقال أمير المؤمنين - عليه السلام -: إدرؤا (1) الحدود بالشبهات (2).
وإذا كانت تحت عبد حرة فأعتق، ثم زنى، فإن كان قد غشيها بعدما أعتق رجم، وإن لم يكن غشيها بعد ما أعتق ضرب الحد (3).
وإذا أتى رجل رجلا وهو محصن فعليه القتل، وإن لم يكن محصنا فعليه الحد، وعلى المأتي القتل على كل حال محصنا كان أو غير محصن (4).
وإذا أتى الرجل البهيمة فإنه يقام قائما، ثم يضرب ضربة بالسيف أخذ منه ما أخذ (5)، وروي عليه الحد (6).
وروى الحسن بن محبوب، أنه يجلد دون الحد، ويغرم قيمة البهيمة لصاحبها، لأنه أفسدها عليه، وتذبح وتحرق وتدفن إن كانت مما يؤكل لحمه (7)،

translation:
The Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, said: "Avert the legal punishments through doubts." 

If a free woman is married to a slave, and he is then emancipated and commits adultery, if he has had intercourse with her after his emancipation, he is to be stoned. If he has not had intercourse with her after his emancipation, he is to receive the prescribed punishment.

If a man engages in homosexual acts with another man and he is married (muhsan), he is to be executed; if he is not married, he is to receive the prescribed punishment. The one subjected to the act is to be executed regardless of whether he is married or not.

If a man has sexual relations with an animal, he is to be made to stand, and then struck with a sword, taking from him whatever it takes. It is narrated that he is subject to the prescribed punishment.

Al-Hasan ibn Muhabb (Hubb) reported that he is to be flogged less than the prescribed limit and must compensate the owner for the animal's value since he has ruined it. The animal is then to be slaughtered, burned, and buried if it is of a kind whose meat is normally consumed.

translation:
If it involves an animal that one rides, the perpetrator must compensate its value, receive a punishment short of the prescribed limit, and be expelled from the city where the act was committed to another location where they are unknown, to sell the animal there so they are not shamed by it.

If a man confesses to a crime meriting a punishment as severe as stoning, he will not be stoned but will instead receive a lesser punishment. The Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) ruled in the case of a man who confessed to a crime but did not specify which one, that he should be lashed up to eighty times. Afterward, he remarked that even if they had completed a hundred lashes, no further witness would have been sought beyond his own confession.

If a man commits adultery multiple times in one day with the same woman, he faces only one penalty. However, if he commits adultery with different women, he incurs a separate penalty for each woman.

It was narrated about a scenario involving a slave jointly owned by two men, when one of the owners freed his share. If the slave then committed a crime against God's laws, and the slave had been valued at the time of being half-freed, the owner who freed him should pay half the value. The half-free part of the slave receives half the penalty designated for a free person, and half for a slave, unless... (text is incomplete).

References for the rulings and hadith traditions are included in the original sources mentioned.

translation:
If a person belongs to a group, he is considered a servant and receives the punishment of a servant. If a man engages in intercourse with a woman who is partially his property, the punishment is reduced in proportion to his share in her, and he is punished for the remainder. If a man approaches his wife's female servant without her permission, he is subject to a punishment of one hundred lashes.

He is not subjected to stoning if he commits adultery with a Jewish, Christian, or a female slave. However, if he commits adultery with a free woman while he has a free woman as his wife, then he is liable for stoning. Just as a female slave, a Christian, or a Jewish woman does not grant him immunity against the punishment for adultery with a free woman, similarly, he is not subject to the punishment for a married person if he commits adultery with a Jewish, Christian, or slave woman while having a free wife.

If a male slave commits adultery with either a married or unmarried woman, he is lashed fifty times, and if he repeats the offense, he continues to be lashed fifty times until he commits adultery eight times, after which he is executed on the eighth offense. A free man who commits adultery with an unmarried woman is lashed one hundred times.

فان عاد ضرب مائة جلدة، فإن عاد الثالثة قتل (1).
وإذا غشى الرجل امرأته بعد انقضاء العدة جلد الحد، وإن غشيها قبل انقضاء العدة، كان غشيانه إياها رجعة لها (2).
وإذا شهد أربعة شهود على امرأة بالفجور أحدهم زوجها، جلدوا (3) الثلاثة، ولاعنها زوجها، وفرق بينهما، ولا تحل له أبدا (4).
[وإذا شهد أربعة عبيد على رجل بالزنا لم يجلد ولم يرجم، ولا أعرف على الشهود حدا] (5).

translation:
If a man returns to his crime, he is flogged with a hundred lashes. If he repeats the offense a third time, he is put to death (1).

If a man has intercourse with his wife after the waiting period has ended, he receives the prescribed flogging. If he does so before the waiting period has ended, his act of intercourse is considered as a return to her (2).

If four witnesses testify against a woman for immoral conduct, and one of them is her husband, the three are flogged, the husband invokes the curse, and they are separated permanently, with her becoming forbidden to him forever (4).

[If four slaves testify against a man for adultery, he is neither flogged nor stoned, and I do not know of any punishment for the witnesses] (5).

translation:
The Chapter on the Punishment for Slander and the Required Judgment in Such Cases

If a man accuses another man by saying to him, "O adulterer," he is subjected to the punishment of eighty lashes. Similarly, if he says to him, "O sodomite, you engage in sexual acts with men," he is punished with eighty lashes as well.

If a male slave accuses a free man, he is punished with eighty lashes.

Al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, said: There is no prescribed punishment for someone to whom the punishment is not applicable. For example, if a madman slanders a man, no punishment is due upon him. Likewise, if a man slanders him by saying, "O adulterer," no punishment is due upon the madman.

If a man says to his wife, "I did not find you a virgin," the punishment is not applied to him (2).
If a man accuses his wife of adultery, he must undertake the process of 'lāʿan' (mutual cursing), after which they are separated, and she is never permissible for him again. If a man accuses the son of the 'mumāni'a' (the accused woman) of adultery, he will receive the punishment of eighty lashes (5).
If a man accuses his wife, she does not have the right to forgive him [without honor or dignity] (6) (7).
[It has been narrated that she does have that right] (8).

وإن قذف قوما بكلمة واحدة فعليه حد واحد إذا لم يسمهم بأسمائهم (4)، وإن سماهم (5) فعليه لكل رجل سماه حد (6).

translation:
If a man accuses another man of slander and is whipped, then repeats the accusation, and says, "What I said about you is true," he will not be whipped. However, if he accuses him of adultery after being whipped, he will face a penalty. If he accused him with multiple accusations before being whipped, he will only receive one penalty.

If someone accuses a group of people with a single statement, he faces only one penalty, provided he does not mention specific names. If he mentions names, he faces a separate penalty for each person he named.

It is narrated regarding a man who accuses a group of people that if they present him individually, each person receives a separate penalty. However, if they present him collectively, he receives only one penalty.

translation:
Chapter 3: The Punishment for Theft

The Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, was asked about the minimum amount that necessitates the cutting of a thief's hand. He, peace be upon him, said: "A third of a dinar."

In another narration, it is stated: "The thief's hand is cut at a quarter of a dinar."

It is also reported that the thief's hand is cut at the value of five dinars or something equivalent to that.

Furthermore, there is a narration that says the thief's hand is cut for stealing "ten dirhams."

وكان أمير المؤمنين - عليه السلام - إذا سرق الرجل أولا قطع يده، فان عاد قطع رجله، فان عاد في الثالثة خلده السجن، وأنفق عليه من بيت المال (1).
وإذا دخل السارق دار رجل فجمع الثياب، فأخذ (2) في الدار ومعه المتاع، فقال (3): دفعه إلي رب الدار فليس عليه قطع، (فإذا أخرج المتاع) (4) من باب الدار فعليه القطع، أو يجيء بالمخرج منه (5).
وإذا أمر الإمام بقطع يمين السارق فتقطع (6) يساره بالغلط، فلا تقطع يمينه إذا قطعت يساره (7).
وإذا أخذ السارق مرة قطعت يده من وسط الكف، فان عاد قطعت رجله من وسط القدم، فإن عاد استودع السجن، فان سرق في السجن قتل (8).

translation:
Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, would first cut off the hand of a thief if he stole, and if he repeated the offense, he would cut off his leg. If he stole a third time, he would be imprisoned permanently, and his maintenance would be taken care of from the public treasury.

When a thief enters someone's house and gathers clothes but is caught inside with the goods, he may claim that the homeowner entrusted him with the items. In such cases, no amputation is performed. However, if he exits the house with the goods, his hand is amputated, unless he returns the items.

If the ruler orders the amputation of the thief's right hand but mistakenly the left hand is cut off, the right hand is not then amputated if the left has already been cut off in error.

If a thief is caught, his hand is cut off from the middle of the palm. If he offends again, his foot is cut off from the middle. If he steals yet again, he is imprisoned. If he steals while in prison, he is executed.

Sources referenced include different Islamic jurisprudence texts and interpretations which provide minor variations on these rulings.

text:
والصبي إذا سرق مرة (1) يعفى عنه، فان عاد قطعت أنامله أو حكت حتى تدمى، فإن عاد قطعت أصابعه، فان عاد قطع أسفل من ذلك (2).
فان سرق رجل فلم يقدر عليه، ثم سرق مرة أخرى، فجاءت البينة فشهدوا عليه بالسرقة الأولى والأخيرة، فإنه تقطع يده بالسرقة الأولى، ولا تقطع رجله بالسرقة الأخيرة، لأن الشهود شهدوا عليه جميعا في مقام واحد بالسرقة الأولى والأخيرة قبل أن تقطع يده بالسرقة الأولى، ولو أن الشهود شهدوا عليه بالسرقة الأولى ثم أمسكوا حتى تقطع يده، ثم شهدوا عليه (بعد بالسرقة) (3) الأخيرة، قطعت رجله اليسرى (4).
وقال: علي - عليه السلام - لا أقطع (5) في الدغارة المعلنة - وهي الخلسة - ولكن أعزره (6).
وليس على الذي يسلب الثياب قطع، وليس على الذي يطر (7) الدراهم من

translation:
When a boy steals for the first time, he is pardoned. If he steals again, his fingers are either cut or scratched until they bleed. If he repeats the act, his fingers are cut off. If he continues to steal, more severe measures are taken with him below the fingers.

If a man steals and is not caught, but then steals again, and witnesses testify against him for both the first and second thefts, his hand is cut off for the first theft. His foot is not cut off for the second theft because the witnesses gave their testimony for both thefts at the same time before his hand was cut for the first offense. However, if the witnesses testify only to the first theft and then wait until his hand is cut off before testifying about the second theft, then his left foot is cut off for the latter offense.

Ali, peace be upon him, said: "I do not enforce cutting for minor theft - which is stealing by stealth - but I punish the offender in other ways."

There is no hand cutting for those who steal clothing, nor for those who snatch coins from others.

text:
ثوب الرجل قطع (1).
وليس على الأجير ولا على الضيف قطع، لأنهما مؤتمنان (2).
وإن (3) وجد رجل ينبش قبرا فليس عليه قطع (4)، إلا أن يؤخذ (5) وقد نبش مرارا، فإذا كان كذلك قطعت يمينه (6).
والأشل إذا سرق قطعت يمينه على كل حال (7).
وضيف الضيف إذا سرق قطع، لأنه دخل دار الرجل بغير إذنه (8).

translation:
The man's garment is subject to amputation (1).

However, there is no amputation for the hired worker or the guest because they are entrusted (2).

And if (3) a man is found digging up a grave, there is no amputation (4), unless he is caught (5) having dug up multiple times. In this case, his right hand is to be amputated (6).

A person with a paralyzed limb who steals will have his right hand amputated regardless (7).

If a guest of a guest steals, amputation applies because he entered the man’s house without permission (8).

فإن أتى رجل رجلا وقال: أرسلني إليك فلان لترسل إليه بكذا وكذا، فدفع إليه ذلك الشيء، فلقي صاحبه فزعم أنه لم يرسله إليه ولا أتاه بشيء، وزعم الرسول أنه قد أرسله (إليه وقد دفعه) (1) إليه، فان وجد عليه بينة أنه لم يرسله قطعت يده، وإن لم يجد بينة فيمينه بالله ما أرسله، ويستوفي من الرسول المال، فان زعم أنه حمله على ذلك الحاجة قطع، لأنه قد سرق مال الرجل (2).
واعلم أنه لا يجب القطع إلا فيما يسرق من حرز (3) أو خفاء (4).
وليس على العبد إذا سرق من مال مولاه قطع (5).
والحر إذا أقر على نفسه لم يقطع، وإن (6) شهد عليه شاهدان قطع (7).

translation:
If a man comes to another man and says: "So-and-so has sent me to you to deliver such and such," and he gives him the item, but later encounters his friend who claims he did not send him and did not receive anything. The messenger claims he has indeed delivered it to him. If there is evidence that the friend did not send the messenger, the latter's hand should be cut off. If there is no evidence, the messenger must take an oath by God that he was not sent, and the money should be collected from him. If he claims necessity drove him to this act, then he should still be punished, as he stole the man's property.

It should be noted that amputation is only required for thefts from protected or concealed places. A slave is not liable to have his hand cut off if he steals from his master's property. A free man who confesses to theft is not punished unless two witnesses testify against him.

1 - "And gave it" is the corrected version.
2 - For further reference, see various sources like Al-Kafi, Al-Faqih, and others mentioned.
3 - "Protected": means a secure place.
4 - For additional context, consult Al-Kafi, Al-Faqih, and other texts cited.
5 - Similar references can be found in other texts.
6 - "And if" is another version.
7 - Different sources also discuss this rule, acknowledging that a free man who confesses once before the Imam is not punished unless corroborated by evidence.

والعبد إذا أبق من مواليه ثم سرق، لم يقطع وهو آبق، لأنه مرتد عن (1) الإسلام ولكن يدعى إلى الرجوع إلى مواليه والدخول في الإسلام، فإن أبى أن يرجع إلى مواليه، قطعت يده بالسرقة (2)، ثم قتل (3)، والمرتد إذا سرق بمنزلته (4).
وإذا أكل الرجل من بستان بقيمة ربع دينار أو أكثر، لم يكن عليه قطع ما لم يحمل منه شيئا (5).

translation:
When a slave absconds from their masters and then commits theft, they are not subjected to amputation while being a fugitive, as they are considered to have apostatized from Islam. However, they are invited to return to their masters and re-enter Islam. If they refuse to return to their masters, their hand is amputated for theft, and then they are executed. This also applies to an apostate who steals.

If a man consumes from an orchard goods worth a quarter of a dinar or more, he is not subject to amputation unless he takes something away with him.

text: ٤ [باب حد المحارب] وسئل أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام - عن قول الله عز وجل: ﴿إنما جزاء الذين يحاربون الله ورسوله ويسعون في الأرض فسادا أن يقتلوا أو يصلبوا أو تقطع أيديهم وأرجلهم من خلاف أو ينفوا من الأرض﴾ (1) قال: ذلك إلى الإمام، إن شاء قتل، وإن شاء صلب، وإن شاء نفى، قال: النفي إلى أين؟ قال: من مصر إلى مصر غيره، فان عليا - عليه السلام - نفى رجلين من الكوفة إلى البصرة (2).

translation:
**Chapter 4: The Punishment of the Highway Robber**

Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) was asked about the words of Almighty Allah: "The only reward of those who make war upon Allah and His Messenger and strive to cause corruption in the land is that they will be killed or crucified, or their hands and feet will be cut off on opposite sides, or they will be exiled from the land" (Al-Ma'idah 5:33). He said: That is up to the Imam. He may choose to kill, crucify, or exile them. He was asked: "Exile to where?" He replied: "From one city to another city, as Ali (peace be upon him) exiled two men from Kufa to Basra."

2. From him, Al-Wasa'il: Vol. 28, Page 308 - Chapter on the Punishment of the Highway Robber - Section 1, Hadith 3 and from Al-Kafi: Vol. 7, Page 245, Hadith 3, similar narration.

translation:
Chapter 5: On Drinking Alcohol, Singing, and the Legal Penalties and Rulings

Know that God, blessed and exalted be He, has explicitly forbidden alcohol itself, and the Messenger of God—peace and blessings be upon him and his family—has forbidden every intoxicating drink. He has also cursed the one who sells it, buys it, consumes its price, serves it, and drinks it.

Alcohol has five names: 'Asir, which is made from grapes; Naqi', which is made from raisins; Bat', which is made from honey; Mizr, which is made from barley; and Nabidh, which is made from dates.

translation: Know that wine is the key to all evil. Be aware that a person who drinks wine is like an idol worshiper. If one drinks it, their prayer is suspended for forty days; if they repent within those forty days, their repentance will not be accepted, and if they die during this period, they will enter the fire. Anything that intoxicates in large amounts is forbidden even in small amounts. Do not keep the company of a wine drinker, for when the curse descends, it encompasses everyone present in the gathering.

text:
ولا تأكل على مائدة يشرب عليها الخمر (1) (2).
ولا تصل في بيت فيه خمر محصور في آنية (3)، وقد روي فيه رخصة (4).
ولا بأس أن تصلي في ثوب أصابه خمر، لأن الله حرم شربها (ولم يحرم) (5) الصلاة في ثوب أصابته (6).
قال والدي - رحمه الله - في وصيته إلي: إعلم يا بني أن أصل الخمر من الكرم، إذا أصابته النار أو غلى من غير أن تصيبه النار فيصير أسفله أعلاه، فهو خمر لا يحل شربه، إلا (7) أن يذهب ثلثاه ويبقى ثلثه (8).

translation:
Do not eat at a table where wine is being consumed. Do not pray in a house that contains stored wine in vessels, although some leniency has been narrated in this matter. It is permissible to pray in clothing that has been touched by wine, because God has forbidden drinking it, but not praying in a garment that has been affected by it.

My father - may God have mercy on him - said in his will to me: "Know, my son, that the origin of wine is from the grapes; if it is exposed to fire or ferments without being exposed to fire causing its bottom to become its top, it becomes wine and it is not permissible to drink it, unless two-thirds evaporate, leaving one-third remaining."

text:
فان نش (1) من غير أن تصيبه النار، فدعه حتى يصير خلا من ذاته، من غير أن تلقي فيه (2) ملحا أو غيره حتى يتحول خلا (3).
وإن صب في الخل خمر لم يجز أكله حتى يعزل من ذلك الخمر (في إناء) (4) ويصبر حتى يصير خلا، فإذا صار خلا أكل ذلك الخل الذي صبت (5) فيه الخمر (6).
وإياك أن تزوج شارب الخمر (7)، فان زوجته فكأنما قدتها إلى الزنا (8)، ولا تصدقه إذا حدث، ولا تقبل شهادته، ولا تأتمنه على أمانة، فليس لك على الله ضمان (9).

translation:
If wine turns into vinegar without being exposed to fire, leave it until it naturally becomes vinegar by itself, without adding salt or anything else, until it transforms into vinegar. If wine is added to vinegar, it is not permissible to consume it until the wine is removed and left until it becomes vinegar. Once it turns into vinegar, then you may consume the vinegar to which the wine was initially added.

Do not marry someone who drinks wine; if you do, it is as if you are leading them into immorality. Do not believe them when they speak, do not accept their testimony, and do not trust them with a trust. You have no guarantee from God regarding them.

text:
وإذا شرب الرجل حسوة (1) من خمر جلد ثمانين جلدة (2).
وإن (3) أخذ شارب النبيذ ولم يسكر، لم يجلد حتى يرى أنه (4) سكران (5).
وإذا شرب الرجل مرة ضرب ثمانين جلدة، فان عاد جلد، فان عاد قتل (6).
وشارب الخمر إذا كان عبدا جلد (7) مرة، فان عاد جلد حتى يفعل ثماني مرات، ثم يقتل في الثامنة (8).
وإياك والغناء (9)، فإن الله توعد عليه النار (10).

translation:
If a man drinks a sip of wine, he is to be given eighty lashes. However, if someone who consumes nabidh (a fermented drink) is captured but not intoxicated, he will not be punished unless it is confirmed that he is drunk. If a person drinks once, he receives eighty lashes; if he repeats, he is lashed again; and if he persists, he is executed.

For a slave who drinks alcohol, he is lashed once; if he drinks again, he is whipped repeatedly up to eight times, and on the eighth occasion, he is executed.

Beware of singing, for God has warned of Hell for it.

text:
والصادق - عليه السلام - يقول: شر الأصوات الغناء (١).
وقال الله: ﴿واجتنبوا قول الزور﴾ (2) وهو الغناء (3).
وقال: (ومن الناس من يشتري لهو الحديث ليضل عن سبيل الله بغير علم ويتخذها هزوا أولئك لهم عذاب مهين (4)) ولهو الحديث في التفسير هو الغناء (5).

translation:
Al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, said: "The worst of voices is singing." (1)  
And Allah said: "And avoid false speech" (2), which refers to singing (3).  
He also said: "And among the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead others from the path of Allah without knowledge and takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment" (4); amusement of speech is interpreted as singing (5).

1. Refer to "Al-Wasa'il," 17/309 - Chapters on earnings, Section 99, Hadith 22, and "Al-Mustadrak," 13/204 within Hadith 16.  
2. Al-Hajj: 30.  
3. Refer to "Al-Mustadrak," 13/214 within Hadith 16. Also in "Al-Kafi," 6/431 Hadith 1, and page 435 Hadith 2, and "Al-Faqih," 4/41 under Hadith 7, similarly noted in both sources by "Al-Wasa'il," 17/303 - Chapters on earnings, Section 99 Hadith 2, 8, and 9.  
4. Luqman: 6.  
5. Refer to "Al-Mustadrak," 13/214 under Hadith 16. Also found in "Al-Kafi," 6/431 Hadith 4 and 5, and "Majma’ al-Bayan," 4/313 with a variance in wording, both referenced in "Al-Wasa'il," 17/304 - Chapters on earnings, Section 99 Hadith 6, and on page 305 Hadith 7, and page 310 Hadith 25.

text:
باب الملاهي إتق اللعب بالنرد، فان الصادق - عليه السلام - نهى عن ذلك (1).
إن مثل من يلعب بالنرد قمارا مثل من يأكل لحم الخنزير، ومثل من يلعب بها من غير قمار مثل الذي يضع يده في لحم الخنزير أو في دمه (2).
واعلم أن الشطرنج قد روي فيه نهي (3) وإطلاق (4)، ولكني رويت أن رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - قال: إذا ورد عليكم حديثان مختلفان، فاعرضوهما على كتاب الله، فما وافق

translation:
Chapter on Games of Amusement

Avoid playing with dice, for it is narrated that Al-Sadiq (peace be upon him) forbade it. Playing dice as gambling is likened to eating pork, and playing it without gambling is likened to placing one's hand in pork flesh or its blood. Be aware that chess has both prohibitions and permissions narrated, but I have related that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his family) said: "If two differing hadiths are presented to you, compare them to the Book of Allah; what agrees with it, adopt it."

It is also narrated in Al-Kafi: 6/437 Hadith 17, and Al-Faqih: 4/4 Early Hadith 1, except that in these it is mentioned that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his family) forbade it. text:
كتاب الله فخذوه، وما خالف كتاب الله فذروه (١)، فوجدنا الله يقول (في كتابه) (٢): ﴿فاجتنبوا الرجس من الأوثان واجتنبوا قول الزور﴾ (3) وفي التفسير (4) إن الرجس من الأوثان: الشطرنج، وقول الزور: الغناء (5).
فالصواب والاحتياط في ذلك نهي النفس عنه، واللعب به ذنب.
ولا تلعب بالصوالج (6)، فان الشيطان يركض معك، والملائكة تنفر عنك (7).
وروي أن من عثرت دابته فمات دخل النار (8).
واجتنب الملاهي كلها (9)، واللعب بالخواتيم، والأربعة عشر (10)، (وكل قمار) (11)، فان الصادقين - عليهم السلام - قد (12) نهوا عن ذلك أجمع (13) (14).

translation:
The Book of God, take it, and whatever contradicts the Book of God, leave it. We found that God says (in His Book): "So shun the abomination of idols and shun false speech." In the interpretation, it is mentioned that the abomination of idols refers to chess, and false speech refers to singing.

Thus, it is correct and prudent to abstain from such matters, as playing it is a sin. Do not play with sticks, for Satan runs with you, and angels turn away from you. It is narrated that if a person’s riding animal stumbled and they died, they would enter the Hellfire.

Avoid all amusements, playing with rings, and the "fourteen"—all forms of gambling—as the truthful ones, peace be upon them, have forbidden all of this.

Reference to the sources: Various books mention these narrations, each with slight variations, but the essence remains the same, reflecting guidance attributed to religious authorities like Imam Jafar al-Sadiq. These teachings emphasize avoiding activities deemed unworthy or sinful in the pursuit of a moral and upright life.

text:
باب العتق، والتدبير، والمكاتبة، والولاء، وغير ذلك إعلم أن من أعتق (1) مؤمنا أعتق الله بكل عضو منه عضوا من النار، وإن كانت أنثى أعتق الله بكل عضوين منها عضوا (2) من النار، لأن المرأة بنصف الرجل (3).
وإذا أعتقت فاكتب كتاب العتق كما كتب جعفر بن محمد - عليه السلام -: هذا ما أعتق جعفر بن محمد، أعتق (4) فلانا غلامه لوجه الله، لا يريد منه جزاء ولا شكورا، على أن يقيم الصلاة، ويؤتي الزكاة، ويحج البيت، ويصوم شهر رمضان، ويتولى أولياء الله، ويتبرأ من أعداء الله، شهد فلان وفلان وفلان ثلاثة (5).
وإن أعتق رجل مملوكه عند موته وعليه دين، وقيمة العبد ستمائة درهم

translation:
Chapter on Emancipation, Appointment of a Slave’s Freedom upon Death, Contractual Manumission, Allegiance, and Other Related Matters

Know that whoever frees a believing slave, Allah will free one of their limbs from the fire for every limb of the slave. And if the freed slave is a female, Allah will free two limbs of hers for every one limb of the male because the woman is counted as half of the man.

When you emancipate a slave, write the document of emancipation just as Ja'far bin Muhammad - peace be upon him - did: This is what Ja'far bin Muhammad emancipated, he freed (name), his slave, for the sake of Allah, seeking neither recompense nor gratitude, on the condition that he upholds prayer, gives alms, performs pilgrimage to the House, fasts the month of Ramadan, loves the friends of Allah, and disavows the enemies of Allah. Witnessed by so-and-so, so-and-so, and so-and-so.

If a man emancipates his slave upon his death while being indebted, and the value of the slave is six hundred dirhams...

ودينه خمسمائة، فإنه يباع العبد، فيأخذ الغرماء خمسمائة، وتأخذ الورثة مائة، فإن كانت (قيمة العبد) (1) ستمائة درهم ودينه أربعمائة درهم، فيأخذ الغرماء أربعمائة وتأخذ الورثة مائتين، ولا يكون للعبد شيء، فان كانت قيمة العبد ستمائة درهم ودينه ثلاثمائة درهم، واستوى مال الغرماء ومال الورثة، أو كان مال الورثة أكثر من مال الغرماء لم يتهم الرجل على وصيته، وأجيزت على (2) وجهها، ويوقف العبد فيكون نصفه للغرماء وثلثه للورثة، ويكون له السدس من نفسه (3).
وإن كان (4) ترك مملوكا بين نفر، فشهد أحدهم أن الميت أعتقه، فإن كان هذا الشاهد مرضيا لم يضمن، وجازت شهادته في نصيبه (5)، واستسعى (6) العبد فيما كان لغيره من الورثة (7).
وإذا كانت بين رجلين جارية، فأعتق أحدهما نصيبه، فقالت الجارية (للذي لم يعتق) (8): لا أريد أن تقومني، ذرني كما أنا أخدمك، وأراد الذي لم يعتق نصفه أن يستنكحها، فلا يجوز له أن يفعل ذلك، لأنه لا يكون للمرأة فرجان، ولا ينبغي له (9) أن يستخدمها، ولكن يقومها فيستسعيها (10).

translation:
If a person's debt is five hundred, then the slave is sold, and the creditors receive five hundred, while the heirs receive one hundred. If the (value of the slave) (1) is six hundred dirhams and the debt is four hundred dirhams, the creditors receive four hundred, and the heirs receive two hundred, leaving the slave with nothing. If the value of the slave is six hundred dirhams and the debt is three hundred dirhams, and the creditors' and heirs' shares are equal or the heirs' share is greater than the creditors', the man is not suspected of misrepresentation in his will, and it is executed as it is (2). The slave is thus appraised, with half assigned to the creditors and a third to the heirs, while he retains a sixth for himself (3).

If (4) a slave is left among a group of people and one of them testifies that the deceased emancipated him, if the witness is deemed credible, he is not held liable, and his testimony is valid concerning his share (5). The slave then works to pay off the portion owed to the other heirs (6).

When a female slave is jointly owned by two men, and one of them emancipates his share, and the slave states to the one who did not emancipate her (8), "Do not appraise me, leave me as I am and I will serve you," and the one who did not emancipate his half wishes to marry her, he is not permitted to do so, as a woman cannot have two husbands, nor should he employ her, but rather appraise her so she can earn her price (10).

text:
ومن كان شريكا (1) في عبد أو جارية فأعتق حصته وله سعة، فليشتر حصة صاحبه وليعتقه كله، وإن لم يكن له سعة في مال (2)، ينظر (3) إلى قيمة العبد كم كانت يوم أعتق نصفه، ثم يسعى (4) العبد في حساب ما بقي حتى يعتق كله (5).
واعلم أن (6) من أعتق رجلا سائبة (7) فليس عليه من جريرته (8) شيء ولا له (9) من ميراثه شيء، وليشهد على ذلك.
ومن تولى رجلا ورضي بذلك، فجريرته عليه وميراثه له (10) (11).
وقال النبي - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -: الولاء لمن أعتق (12).
وإذا اشترى رجل عبدا وله أولاد من امرأة حرة فأعتقه، فان ولاء ولده لمن أعتقه (13).

translation:
If a person shares ownership of a slave or servant and frees his portion of ownership while having the financial means, he should purchase his partner's share and free the entire slave. However, if he lacks the financial capacity, he should assess the value of the slave on the day he freed half of it, and then the slave must work to pay off the remaining share until he is fully emancipated.

Be aware that if someone emancipates a slave as a "sa'iba" (one who is freed without any remaining obligations to the emancipator, nor any inheritance rights), the emancipator bears no responsibility for the slave's offenses, nor is eligible for any inheritance from him. This should be witnessed.

However, if someone assumes the guardianship of a person and consents to it, he is responsible for their offenses and entitled to their inheritance.

The Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Allegiance (wala') belongs to the one who emancipates."

If a man buys a slave who has children with a free woman and then emancipates the slave, the allegiance of the children is owed to the emancipator.

text:
فإن قال رجل لغلامه: أعتقك على أن أزوجك جاريتي، فان نكحت عليها أو اشتريت (1) جارية (2) فعليك مائة دينار، وأعتقه على ذلك، فنكح أو اشترى (3)، فعليه (4) الشرط (5).
وإذا أعتق الرجل جاريته، وشرط عليها أن تخدمه خمس سنين، فأبقت ثم مات الرجل، فوجدها (6) ورثته، فليس لهم أن يستخدموها (7).
واعلم أنه لا عتق إلا ما أريد به وجه الله عز وجل (8).
وإذا كانت للرجل أمة فيقول (يوما: إن آتيها) (9) فهي حرة، ثم يبيعها من رجل، ثم يشتريها بعد ذلك، فلا بأس بأن (10) يأتيها، قد خرجت من ملكه (11).
فإن قال: أول مملوك أملكه فهو حر، فورث سبعة مماليك، فإنه يقرع بينهم

translation:
If a man says to his servant, "I emancipate you on the condition that I marry you to my maidservant. If you marry someone in addition to her or purchase another maidservant, you owe me one hundred dinars," and then emancipates him under those conditions, should he marry another or make such a purchase, he is bound by the stipulation.

If a man emancipates his maidservant and stipulates that she must serve him for five years, and she runs away and the man dies, and then his heirs find her, they do not have the right to use her services.

Be aware that an emancipation is only valid when done for the sake of Allah Almighty.

If a man owns a female slave and declares one day, "If I approach her, she is free," then sells her to another man and later repurchases her, there is no issue with him approaching her after that, for she has exited his ownership.

If he says, "The first slave I own shall be free," and then inherits seven slaves, he must draw lots among them.

text:
ويعتق الذي قرع (1).
فإن زوج أمته من رجل وشرط له، إن ما ولدت فهو حر، فطلقها زوجها أو مات عنها فزوجها (2) من رجل آخر (3)، فان منزلتهم منزلة الأم وهم عبيد، لأنه جعل ذلك للأول وهو في الآخر بالخيار، إن شاء أعتق وإن شاء أمسك (4).
وقال رسول الله - صلى الله على وآله وسلم -: لا طلاق قبل نكاح، ولا عتق قبل ملك (5).
فإن أعتق رجل عبده وله مال، فإن كان حين أعتقه علم أن له مالا تبعه ماله، وإلا فهو له (6)، وإن لم يعلم أن له مالا وأعتقه ومات، فماله لولد سيده (7).

translation:
And the person who strikes the bell is freed (1).

If a man marries his female slave to another man and stipulates that any child she bears will be free, and then her husband divorces her or dies, and he marries her (2) to another man (3), then their status is like that of the mother, and they are slaves, because he made this condition for the first husband, and regarding the second husband, he has the choice: if he wishes, he can free them, and if he wishes, he can keep them (4).

The Messenger of Allah - peace be upon him and his family - said: There is no divorce before marriage, and no emancipation before ownership (5).

If a man frees his slave who has wealth, and when he freed him, he knew about the wealth, then the wealth follows the slave; otherwise, it belongs to the master (6). If he did not know about the wealth and freed the slave and then died, the wealth belongs to the master's children (7).

[وروي: أن من اشترى مملوكا له مال، فإن كان اشترط ماله فهو له، وإن لم يشترط فهو للبائع (1)] (2).
واعلم أن المملوك إذا عمي فقد عتق (3).
ولا بأس ببيع المدبر (4) إذا كان على من دبره دين ورضي المملوك (5).
وإذا أعتق الرجل غلامه أو جاريته عن (6) (دبر منه) (7)، ثم يحتاج إلى ثمنه فليس له أن يبيعه، إلا أن يشترط على الذي يبيعه إياه أن يعتقه عند موته (8).
فإذا دبرت امرأة جارية لها، فولدت الجارية جارية (9) نفيسة، فان كانت الجارية (10) حبلى قبل التدبير ولم تذكر ما في بطنها، فالجارية مدبرة وما في بطنها رق، وإن كان التدبير قبل الحمل ثم حدث الحمل، فالولد مدبر مع أمه، لأن الحمل

translation:
Narrated: If someone buys a slave who possesses wealth, if the buyer stipulates the acquisition of the slave's wealth, then it belongs to the buyer. If no such stipulation is made, the wealth remains with the seller.

Be aware that if a slave goes blind, he is considered freed.

There is no objection to selling a "mudabbar" (a slave promised freedom after the owner's death) if the owner who promised the freedom is in debt, and the slave agrees.

If a man emancipates his male or female slave as a "mudabbar," and later needs the slave’s price, he cannot sell the slave unless he stipulates to the buyer that the slave be freed upon the buyer’s death.

If a woman designates her female slave as a "mudabbar" and the slave gives birth to a valuable female slave, then if the pregnancy occurred before the designation and the fetus was not mentioned, the first slave remains "mudabbar" while the fetus is a slave. However, if the designation occurred before the pregnancy and then the pregnancy happened, the child is also "mudabbar" along with her mother, because the pregnancy occurred during the period of designation.

حدث بعد التدبير (1).
واعلم أن المدبر (2) بمنزلة الوصية، وللرجل أن يرجع في وصيته متى شاء (3).
وروي: أن العبد والجارية إذا أعتقا عن دبر، فلمولاهما أن يكاتب العبد إن شاء، وليس له أن يبيعه قدر حياته، إلا أن يشاء العبد، وله أن يأخذ ماله إن كان له مال (4).
وسئل أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام - عن امرأة أعتقت ثلث جاريتها عند موتها، أعلى أهلها أن يكاتبوها إن شاؤوا أو أبوا؟ قال: لا، ولكن لها (5) ثلثها وللوارث ثلثاها (6)، يستخدمها بحساب ماله فيها، ويكون لها من نفسها بحساب ما عتق (7) منها (8).
وسئل عن الرجل يكون له الخادم فيقول: هي لفلان تخدمه ما (9) عاش، فإذا مات فهي حرة، فتأبق الأمة قبل أن يموت الرجل بخمس سنين أو ست سنين (10)، ثم يجدها (11) ورثته، ألهم أن يستخدموها بعد (12) ما أبقت؟ قال: لا، إذا مات

translation:
After the Arrangement

Know that the arrangement (tadbir) is akin to a will, and a man can revoke his will whenever he desires.

It is narrated that if a male or female servant is freed upon the owner’s death, the owner has the right to enter into a contract with the servant if he wishes, but he cannot sell the servant during his lifetime unless the servant wishes it. The owner also has the right to take the servant’s property if they have any.

Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, was asked about a woman who freed one-third of her female servant upon her death. Is it obligatory for her family to enter a contract with her, whether they wish to or not? He replied: No, but she owns one-third of her, and the heir owns the remaining two-thirds. The heir can utilize her services according to their share, and she has independence proportional to the part of her that is freed.

He was also asked about a man who has a servant and says, "She is for so-and-so to serve him as long as he lives, and when he dies, she is free." If the servant runs away five or six years before the man’s death, and then his heirs find her, are they entitled to use her after she has run away? He answered: No, if the man has died.

الرجل فقد عتقت (1) (2).
وإذا قال الرجل لعبده: إن حدث بي (3) حدث فأنت حر، وعلى الرجل تحرير رقبة في كفارة يمين أو ظهار، فلا يجوز الذي (4) جعل له في ذلك (5).
ولا بأس أن يطأ السيد المدبرة (6).
وإن كاتب رجل عبده، واشترط عليه إن عجز فهو رد في الرق، فله شرطه ينتظر بالمكاتب ثلاثة أنجم (7)، فان هو عجز رد رقيقا (8).
وروي إذا عجز عن مكاتبته فعلى الإمام أن يؤدي عنه من سهم الرقاب (9).
وإذا توفيت مكاتبة، وقد قضت عامة الذي عليها، وقد ولدت ولدا في مكاتبتها، فإنه يعتق منه مثل الذي عتق منها، ويسترق منه ما رق منها (10).

translation:
The man has emancipated.

If a man says to his slave, "If something should happen to me, you are free," and the man is required to free a slave as expiation for breaking an oath or performing zihar (a type of divorce), this stipulation cannot be invalidated.

It is permissible for a master to have marital relations with a slave woman designated to be freed after his death (madabbara).

If a man signs a contract of manumission with his slave and stipulates that if the slave fails to fulfill the conditions, he will revert to slavery, this stipulation is valid. The slave owner must wait for three terms (installments), and if the slave is unable to fulfill the contract, the slave will revert to slavery.

It is narrated that if the servant cannot fulfill the terms of their manumission contract, the leader (Imam) should pay off the debt on their behalf from the share reserved for freeing slaves (zakat allocation).

If a female slave who is under a manumission contract passes away, and she has fulfilled most of her obligations and given birth during this contract, then the portion of her child equivalent to what part of her was freed becomes free, while any part of the child that corresponds to any part of her that remains enslaved stays enslaved.

text:
وسئل أبو عبد الله - عليه السلام - عن قول الله تبارك وتعالى: ﴿وآتوهم من مال الله الذي آتاكم﴾ (١) قال:
الذي أضمرت أن تكاتبه عليه لا تقول: أكاتبه (٢) بخمسة آلاف وأترك ألفا له، ولكن أنظر الذي أضمرت عليه فاعطه منه (٣).
وروي في تفسير قول الله عز وجل: ﴿فكاتبوهم إن علمتم فيهم خيرا﴾ (4) إن علمتم لهم مالا (5).
وروي في تفسيرها: إذا (6) رأيتموهم يحبون آل محمد - صلى الله على وآله وسلم - فارفعوهم درجة (7).
والمكاتب (8) يجوز عليه (9) جميع ما شرطت عليه (10)، فلو أن رجلا كاتب مملوكا واشترط عليه أن لا يبرح إلا باذنه حتى يؤدي مكاتبته، لما جاز له أن يبرح إلا بإذنه (11).
وإن مات مكاتب وقد أدى بعض مكاتبته، وله ابن من جارية، وترك مالا

translation:
Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) was asked about the words of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted: "And give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you" (1). He said: What you have resolved to write for them, don’t say, “I will write for them for five thousand and leave a thousand for them,” but rather look at what you have resolved upon and give them from it (3).

It was narrated in the interpretation of Allah's words: "And if you find in them good, then write for them" (4) that if you find they possess wealth (5). Another interpretation states: If you see that they love the family of Muhammad (peace be upon him and his family), then raise them a degree (7).

A mukatab (8) is bound by all that has been stipulated upon him (10). If a man makes a contract with a slave and stipulates that he should not leave except with his permission until he fulfills his contract, then it is not permissible for the slave to leave without permission (11).

If a mukatab dies and has paid part of his contract, and he has a son from a bondmaid and has left behind wealth...

(فان ابنه) (1) يؤدي عنه ما بقي من مكاتبة أبيه، ويعتق ويرث ما بقي (2).
وإن كاتب رجل عبدا (3) على نفسه وماله وله أمة، وقد شرط عليه (أن لا يتزوج) (4)، فأعتق الأمة وتزوجها، فإنه لا يصلح أن يحدث في ماله إلا الأكل من الطعام، ونكاحه فاسد مردود، وإن كان سيده علم بنكاحه وصمت ولم يقل شيئا فقد أقر، فإن عتق المكاتب قد مضى على النكاح الأول (5).
واعلم أن الرجل لا يملك أبويه، ولا ولده، ولا أخته، ولا ابنة أخته، ولا عمته، ولا خالته، ويملك ابن أخيه، وعمه، وخاله، ويملك أخاه من الرضاعة، ولا يملك أمه من الرضاعة، وما يحرم من النسب فإنه يحرم من الرضاع، ولا يملك من النساء ذات محرم، ويملك الذكور ما خلا الوالد والولد (6).

translation:
If a man's son settles the remainder of his father's slavery contract, he (the slave) is freed and inherits what remains. If a man enters into a contract with his slave for freedom, including an agreement regarding his property, and the slave owns a female slave with a condition against marriage, then frees her and marries her, the marriage is invalidated and rejected. However, if the master knows of the marriage, remains silent, and says nothing, it implies consent, and if the contractual obligations for freedom were fulfilled, the initial marriage stands.

It is important to know that a person cannot own their parents, children, sister, niece, paternal aunt, or maternal aunt. However, they may own their nephew, paternal uncle, maternal uncle, and brother through nursing, but not their nursing mother. What is prohibited by blood relation is also prohibited by nursing. One cannot own a woman who is a close relative, but may own males except for their father or son.
